story:
What is Creative Colloquy

Our mission is to share the South Sound's rich literary talent as well as to foster relationships built upon mutual admiration of the written word.

Creative Colloquy is a submission based literary site with a focus on Tacoma and South Sound scribes paying special attention to writers of short stories, essays, and excerpts of novels.

“Colloquy” by definition means to pow-wow, or to open up a dialogue. Monthly reading/open mic events play an instrumental part of that. Created in February 2014, Creative Colloquy was born from the desire to create a platform for writers to share their work and build relationships with those of like minds. Writing is typically something done as an isolated individual but connecting with those who understand the process can be inspiring and necessary to the creative process.

What We Need & What You Get

We here at Creative Colloquy want to evolve into a physical twice yearly review (while continuing our bi-weekly online posts.) Pages in your hands! The problem is paper costs money. That is where you come in. Your monetary contribution will help us put together our review full of work by local literary talent. Specifically the funds will be used as such:

  • Cover design, visual direction (commercial), etc. We've constructed a team of fabulous creative individuals. A portion of the funds raised will go to monetarily compensate these people for their efforts.
  • Podcast fees. They're minute, but as starving artists every bit helps. We'd like to deliver bookish discussion, reviews and readings via a regular podcast.
  • Advertising. We want to share the South Sound talent with the world. To get people to notice we will need to be able to spread the word.
  • Maintaining the website.
  • Most importantly, Creative Colloquy Volume 1. These pages will be filled with a combination of our very favorites featured online as well as some new stories created exclusively for CC! 

    We will thank our supporters in a number of ways, all of which you can find in our perks section. Sweet CC swag like buttons, mugs, and tees. For contributors on the higher tiers we offer ad space (online and in our publication) and of course all of you get our eternal gratitude.

    Follow us on Facebook to spy previews of our swag as they are created!

    What Folks Are Saying

    "I had a fantastic time emceeing Creative Colloquy's first  'YA fiction' open mic night. We Puget Sounders are lucky to live in an area rich in art and literature, and there's nothing so inspiring as being surrounded by other creators. Creative Colloquy offers us a wonderful opportunity to be a part of this community, share our work, and support our peers." ~New York Times Best Selling Author, Marissa Meyer

    "What I appreciate about CC is the creative community aspect. Writing is by nature a solitary task and often offers little or no external validation. Like a plant that needs water, nutrients, and sunshine to grow, writing is missing a key part of the growth cycle when it does not have an audience. CC does that. It provides a nourishing environment for the various word gardens being cultivated around town to sprout their harvest. The frequent schedule of publishing gives everyone plenty of opportunity to see works in print and the events are wonderful ways to encourage and encounter other writers." ~Titus Burley

    "I have been heartened by the immediate community brought to light by CC. I had assumed that there had to be a community of writers in such an arts rich city, but I didn't know how to access them until now." ~Lory French

    "It is first and foremost a celebration of passion rather than talent and when a writer is surrounded by that type of community, whether they are experienced or picking up a pen for the first time, they will always produce their best work." ~William Turbyfill

    "The reinforcement of the opportunity to share creations within a group of like minded individuals is all the inspiration we need to share our values and be valued. Shorter? The sharing is awesome!" ~Craig Rounds

story:
The truth is . . . I'm on a mission.  My mission started about 4 years ago after realizing that I had been listening to every word "society" had taught me over the previous 32 years. 

I'm not good enough.

"Society" could include parents, friends, teachers, church community, magazines, television, etc.  Society is everything around us and the messages that are coming to us is that we need to look or act a certain way and have certain things in order to be "good enough". 

The truth is the fact that I was BORN is enough.  The fact that I made it into this world means that I have a REASON for being here.  I've been given this gift of life and so have you.

My mission is to spread the message that society has it all wrong.  Fortunately, the message is starting to shift and there are great people doing great things to spread the message - that you are great!  Unfortunately, society (typically) has more money and more ad power and is therefore, ultimately sharing a message that we can't live up to.

That's why I'm coming to you!  I believe that you understand the pressures what it's like to grow up feeling like you aren't good enough:

  • no matter how much weight you lose, you still feel fat
  • you don't have the "right" clothes or the "right" friends
  • you look at yourself in the mirror and hate the face you see
  • secretly you feel so much pressure to fit in, and instead don't belong
  • you might feel obligated to give up your dream so you can be "normal"
  • whatever you do, you can't seem to do it well enough
  • add in your own ways you've felt "not good enough"


What I've found over the past 4 years as a coach is that teens that feel these things grow up to be adults that still feel like they're not good enough but have learned how to "cover it up". 

A girl (Me) on a mission to share the message (You = Gift).

Campaign basics...

You're asking the question, "So what is it exactly that I'm supporting?"  When you support me and this campaign, you'll be supporting the publishing of an amazing book with amazing resources. 

The writing, creating, and publishing of this book shall not rest on society deeming it worthy.  Instead, I'm saying forget about society and let's get this message out -- NOW!!

About Jen...

If you ask me the short version - I am a motivational speaker for the youth industry (especially young women).  Why?  Simple.  Society has taught us that we need to be a certain way, look a certain way, act a certain way, etc. in order to be good enough.  Most of a look for a reason in order to be good enough.  Most of us aren't taught that the fact that we are here IS enough.  I'm tired of what society is teaching and I'm sharing my voice (through speaking AND writing this book) with others so they can step into the life they are meant for.  And, it's meant for all of us, not just some of us!

Why Jen?

In The Beginning

May 7, 2009 - A day that I will forever remember.  For the first time in my life I was told, "You are born into greatness.  The fact that you are here is enough." 

I Always Knew

I remember when I was younger I was always searching and wondering what it is I'm meant to do.  I remember knowing as a young girl that I had a purpose.  I was meant for something wonderful.  I also remember searching and seeking, never to find what this "thing" was.

I always knew that I was meant to HELP OTHERS, I just didn't know how.

When I was 32 years old, my life started to change.  That day, back in May of 2009, when I was told I was enough, I finally started believing it.  Unlike the perception, I haven't always felt confident and comfortable in my own skin.  For 32 years I held tightly to knowing "I'm not good enough, people don't like me, so why even bother."

The truth is that . . . I am amazing.

And so are YOU!

I was in some of my darkest times as a teen and in my early 20's.  I know what it's like to be scared and uncertain, confused and overwhelmed.

Why This Campaign?

Simple answer:  I broke a board.

Not-so-simple answer:  Friday, July 17, 2009 - the second day I will forever remember.  I remember knowing that if MY board broke, life would change.  I also remember knowing that it didn't matter because MY board would NEVER break.  Oh how I wanted to believe that I was enough. 

The little girl inside of me KNEW that I was enough.  In fact, she had known all along.

Me, my "adult self" had let go of this knowing.  You see, we come into this life with an awe, an understanding, a recognition that we have a gift to offer the world.  And then somewhere along our journey, typically as teenagers, that understanding and recognition goes away and is replaced by society and the judgments that come along with it.  Now, in this moment I was back to wanting to believe it, but didn't know how.  The board was my symbol.  IF it broke, I KNEW my life would change.

It took three tries.

My board broke.

Over the next 2 days I had grasped that if I had felt this way my entire adult life and possibly longer, then it's likely that others also feel this way.

So, I did what everyone does at this point and I created an experiment.  I gave myself 3 months to shift my perspective, change my thinking, and watch my new life unfold.  If it changed, I'd drop everything I was doing, let go of my career, quit my job, and start a business supporting others.

Can you guess what happened?

Why Now?

After 4 years of my grass roots efforts and spreading the message, it's time to take it further. 

This campaign is important because the message is still missing from everyday conversation.  This campaign is important because everywhere I go, when I share these words people are still shocked to think they could be true for them.  This campaign is important for the hundreds of thousands that still don't realize they are a gift and that they've been uniquely designed and divinely created for something spectacular!!

The question isn't whether or not you'll have an impact.  The question is what kind of an impact will you have? 

Ask yourself that question and then please, choose to join me on this mission.  We've been given one amazing life - this isn't a practice run.  This is it.  Help me spread the message that your life is your gift and we need to stand up and CHOOSE to live!

Ultimately, in the end, of course I hope you are able to financially support this mission.  However, if you aren't, I'd still love to hear from you.  Please share this with others, reach out, connect with me, comment below, send a pony express.  I absolutely LOVE connecting with others and look forward to hearing from you too!

Make a Difference . . . Lead with Love
Jen xoxo

P.S. (Can I have a post script in a campaign? - Yes, since I'm making my rules!)

If you care to hear (duh, that means read) from some lives that have already been touched by my words, keep reading . . .

“This type of message (of worth and value, knowing you are a Gift) is important for everyone to hear. It is amazing to see the looks on the girls’ faces when it all starts to make sense. I always feel refreshed and inspired when I leave Jennifer's presentation.” ~ Holly

“Jen was PERFECT.In the beginning Jen said that she believed she was meant to do this, and I am 100% positive that she is on this Earth to help everyday girls get through this crazy life with a smile on their face.” ~ Courtney

“After just one conversation with Jennifer I felt an extra lightness in my heart and peace in my mind.  It was a conversation I really wanted to have for a long time.  Jennifer was absolutely perfect in her words, direction and insights.  She is a gift to others!” ~ Margery

“Jennifer was my first presenter in my company’s “Live Your Best Life” series and let’s just say she’s been a hard one to follow…I would highly recommend Jennifer for any speaking engagement” ~ Katy

You've Made It This Far

First, I want to start by thanking you for taking time to learn more about me, my journey, and this campaign.   I'm so grateful and appreciative! 

Second, I want my perks to be beneficial for you.  If you would like to donate, but the perks don't seem to match your desires, please reach out and connect with me.  I want them to make sense for you and I'm confident we can find something that will work!

Third and lastly, thank you again.  Thanking you is one of the most important things to me (second only to the desire that you know you're amazing!).  I am truly humbled and grateful to be on this journey and having you join me!

What risks and challenges might I run into?

The biggest challenge will be coordinating the personal call/skype conferencing along with travel plans for personal delivery, presentation/speaking engagements. However, with that being said, since I always lead my life with love, and since you're joining me, I'm guessing you want to as well, we'll definitely find a way to make it work!

Additionally, I'm a very open, candid, and vulnerably sharing person...so, you'll be in on every step of this journey. I'm excited to share with you - good, bad, or indifferent!

story:
Gender Bending Greetings on behalf of the
Transnational Feminist Union in Mexico! 

   

     

  • We are enthused to announce our Feminist Drive campaign in the founding year of our emerging feminist labor organization, The Transnational Feminist Union, uniting anti-sexist capital to cover some of the utmost crucial costs of deconstruing patriarchy & systemic violence in 2015. #TransFemmeDrive!
      The vision of united transnational feminist labor is "rooted from our concrete reality & simultaneously imagines possibilities beyond this reality. It is a radical dream of revolutionary political mass movement that in its reformist stage grants women civil rights within the existing imperialist, white supremacist, capitalist, patriarchal system while simultaneously working to undermine and overthrow that system. The feminist dream of replacing the culture of domination with a world of participatory economics grounded in communalism & social democracy, a world without discrimination based on race or gender, a world where recognition of mutuality & interdependency can be the dominant ethos, a global ecological vision of how the planet can survive & how everyone on it can have access to peace & well-being"      ~ bell hooks, Feminism is For Everybody #VisionaryFeminism

           
    Liberally, our mission is to unite & expand feminist work & research in all sectors of the economy, culture & political structures from a transnational, eco-working class approach. Some of our core central goals include gender inclusive domestic labor policy remunerations, reaching economic settlements for current unpaid domestic labor, fair wages for house work & backpay for our mothers, grandmothers & all our ancestral unpaid domestic labor. Integrate women & gender studies in public school curricula & amongst grassroots coalitions. Implement transnational gender justice programs, prioritizing the needs of the most vulnerable in our global community, cultivate autonomous eco-feminism & advocate for the worldwide decriminalization of reproductive justice, including for our universal right to choose abortion. Contest the mainstream racist & rape culture media, forming feminist think tanks, town hall conferences & promulgating alternative online feminist media content. As well as continue to embolden & develop inclusive grassroots awareness campaigns & networks to end DV, incest & child abuse worldwide through preventative, community based solutions that educate for healthy interpersonal relationships across generations & connect the community with feminist resources or services available. Apply, radiate, advance & innovate transnational feminist grassroots research, media, community education, resources, services & libratory praxis. #RestorativeJustice #ReproductiveJustice
    UNION TRANSNACIONAL FEMINISTA, TRANSNATIONAL FEMINIST UNION, 2015 FOUNDING YEAR AGENDA: Our agenda is shaping up as follows yet unless specified otherwise this, as all Union publications, is a working draft.
    *     Establish location of the Los Angeles development local; move to new office local.
    * Publish work in process,  #BlackLivesMatter #WeGotYouSis
      "The Intersectionality of State Sanctioned Police Brutality & Domestic
    Violence"
     *Solidify Union Council Mission & Vision, Demands & Agenda  (2015-2016)
    Whereas Worldwide:
      - Every year 60 million girls are sexually assaulted at or on their way to school.
      - 1-3 women have been beaten or sexually abused in their lifetime.
     - At least 60 million girls are missing form their populations- mostly in Asia as   
        a  result of infanticide or sex related abortion.
      - Women and Girls are 80% of 640,000 of the estimated 800,000 trafficked
        across national borders annually with the majority 505,600 being trafficked    
        for sexual exploitation.
      - In some parts of the world girls are more likely to be raped than to learn 
        how to read. 
      - Over 60 million girls worldwide are child brides, 31.3 million in S Africa.
        Violence  & abuse characterize married life for most of these girls.
      - Boys who witness their fathers violence are 10 times more likely to engage in 
        spousal abuse in later adulthood.
      - Up to 5% of women report being physically abused while pregnant, 50% of 
        physically abused Indian women reported being abused while pregnant
      - Between 100 & 140 millions girls alive today have been subjected to Female 
        Genital Mutilation. In 6 African countries 80% of women have been subjected
        to this torture. (United Nations Statistics) 

A womanist/feminist transnational mass movement is vital, we must all act NOW, Men, Women, all Genders, Sexes, ages, ethnicities, religions, identities together to shift the violence of imperialist, white-supremacist, capitalist, hetero- normative-patriarchy, moreover, architect a safe, anti-sexist, healthy future for all our children humns & our earth. Centering the needs of the most impacted, empowering everyday survivors at the intersections of discrimination, violence, oppression & exploitation, trans woc, queer woc, female youth of, & generally woc.
  If you support our mission, join our councilship, participate in fortifying its democratic impact by reflecting & editing your insights into a separate living mission & vision declaration we can later consolidate to produce one final council collective mission & vision document (2,000wrds).
UNITE IN UN & GRASSROOTS EFFORTS TO END VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN GLOBALLY!
* Help us implement Gender Studies in Public School Curricula from Pre-K to 
  High-School exemplified & being taught by pedagogues in La Paz, Baja California 
  S, Mexico since, 2008. #TransFemDrive
         "Nuestro Norte y Nuestro Sur, puntos extremos en la geografía, el horror de la 
                       violencia y la explotación, en la discriminación étnica y de género, pero 
            también extremos que se tocan… en la dignidad, en las demandas de justicia, 
                     en la resistencia.” ~ Marisa Belausteguigoitia y Lucia Melgar, Equidad de 
                                                                       Genero y Prevencion d Violencia en Secundaria
       " Our North & Our South, points at extreme ends in our geography, the horror of
                   the violence & the exploitation, in ethnic discrimination & gender but also 
                    extremes that touch... in dignity, in the demands of justice, in resistance."
                                                ~ Marisa Belausteguigoitia y Lucia Melgar, Gender Equity &
                                                                                          Violence prevention in Middle School  

                                                                 

* Publish Union Transnacional Feminista, founding & seasonal newsletters. 
* Promote & architect Eco-working-class jobs & feminist polluter pays policies. 
“To fight climate change we have to fight inequality within our countries & between them. There is a finite carbon budget, there is a right to exit poverty, to address the unequal exchanges that were built between our nations by fossil fuels, super powered by fossil fuels in the early days, in the burning of coal & Esperanza is going to lay out a vision of how  we must & can heal the wounds of colonialism & turn the world right side up. In our own countries we will not stop this fossil fuel frenzy unless indigenous people, people of color & low income communities have real options & are not being asked to choose between poverty & pollution." 
                               ~ Naomi Klein, This Changes Everything: Capitalism vs. The Climate



              
* Edify of the pivotal time we have to reverse & avoid further catastrophic impacts
  of climate change, both on the faith of our ecology & on the lives of millions 
  already facing greater risks in communities impoverished by toxic market 
  capitalism & modern imperialism. Work to detoxify, balance & transform our
  global food system so that it meets optimal nutritional needs for all peoples.
  Support local farmers & cultivate community based organic nutrition & renewable 
  energy projects including sowing awareness of Moringa Oleifera, this self-seeding
  tree, contains more nutritional properties for the human body than any vegetable
  on the planet today, is preventative to hundreds of chronic diseases, including

social democracy, a world without discrimination based on race or 
gender, a world where recognition of mutuality & interdependency can

story:
"Laser, quick, go around through the other rooms and come back down the hall towards me. If there is something there you will push it right to me."

 

"By myself?"

 

"Of course!  Don't worry, I am right here, you can do it." Encouraged Doodlebug.

 

"Okay... I guess I can do it..."

 

Laser crept out of the hall, barely breathing and listening for any tiny sound with his sensitive ears.  Each step he took meant going further out of sight of his sister and further into the darkness. Every inch of his body was tense and waiting for something to jump out at him.  He felt like a helpless little gazelle walking through a lion’s den.  He was sure his pounding heart was loud enough to wake those lions and cause them to attack... except these weren't real lions, these weren't even... alive.

 

Thu-thump, thu-thump, no matter how careful he was to walk as quiet as possible... his steps seemed so loud that they echoed through the empty room.  Or was it empty?  Laser froze.  Did something in the corner of the room just move?  He drew in a slow, quivering, breath as he kept his eyes fixed on that corner. Nothing; must have been his imagination.  He took a few more steps, towards a door that separated two rooms.  On the far end of the second room was another door that opened back out into the hall at the opposite end from Doodlebug.  If anything was haunting this basement then hopefully Laser would push it back towards Doodlebug, or Bugs as he called her.  Just one more room beyond this door and he would be at the far end of the hall from his sister, able to see her again; feel safe again.  She is always so brave; he wished he could be more like her.

 

Ahead the next stretch through the second room was going to be tough, "How does she always talk me into doing these things?" he thought to himself realizing that this wasn't the first time, and it wouldn't be the last that he would find himself creeping through the dark all by himself.  Not just place in the dark... a haunted place in the dark.

 

He paused in the doorway to the neighboring room steeling himself for enough courage to get through these last few yards of darkness.  A much darker and ominous stretch between him and the safety of the hallway, "I can creep through here and slowly and take more time, or I can go through with determination and get to that hallway faster" he weighed out his options.  It didn't take long to decide that the latter, go with determination, was the answer.

 

He doubled his speed and stopped caring about walking quietly.

 

"What was that?" He said out loud to the air.  He could have sworn he heard a noise to his left, but he couldn't see anything. Just a few more steps to the hallway…  Laser lowered his head and soldiered through until he could see the warm red glow of his sisters’ flashlight hanging around her neck.  The red light helped keep their eyes adjusted to the dark.

 

Short Summary

My name is Mari Chastain.  I have always been in love with the mystery of the paranormal since I was a child. I remember bringing book after book about “true stories of hauntings” home from my elementary school library and scaring myself so badly that I would lay in bed and shiver myself to sleep. My mother quickly forbade me from bringing any of those books home, so I resorted to reading them in the library during every free minute I had… until I actually ran out (what can I say, it was a small elementary school library)! As a child I would never just walk up to my bed, but take a flying leap from the edge of the room onto my bed so that the monsters and ghouls under my bed couldn't grab my ankles. This was only a relevant exercise at night, mind you; I was monster and ghoul immune during the day. I also practiced the ritual of making sure all stuffed animals were under the covers with me, if they were on top of the covers the ghosts could scare them and steal them. If they were under the covers somehow they could protect me from ghosts. I fell into ghost hunting in late 2008. Once I dove down the paranormal rabbit hole I was hooked! I have not looked back and the paranormal has been my passion ever since.

Several years ago I had gotten the idea to write children’s stories that I could send to my niece, Ady. A little something we could share as we live on opposite sides of the country. She fell in love with Doodlebug and Laser when she met them, and the idea of mixing her little friends with my passion was hatched. The original story and additional ideas for further stories kept growing in my mind. I guess they just ran out of room up there because one day, I just started writing, and didn't stop until the first book was 3/4 finished! Upon completing the first book I read what I had put onto paper and I liked it. I felt that it was time to see what I could do with self publishing.

That brings me to indiegogo.com, a wonderful tool to help me launch this project. I hope you are interested in this project, and most of all, I hope my stories bring you and your loved ones joy!

About my project:

Doodlebug and Laser; Ghost Hunters is a line of children’s books. They are designed to entertain as well as teach children that not everything that “goes bump in the night” is harmful or scary.

 
Doodlebug and Laser live in a close knit community, and help their fellow neighbors (human and furry alike) whenever they think there may be a haunting. Doodlebug is fearless and dives right in to every mystery, while Laser is apprehensive and deals with dark spooky places scaring him. In real life Laser has Lupus, so I have chosen to integrate that into the stories as well.  
 
For the most part, they might just save the day or learn a valuable lesson, but you never know… they may just run into something they can’t explain here and there!
 
Thank You,
Mari Chastain

What We Need & What You Get

For my project I have extrapolated the costs to launch this endeavor:

- Publishing services (self publishing to save on costs) and set up fees.

- Publishing books for sale at Phenomenology 105 and other conferences.  This cost will vary based on the number of illustrations myself and Howie agree on.

- Banners and Marketing materials
 
- Illustrations, I am getting quotes from:
  • Howie Noel - www.hcnoel.com
  • John Opal - www.opalgallery.com
  • G Patrick Teran - www.gpatrickteran.com
 

I am hoping indiegogo.com can help me with the initial investment for this project, but my intention is for the sales of this first book to fund the publishing of subsequent books.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not all of us can afford to support projects... that is why I am bringing my project to indiegogo.com!  If you cannot support monetarily, I would love your support in spirit and networking.  Please go to my facebook group page and like us.  Also, share with your friends whenever you can!  Maybe one day you can buy some book for yourself, or as gifts to help spread the word.

https://www.facebook.com/DoodlebugandLaserGhostHunters

Thank You!!

Ahead the next stretch through the second room was going to be tough, "How does she always talk me into doing these things?" he thought to himself realizing that this wasn't the first time, and it wouldn't be the last that he would find himself creeping through the dark all by himself.  Not just place in the dark... a haunted place in the dark.
 
He paused in the doorway to the neighboring room steeling himself for enough courage to get through these last few yards of darkness.  A much darker and ominous stretch between him and the safety of the hallway, "I can creep through here and slowly and take more time, or I can go through with determination and get to that hallway faster" he weighed out his options.  It didn't take long to decide that the latter, go with determination, was the answer.
 
He doubled his speed and stopped caring about walking quietly.
 
"What was that?" He said out loud to the air.  He could have sworn he heard a noise to his left, but he couldn't see anything. Just a few more steps to the hallway…  Laser lowered his head and soldiered through until he could see the warm red glow of his sisters’ flashlight hanging around her neck.  The red light helped keep their eyes adjusted to the dark.
 
Short Summary
My name is Mari Chastain.  I have always been in love with the mystery of the paranormal since I was a child. I remember bringing book after book about “true stories of hauntings” home from my elementary school library and scaring myself so badly that I would lay in bed and shiver myself to sleep. My mother quickly forbade me from bringing any of those books home, so I resorted to reading them in the library during every free minute I had… until I actually ran out (what can I say, it was a small elementary school library)! As a child I would never just walk up to my bed, but take a flying leap from the edge of the room onto my bed so that the monsters and ghouls under my bed couldn't grab my ankles. This was only a relevant exercise at night, mind you; I was monster and ghoul immune during the day. I also practiced the ritual of making sure all stuffed animals were under the covers with me, if they were on top of the covers the ghosts could scare them and steal them. If they were under the covers somehow they could protect me from ghosts. I fell into ghost hunting in late 2008. Once I dove down the paranormal rabbit hole I was hooked! I have not looked back and the paranormal has been my passion ever since.
Several years ago I had gotten the idea to write children’s stories that I could send to my niece, Ady. A little something we could share as we live on opposite sides of the country. She fell in love with Doodlebug and Laser when she met them, and the idea of mixing her little friends with my passion was hatched. The original story and additional ideas for further stories kept growing in my mind. I guess they just ran out of room up there because one day, I just started writing, and didn't stop until the first book was 3/4 finished! Upon completing the first book I read what I had put onto paper and I liked it. I felt that it was time to see what I could do with self publishing.
That brings me to indiegogo.com, a wonderful tool to help me launch this project. I hope you are interested in this project, and most of all, I hope my stories bring you and your loved ones joy!
About my project:
Doodlebug and Laser; Ghost Hunters is a line of children’s books. They are designed to entertain as well as teach children that not everything that “goes bump in the night” is harmful or scary.
 
Doodlebug and Laser live in a close knit community, and help their fellow neighbors (human and furry alike) whenever they think there may be a haunting. Doodlebug is fearless and dives right in to every mystery, while Laser is apprehensive and deals with dark spooky places scaring him. In real life Laser has Lupus, so I have chosen to integrate that into the stories as well.  
 
For the most part, they might just save the day or learn a valuable lesson, but you never know… they may just run into something they can’t explain here and there!
 
Thank You,
Mari Chastain


What We Need & What You Get
For my project I have extrapolated the costs to launch this endeavor:
- Publishing services (self publishing to save on costs) and set up fees.
- Publishing books for sale at Phenomenology 105 and other conferences.  This cost will vary based on the number of illustrations myself and Howie agree on.
- Banners and Marketing materials
 
- Illustrations, I am getting quotes from:


Howie Noel - www.hcnoel.com

John Opal - www.opalgallery.com

G Patrick Teran - www.gpatrickteran.com



 
I am hoping indiegogo.com can help me with the initial investment for this project, but my intention is for the sales of this first book to fund the publishing of subsequent books.


Other Ways You Can Help


I know not all of us can afford to support projects... that is why I am bringing my project to indiegogo.com!  If you cannot support monetarily, I would love your support in spirit and networking.  Please go to my facebook group page and like us.  Also, share with your friends whenever you can!  Maybe one day you can buy some book for yourself, or as gifts to help spread the word.
https://www.facebook.com/DoodlebugandLaserGhostHunters
Thank You!!

story:
Who we are

Hey everyone! My name is Angie Underwood, a professional book designer and the creator of BookCreative – a program that allows writers and book professionals to create beautiful, high-quality books for print or e-book.
 

It all started when...

Back in 2006, I created a software program called BookCoverPro to fulfill a need for self-publishers who wanted (and deserved!) high-quality book cover design, but didn't have the budget to hire a professional. With that, I designed a library of cover templates so that even the most artistically-challenged could create stunning, high-quality book covers. My goal was to level the playing field so that anyone who worked hard at writing a book could have the same opportunity to get their books noticed and sold as those who had spent thousands on professional design. In the ten years since this program was available, we had tens of thousands of loyal users, many of whom used BCP for dozens of their titles. Several of our authors even won awards for their outstanding designs – with no prior art experience!
 

Since then, I have developed many friendships with writers, along with a strong sense of respect and compassion for their work. I wanted to take the program even further by offering not only a platform to design covers, but also have a way to edit pages and create marketing materials. With this goal, I teamed up with skilled (and very patient) developers and, in December, launched the initial release of BookCreative.

ღ  ღ  ღ

BookCreative is a plug-and-go book design program that is both Mac + PC compatible and includes a robust platform for designing book covers, formatting pages, and building marketing media like bookmarks, brochures, postcards, DVD cases, and more. It even includes a built-in ISBN barcode generator, and formatting for PDF, JPG, PNG, GIF, + BMP.

 

E-book cover interface

Full cover interface

Page interior interface

Bookmark interface

In case you don't like dark gray, there are several interface colors ~

Some nice things about the program:

  • NOT subscription-based - this is a one-time cost, good forever.
  • NOT web-based, but a free-standing desktop app. There is never a risk of losing your info because of a site outage or being compromised by hacker sabotage. 
  • UNLIMITED titles + FREE updates.
  • ANY STYLE print book or e-book.
  • PRE-DESIGNED TEMPLATES and FREE images included with your Deluxe order.
  • Mac & PC compatible.
  • Supports BookCoverPro files.

Fast-forward to today...

We have customers all over the world using BookCreative and with a lot of positive testimony, we've received some great suggestions – that we would now like to apply.

It's also time to upgrade BookCreative for better functionality – while still remaining easy to use and affordable. Here is what my team and I propose with this next level of development:

  • Easier manipulation from Word or other editing programs
  • .EPUB & .MOBI formatting
  • Instant, customizable 3D e-book cover conversions
  • An option to contract with artists who can monetize their designs on our platform
     

What We Need:

The $2,000 we propose will cover:

  • Development costs
  • Quality Assurance testing
  • More unique templates and images for our users


The Impact

With indie publishers now accounting for about 45% of all e-book sales (2016), the playing field has certainly changed in the past decade. Self-publishers tend to be savvy and smart with a refined mindset, and they demand (and deserve) book design that reflects the same quality and professionalism as afforded to traditionally-published books.

BookCoverPro helped leverage this mindset by giving writers the power to design their own covers. BookCreative moves this forward by helping writers create their entire books that are stunning and sellable, and industry-correct for any device.

We believe that a writer should have complete control over their entire book—content AND design—because they know their book better than anyone else. We know the hard work that writers put into their product, and we want them to have the ability to create beautiful design, for unlimited titles, at a cost that is affordable—for anyone, all over the world.

And, we want to have a full library of cover and page design templates to use and customize. These have proven to be very popular with our users, and they help to leverage the design skills for those who are more "artistically-challenged".

As always, my professional team and I will continue to provide excellent service to all our customers. ツ
 

Risks & Challenges

I have secured a devoted QA team and a selection of our own customers to beta test the app while in development and before launch to ensure proper functionality on all platforms and devices. After launch, my developers will remain on board to provide updates, zap any issues that arise, and continue to test UX functionality.

If we do not meet our minimum funding: Any proceeds raised will go toward development costs and/or helping authors with their design and promotional needs. I promise, every penny will be put to good use with our services.

Any funding in excess: Will be used to expand our reach with more services such as design workshops and courses–which we are super excited about. More on that when it happens!
 

Perks & ETA:

Every contributor who chooses our SILVER, GOLD, PLATINUM, or VESTED perks will immediately receive a link to our current BookCreative program for download, and will receive our new release when ready.

If funding is met, development will commence right after campaign is complete, and we expect the timeframe for development and testing to take about 1-2 months. We will keep everyone up to date on this campaign page. Estimated date of launch: October 2017.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

So if you're a huge fan of books and authors (like me!) but not a writer, and you would still like to contribute to the cause, we'd love that! Any contribution is very much appreciated. Or, please, feel free to post our link on your website or social media – that would be awesome!

Be sure to check us out at bookcreative.com

Help us spread the word to writers you know. Thank you for viewing!

 xoxo ~Angie ツ

story:
VERSeFest is Ottawa’s annual international poetry festival.  It is managed by a collective of Ottawa poetry groups called VERSe Ottawa.  The festival is going into its third year and has been a great artistic success.  Last year’s festival brought spoken word poets of the calibre of C.R. Avery and Ursula Rucker, and written word poets such as Philip Levine and Rae Armantrout.  We’re looking forward to VERSeFest ’13, which will feature poets from Australia, Ireland and the Netherlands.  The festival promises to be even better than its predecessors.  But we need your help.

 

Staging an international poetry festival is a much more expensive operation than ‘keeping it Canadian’.  Travel costs are very much higher, as you might imagine; even the costs of accommodation and hospitality rise above those for Canadian nationals.  We have sought and obtained some funding from several Canadian funding agencies, but it isn’t enough to offset costs.

 

We need $5,000 to break even on VERSeFest ’13.  If we don’t manage to raise that amount, we will have to start cancelling international and Canadian poets.  We need $2,500 to bring two Irish and three Dutch poets to Ottawa, and we need $1,500 to bring Canadian poets from western Canada.  A further $1,000 will go toward accommodations and hospitality for other festival participants. 

 

Your contributions will go directly to funding the artists’ appearances.  VERSeFest is run completely by volunteers, so 100% of every donation goes toward making the festival happen.  Please give what you can.

 

You can help even if you can’t contribute financially.  Please pass the word about our campaign to friends and acquaintances.  Make some noise about VERSeFest and Indiegogo.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.

 

Thank you!

story:
What's HRVST? 

HRVST is not a music magazine. It ́s not about telling you how a new record sounds or how the tour of our favorite band went. Instead we “harvest“ experiences, ideas and stories of people from the DIY music and art scene and produce a magazine that focuses on their individual stories and experiences, shedding light on a very up and close personal level, building on a bigger, more complex and truthful picture of who they really are and what makes them the persons they are. Beyond the stage, beyond the canvas, beyond what you seem to know about them, already. In the end uniting them in one single topic per issue. Following the first issue “Death“, the second issue of HRVST focuses on the topic of “Youth“.

HRVST is a book project that features various persons that have their roots in the underground / punk / hardcore environment. Be it painters, graphic artists, writers, musicians, photographers, label-guys, or whatnot. It´s not asking about the latest record or tour, or giving out record-reviews and stuff like that. Enough people do that, already, and they are probably better at it than we would. Instead we focus on one topic per issue, making this thing more timeless by featuring pure statements, opinions and stories of people that we think have something to say about a topic that is dear to us. Starting with the end, "Death" has been the topic for our premier issue.


Why we are here. 

HRVST #2 focuses on "Youth". It´s already finished but we need YOU to turn this into a printed reality so that you can hold it in your hands. 

So we are sincerely hoping for your support to help us finance the printing process! If you can spare a couple of bucks, we would be more than happy to share some of the perks with you, in the last section of this page.

story:
Cracking Heaven's Mirror

An ancient Persian text and oracle, Masonic ciphers, Angels and Demons, an Illuminati conspiracy, Nazi occultists and mystics retrieving it as a holy relic, the ability to see an hour or 1000 years into the future... sound like the latest Dan Brown novel?  Wrong.  This is true history and the document has been deciphered for the first time in over 200 years and will soon be available for YOU to have!:

I am an author, graphic pencil artist, and researcher/translator of Renaissance European texts. While studying a particular French author, a friend clued me into some engravings she had seen in a book. After much research I found the origin of the seven engravings. As I dug deeper into these mysterious engravings and the man behind them, it led me on a journey though Renaissance secret societies such as the Masons and Rosicrucian, Illuminati espionage, deep into occult and esoteric fields of thought.

After trying to make sense of the text and seven engravings, it occurred to me that there were certain indicators on the engravings and oracular pieces; and what I was looking at was not the true text or oracle, but a system that had been scrambled by a cipher! I've meticulously found every cypher and am working on the translation of the original text from French into English.

This ancient Persian tarot-like oracle is purported to give future predictions anywhere from minutes or hours into the future to epochs of over 1000 years! In its ciphered form, the oracle is useless, but now that I have the keys, I am working on getting French text translated into English for the first time in history, and also redrawing the engravings which are vital for the oracle to function. All will be compiled into an easy to follow book retracing the original author's steps (who died in a prison for treason), and also my steps as I take you through how the oracle was encoded and decrypted. Also included will be the translation of the original text, the deciphered oracle and everything you will need to start using this 1000+ year old secret system!

What People Are Saying:

"I'm very excited to see it coming out of the woodwork and getting a thorough treatment. We'll all be edified by the hard work Eric is doing to revive this tool.  In particular, the Tarot world will have access to its own bigger picture; this is a major contextualizer for esoteric developments in the 1700's."  --Christine Payne-Towler, author of "The Underground Stream" and creator of "Tarot of the Holy Lights"

 

Why do we require this funding?

  • Due to the economy, publishers are not fronting money to authors.
  • The amount of time required to redraw all of the engravings and translate the text will be extremely time consuming and a full time project.

What perks will you receive for funding* this project?

  • Your name published as a contributor in the final book.
  • A special edition signed copy of the book.
  • A special edition signed copy of the book along with a printable PDF of all the deciphered oracular pieces for you to print out and start using immediately!
  • A special edition signed copy of the book along with cardstock prints of all the engravings (signed by the artist) and all the oracular pieces on cardstock!

(*Based on your funding level)

This is a groundbreaking project!

Very little of the Renaissance literature has been translated into English:

  • This will be one of the first French esoteric texts translated into English in the 21st century!
  • It will give people a glimpse into the Secret Societies in Europe during the time.
  • It will also demonstrate the level of knowledge the "elites" had during that time period!
I've translated several Renaissance texts from the same time period into English for the first time, and this will be no different.  I deliver the goods!
If the funding goal is not met, I will allocate as much time as possible to the project until it is completed.  This book WILL be published no matter what and you will receive your incentives for participating.

Spread the word!

Lets make this project a reality!  Share this project on all your social networking sites like facebook, twitter, myspace.  Really get the word out!  You can also tell your friends by word of mouth!  You can also use all of the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Pit Bull Victims Foundation Inc. is a non-profit corporation founded in Texas, incorporated on November 2nd 2012. The purpose of the foundation is to memorialize the many innocent victims of the fatal pit bull attacks, to offer support to those who have survived these horrific attacks and the families of all victims. 

The PBVF will also strive to raise awareness of the growing crisis we all face, brought about the pit bull advocates and owners over the last 40 plus years, to make educational materials available for all, to let the victims and their families know they are not alone, to let victims know they do not deserve the further abuse and attacks the owners and advocates heap on them after they become a victim, to help people and organizations hold events to raise awareness and help victims wherever they may be and we hope in the future to be able to help offer low cost and or free spay and neuter services. 

We are dedicated to making sure the victims are no longer forgotten and to help make sure the survivors of these vicious and brutal attacks know there is help out available. 

We plan to implement programs one at a time over the coming months and years as we are able to fund them. We are not yet taking donations or accepting volunteers and will not be until we obtain our 501(c)(3) status. 

One of our first efforts will be to design build and open to the public the memorial honoring the fatal victims. These victims include the great many human victims but also the exponentially greater number of animal victims who are maimed, mauled and killed every year by these inherently dangerous dogs. 

For those wishing to hold events to raise awareness or help raise funds to help victims please contact us for any and all the help we can offer. 

Far to long have the pit bull advocates and owners made a mockery out of the tragedy of the innocent victims and their families. Far to long have these victims been further attacked and abused by pit bull owners and advocates just for becoming an innocent victim of these dogs and their owners. 

Far to long have the victims been ignored and forgotten by the news media and the majority of good people in America who were not informed of the devastating plight of the victims and their families after one of these brutal and savage attacks.

We have not yet filed for 501(c)(3) status and so donations are NOT tax deductible at this time.

story:
¿Qué?

Portamento es un soplo de aire fresco para el género del suspense y de los mitos, urbanos o no, con los que nos hemos visto bombardeados hace unos años... imprescindible.

Olvida todo lo que te han contado. Olvida todo cuanto has leído. Los humanos escriben su historia con sangre, y de la sangre surgió, también, la primera leyenda. Adan y Eva no estaban solos cuando comieron del árbol prohibido. Y ahora, la Hija de la Tierra renace en un mundo famoso por masacrar a sus héroes. Pobre Verónica. Tan joven. Tan frágil. Tan insignificante… un cuerpo de solo diecinueve años, albergando el alma más antigua de la Creación. Tomando café, escuchando música o asistiendo a clase, mientras nuestras razas están en guerra.

Bravo.

Me encantaría saber cómo termina esta historia. Pero esa es la ventaja de la inmortalidad, supongo. Solo es cuestión de tiempo. Y yo, tengo todo el del mundo.

Enoc

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Belinda Mainar.

Nacida el 18 de febrero de 1977, empezó a escribir a los ocho años en el diario que le regalaron por su primera comunión. Enamorada de los comics de sus hermanos mayores, aprendió a leer con Zipi y Zape, 13 Rue del Percebe y Mortadelo y Filemón, abriéndose camino poco a poco a otras lecturas con menos viñetas.

Estando en el instituto ganó el concurso de poesía, participó en la revista del centro y el grupo de teatro eligió y representó una comedia con su firma. Tiempo después comenzó con los talleres literarios, primero en la Universidad Popular de Zaragoza, luego en la Escuela de Escritores, con profesores de la talla de Patricia Esteban Erlés, o el poeta y novelista Julio Espinosa Guerra.

Actualmente trabaja como administrativa y Travel Manager para una empresa de ingeniería y va a publicar su primera novela, Portamento.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Portamento que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Belinda Mainar vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
I was lucky enough to be selected to be one of the 8000 to initially explore the new Google Glass, and I thought, wouldn't it be cool if I chronicled my experiences using the product in an e-book that would be published shortly before Google Glass was released the general public? I would also maintain a blog, incorporating images and videos taken using Google Glass, then shortly before it is released to the public, flesh out the material into a full-length e-book (in the Kindle format) that would include additional thoughts and experiences unable to be documented by the Glass. Since the book would be primarily text (with some images), the blog would serve as a natural complement as it would contain all of the images and video clips taken. 

As part of this adventure, I would also entertain suggestions from those who followed the blog to embark on novel experiences to be incorporated as events in the book (and share them online). As long as it wasn't illegal, immoral, unethical, dangerous, or unreasonable, I am pretty much up to anything. I also thought it would be fun to visit random people and document their daily routine (with their permission, of course) and incorporate them as featured characters in the book as well.

My biggest challenge is to never be boring, as I'm promising an entertaining ride that is essentially my life to become the narrative of the book. And since this is non-fiction, even though there might be temptation to "enhance" events to make them more exciting, my ethics would force me to remain honest. But that is where my viewers become a pivotal part of this process; by suggesting new adventures for me to embark upon, and maybe even becoming part of the story. Initially, only one person in 40,000 will have access to this new technology, so the inherent novelty will fascinate folks, but I will also face individuals who fear the potential abuses of this gadget, especially when it comes to privacy issues. I hope to serve as an ambassador of change, showing folks that in this day of social media, that we must embrace a new world of interconnectivity that spans across all cultures and unifies the globe.

While real life is unpredictable, I feel that I can document an entertaining journey with many unexpected twists that readers will not easily forget. Won't you be part of my trip into a brave new world of social interaction combined with the newest technological development? I'll see you on the other side of the glass.

---

An excerpt from the book:

Privacy, privacy, privacy . . . that seems to be the common theme lately among anyone writing about Google Glass. While I'm an advocate for personal privacy, I also understand that it only applies to private spaces. I don't want the government, or anyone for that matter, "peeking" through my bedroom window (or any other window of my house). There are certain establishments that I frequent that I really don't want everyone knowing that I go to, but they're all on private property, and the owners of such spaces are pretty good about restricting the use of recording devices by their patrons (although they may use CCTV for their own security purposes).

I'm also savvy enough to recognize that there are spaces where it would be inappropriate for me to use a recording device, such as a public restroom or a movie theater (or even a live theatre). I'm also not going to take pictures or video of a stranger without their permission, and I'm especially not going to record pictures/video of kids in a playground to post on pedophile sites; I hate pedophiles as much as any normal person. If I do happen to take pictures that involve other people, it'll probably be part of a crowd scene in a public space, and I won't be specifically targeting an individual.

I'll be using my Glass to document the minutiae of my own life, which will involve the people that I know (except for the few who have already requested that I don't record them). The only person really giving up their privacy is me, and I'll be choosing which aspects of my life I wish to share with others. I know full well that whenever I'm in a public space, my life is already being recorded from a variety of viewpoints, and for various reasons. I'm not ashamed of anything I might do in public (although I might be embarrassed at times). If people witness me going about my life, it's because I have made the choice to be part of society. If they happen to record me doing so, that's okay, as long as they don't misrepresent me (or unfairly profit from my performance).

I look around and see how the plethora of cameras has actually benefited society. When bombs went off in Boston, official examination of the collected recordings made by those in attendance quickly identified the suspects (after a few false starts) and eventually led to circumstances that prevented them from doing any more harm.

We live in a much different world than we did a decade ago, but that's the way it has always been. Society is changing at an accelerated rate, and with the cyber-genie released from the vacuum tube, fantastical technology will constantly be developed that will allows us to reshape our reality in ways only imagined in the best science fiction offerings. I, for one, welcome the opportunity to finally live in the future that I once only dreamed about.

The technophobes will always fear change, but that's because they don't fully understand the actual capabilities of the newest gadgets. However, I don't want to be held back by their misconceptions. I am an explorer, one of the chosen, who is willing to navigate the waters where there be dragons. I will lead by example, and I'm joined by others who understand that many feel we're sailing over the edge of the world. But we'll prove that there are new lands waiting for us, and we're more than willing to share with others what we discover, while at the same time, respecting the privacy of those who wish to remain anonymous. We'll do no evil. I promise.

story:
Short Summary

I am an aspiring author that is trying to get his name out there. I finished one novel and I put that on the back burner because I want to make sure that it is perfect before I work on publishing it. The second book I am currently is very personal and was a way to cope with many things that I went through in life. There are messages in the book that I wish to share with the world' like never giving up and to keep good people in your life. It is a romance novel that almost everyone can relate to. 

What I Need & What You Get

Createspace.com has an amazing package for Authors who wish to self publish which includes:

  • Comprehensive Copyediting Plus(1 Round)** – Receive suggestions on how to improve your work, and an edit to help tighten your manuscript's style and technical consistency.
  • Signature Book Cover – Work with our design team to create a one-of-a-kind cover with a combination of images, textures, colors, and fonts.

  • Online distribution through sales channels you select, including Amazon.com and your own eStore

 

It includes everything I will need to further my career. There are certain perks to sponsoring that include a free copy of a paperback book to a personal dedication in the novel along with two hardcopies, two paperbacks to share with friends, all signed of course. I am making steps to further my dream and I want you to be a part of it.

Even if I don't reach my goal everyone still gets their perks. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word and help me get my dream along. Even if you cannot contribute, it doesn't mean that you can't help and I will not forget you.

I pledge to donate the remaining money to Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. The goal isn't all for me. I don't need all that money but I would love to donate. I believe in giving back when given to! http://mskcc.convio.net/site/PageServer?pagename=giv_donate_now

story:
Fix North Platte-To Benefit PAWS-itive Partners

A Group Effort Organized By Participants Of The NP Chamber Of Commerce Program, Leadership Lincoln County

Who is Fix North Platte?

Fix North Platte (FNP) is a group organized by individuals who are participating in the program, Leadership Lincoln County (LLC) a program offered by the NP Chamber of Commerce. The LLC program is a year-long in duration, participants meet once a month to learn, tour and see everything that is North Platte. A requirement to 'graduate' LLC is to do something which will benefit the community. LLC is composed of multiple groups, a group with a mission to benefit the humane community decided to organize Fix North Platte. 

What is the mission?

FNP's mission is to raise enough funds so that a minimum of 25 animals can be spayed or neutered through PAWS-itive Partners.

PAWS-itive Partners, through an application process, offers financial help to pet owners who have a pet which requires a 'fix'.

Fixing an animal is an expensive job and the cost varies depending on the animal, gender and weight.

Our goal

Our goal is a minimum of 25 animals, an accurate number of funds required for 25 procedures is nearly impossible, the goal may require more or less than $2000.

Why donate?

  1. Anything you can donate is a major contribution to our cause!
  2. All donation are tax deductible!
  3. You're helping contain the number of animals who have an uncertain fate on the streets, animals which reproduce and the owners are unable to keep the babies due to a lack of funds.
  4. If the pet owner doesn't have funds to take care of baby animals, they more than likely didn't have enough money to get the animal fixed. 

Are you tired seeing stray cats in your yard or around town? Donate for the cause!

 

You're going to see Fix North Platte more and more in the future. We only have until the end of March to raise funds, you can help by telling a friend, sharing this on Facebook or even a donation!

Thank you!

story:
Story of My Book


To Murder Galatea is about a young museum warehouse keeper’s journey during a time of crisis and social anxiety. He has to fight off a mob of iconoclasts and save artworks from the museum's evil curator.

My name is Moyu Chen, and I am the author of To Murder Galatea. I wrote this book because I want to explore the thrilling theme of iconoclasm in a secular context. It is always fascinating to think that people actually destroy artworks, which are usually lionized and preserved, on some occasions. I also wrote this story to explore social anxiety due to the rise of social injustice and the consequent protests. I want to help readers and myself make sense of current events and affairs in the real world. As a result, I imagined a world in which social injustice is ‘exterminated.’ People celebrate the unity of humanity and at the same time they are haunted by their dark past. The world in the book is fictional, but it also alludes to our reality in which people are and were desperate to find a path to justice and to fight, protest, and survive. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that we cannot forget history by simply getting rid of the reminder of it. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to confront our own shared history with the book creating a twilight zone that is ostensibly fictional but cautionary in nature. I hope you will realize that when diversity and disparity are forbidden, and when inclusivity is driven by law, a world with unity can be much less of a Utopia than one without it.
You will love this book if you are an art enthusiast and ardently care about social change. 

To Murder Galatea speaks to art lovers and “all good people” who want to grapple with art and artworks and social change in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that To Murder Galatea inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing us into engaging questions like:
 

  • Is it possible that an artwork, though representing an artist’s voice, can hold some degree of neutrality before the beholder? 
  • Should seemingly offensive artworks be preserved or destroyed?
  • To what degree do those objects, artworks and monuments have power over us and our way of thinking?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing art, art history, and social changes will shape us all for the better.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting of my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in Spring, 2021.

When I pre-sell 130 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 155 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 205 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Moyu Chen is a part-time author and a senior Art History major student at Franklin & Marshall College.

During other times when he does not sit in front of his laptop, pulling his hair out while writing, Moyu is a mediocre piano player, a barely abstemious chocoholic, a cream-sherry lover, and most important, an introvert proud of his taciturnity. 

For more information, you can connect with Moyu Chen at moyu.chen@icloud.com and c._moyu on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ToMurderGalatea* and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts. You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page. 

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,


Moyu Chen

story:
About the authors

Our names are Jake and Kate Persy and we’re young, self-publishing writers. We’re a happy couple, we have a healthy, active lifestyle and our motto is, ‘The best moment to be happy is right now’.A wise man once said, ‘What we do for ourselves dies with us. What we do for others and the world remains and is immortal’. We believe that we should all bring something valuable into the world, we should share our joys and savour the moments we spend with our nearest and dearest, and make the most of each and every day.

About our book

We wrote Codename: Chimera about two years ago, initially for a small target audience. However, because of its easy, laid-back style, the pace of the action and the absorbing puzzles, the book soon took off, and this is why we decided to publish it.

Since Codename: Chimera is just the first part of the adventure series, the only characters introduced at this stage are private detective Kevin Kris, his loyal assistant Penny and his tireless best friend, Michael.

In part 1, the detective and his friends investigate a chain of bloody events with links to an ancient curse. The terrible secret they are trying to get to the bottom of is shrouded in the legend of a mythical creature, Chimera. As they endeavour to find out the truth and unmask the Man With No Face, Kevin Kris and his friends find themselves in mortal danger. This gripping novel already has fans in many parts of the world, as shown by a multitude of reviews.

Download PDF sample of Codename: Chimera in Gallery.

Reviews and Testimonials

 Couldn't put this down and finished it in about 4 hours. Such an imaginative story and beautifully written too (Ellis).

 Equal parts Indiana Jones and Sam Spade, this exciting, enjoyable read will quench your thirst for adventure. With likeable characters and fast-paced action, this mystery/conspiracy/detective novel was a joy to read from start to finish (Donna)

 I really enjoyed the book and I was kept interested from start to finish. I get a sense that there may be more books to follow and I can honestly say that I am definitely looking forward to reading them (Kristiene)

 I was pleasantly surprised by how well the story was written and the consistency of reader's interest captured from the beginning to the end. I hope the authors continue to write more stories with the same style. Can't wait until their next novel is out! (Jorge)

 I didn't expect that the story will go to the end like this and i really liked it. (Garry)

 The fast pacing kept me interested in the story throughout and made this a quick and entertaining read. It was very obvious that the authors spent a great deal of time conducting research for this book. Overall, this was a fun, well-researched story, that is hopefully just the beginning of an entertaining new series (Amanda)

 There is almost a type of suggestion to the way the story is written that doesn’t give too much away allowing the reader to interpret the story and characters in their own way, almost as if they are part of the private eye’s adventure! (Kristie)

 Well done Jake and Kate and I will look forward to reading more of your books (Blondie)

 Overall I enjoyed the story - it had a good plot very well thought out, it engages the reader and gets your mind working to solve the mystery (Lariza)

 Overall, I am very impressed by the quality of this book! I think this is the first book I've read from self-publishing authors. Jake and Kate provide a story that is fast paced and interesting!  (Amy)

 I must say that this book held my attention right through with its action, mystery, non-traditional twists and turns and a possibly cursed antique--the Bellerophon, a piece of jewel-encrusted medallion. Very entertaining (Betty)

Watch video review by Emma Brown:


Watch other video reviews in Gallery.

Social Impact

We wanted to do more than just write an interesting story; we wanted to share our philosophy with you, and our motto, ‘The best moment to be happy is right now’, sums it up perfectly. Using the example of the characters in Codename: Chimera, we wanted to show you how important it is to savour every single second, and not put off until tomorrow what life holds for you today. Follow your heart, otherwise you might find yourself missing out on the best bits of life. We hope that our detective story will both entertain you and help you to see life differently.

What we need and what you get

When we decided to publish Codename: Chimera, our plan was to create a high-quality product, so we invested a lot of time and money in it. What funds we had were spent on editing, formatting, copyright registration, book cover design, Facebook and Twitter Page design, book trailer creation, domain and hosting for the website.

However, we soon found out that what every product needs is advertising and promotion. Since we’d exhausted all our available funds, we decided to turn to those of you who are as passionate about this project as we are. We feel that it is only with your help that we will achieve our goal.

And so, we need to raise $5,000 to cover the advertising and promotional costs of Codename: Chimera, and this is how we intend to spend the money:

And to thank you for your support, we’ve put together the following packages of perks for you:

BronzeSuntan

$5 – You get the Codename: Chimera e-book in epub and mobi formats, with a signed pdf, along with a personal note of thanks on our Facebook, Twitter and Google+ pages.

SilverPrize

$10 – You get the Codename: Chimera e-book in epub and mobi formats, with a signed pdf, along with a handwritten letter of thanks.

Golden Kiss

$25 – You get the Codename: Chimera e-book in epub and mobi formats, with a signed pdf, along with a handwritten letter of thanks and a scanned kiss from Kate.

Platinum Photos

$50 – You get all the perks of Golden Kiss, plus our amazing collection of photos of interesting world sights.

Sweet Cake

$75 – You get all the perks of Platinum Photos, plus a booklet of Kate’s favourite recipes.

Lux

$100 – You get all the perks of Sweet Cake, plus a list of the best motivational books that we’ve read.

Exclusive

$200 – You get all the perks of Lux, plus a special dedication in our next book (5 people max.).

We’ll also be presenting a special prize to the person who attracts the highest number of contributors. And please don’t forget that for Indiegogo to calculate the number of contributors you attract, you must be logged into an Indegogo account. You can get others involved by using Share Tools or by copying and pasting the campaign URL displayed in your browser’s address bar.

Other ways you can help us

Even if you’re unable to help us financially, you can still help in other ways:

-  Share this with your friends and relations on Facebook, Twitter, Google+,  LinkedIn and other social networks.

-  Become our affiliate and earn commission from sales of our book (email us at jkpersy@yahoo.com).

-  Blog about our book to your friends, relatives and work colleagues.

still help in other ways:
