Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Clave de Sol que saldría pocas semanas 
después a la venta.Además... Sabemos
 que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible 
que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en 
estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, 
incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta 
campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Alfonso Mollón vea publicada su obra. Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
ABOUT THE PELEE ISLAND BOOK HOUSE & WRITERS’ RETREAT

My name is Dawn Kresan, and I am the founder of the Pelee Island Book House & Writers’ Retreat. It has been my dream to create a writers’ retreat on Pelee Island for over a decade. Pelee Island, Ontario, is renowned for its birding, monarch migrations, sandy beaches, and serene beauty. Situated near the Canada/USA boundary between Sandusky, Ohio and Essex County, Ontario, Pelee Island is the perfect setting for a retreat. There are no other writing retreats like it! When not reading or writing, participants might go for a bike ride to the lighthouse, visit the Pelee Island Winery, walk along the beach, or listen to the birds and enjoy the breeze from the lake. Home of the annual Springsong reading series hosted by Margaret Atwood as well as the Island Unplugged music festival and the Artworks artists’ outlet, Pelee is proud of its burgeoning arts community.

Taking part in a Pelee Island writing retreat will give authors the opportunity to focus on their work, free of distraction. Their fees include accommodations, meals, and workshops, with the time and space needed to work on a manuscript while benefiting from inclusion in a creative community. Each retreat offers writers the chance to work on their own and also to take part in facilitated workshop sessions, which will combine group discussion and individual text critiques. The 7-day retreat will include two master classes, and the 5-day retreat will have one master class. On an annual basis, one of the retreats will be sponsored by Pelee Island Bird Observatory (PIBO), which will offer a nature related writing workshop. Participants will go on a bird identification walking tour and spend some time at the bird-banding station. Additional options for all retreat participants, depending on booking dates, include bike rentals, Island tours, wine tastings, vineyard tours, yoga classes, and Springsong tickets. There will also be 6-day self-directed residencies, which are a low cost alternative for writers who need time away to focus on a manuscript. There will be no instructors or workshops, but plenty of time to write, read, walk, and explore the Island.

Confirmed workshop leaders include Margaret Atwood, Cassidy McFadzean, Alissa York, Steven Heighton, Iain Reid, and Chuck Wendig. Every year there will be a variety of genres represented through the workshops — novels, poetry, memoir, graphic novels, sci-fi, horror, children's lit... and so on.


WHAT YOUR DONATION WILL BE USED FOR

The retreats and residencies will begin in the spring of 2017. The funds raised will be used for the start-up costs of the writing program. Costs include promotion, websites, and advertising in literary journals. A lot of the promotion can be done on-line, though Facebook, blogs, and twitter. Those incentives take time, but not money, and I am willing to put in the work because I believe in this project. The bulk of the donation money will be put into paying the instructors for their workshop time and bringing them to Pelee Island. By bus, train, plane,  ferry, or some combination of! Authors should never be expected to do work pro bono or for the promotion of their work. Although a few can command a large sum of money, most authors are paid very little or no fee for readings. It is important that all professional writers are paid for their labour. I intend on creating an afternoon reading series, free and open to the public, where the instructors will read (and get paid for their reading), and where the participants in the workshop can read short pieces on the same stage as their mentor. This will give workshop participants the opportunity to "try out" their pieces and it may be the first time some of them publicly read. Donation money will be primarily used for instructor workshop fees, readings, travel, lodging, and catering for both instructors and writers. Three meals a day for a dozen writers over the course of a week means a lot of food, and a lot of coffee.

This is a one-time campaign to get things going. I don't want to apply for grants, or even worse — become reliant on them. After this initial year, there should be enough money flowing in at a regular basis that the retreats and residencies will  be paid through the participants tuition fees.


PERKS MAKE GIVING REWARDING

Perks are offered in every price range, from $10 to thousands. For those interested in taking part in a retreat or residency—if you give $100 now you’ll get 10% off a future booking, and for $200 you’ll get a 20% discount. Why give a  donation now, when you can enrol later? Because you can save money and you are ensuring the success of the Pelee Island writing retreats. You can save $200 by pre-booking a 7-day retreat, and you’ll have five years in which to use it. Having the money upfront better allows me to budget the upcoming retreats and gives me a better idea of how many people are interested in enrolling. All this is useful from a promotional aspect. How much advertising do I need to do? There are only 12 spots available for each session, so pre-enrollement means I know my numbers and I know how hard I need to push. It also tells me which workshops are more popular and what genres are in demand. I can plan the following years's retreats accordingly.  There are lots of fun perks, from signed copies of books, vouchers for Pelee Island retailers, bookstore vouchers,   festival tickets, and even exclusive party invitations to hobnob with literary greats. How fun!

Please note that session 3, in both the spring and fall, is a special purchase that must be made through this IndieGoGo campaign. There have been some spots already taken in the Atwood session, which is why it is down to six spots left. There are 12 spots available in each session. Participants will be assigned a room with someone of their own gender. Travel is not included.


SUPPORTER SHOUT-OUTS

Thank you to all the generous people, businesses, and organizations that donated perks to this fundraiser, including Margaret Atwood (Pelee Island Bird Observatory), Aimee Parent Dunn (Palimpsest Press), Anne Marie Fortner (Explore Pelee), Sarah Jarvis (Bookfest Windsor), Kim Gardner (Pelee Island Heritage Centre), Marty Gervais (Black Moss Press), Walter Schmoranz (Pelee Island Winery), and Dan Wells (Biblioasis).


Spring  2017 Retreats & Residencies

Session 1:“True Lies” Monday May 8 to Sunday May 14

 Instructor: Alissa York

Session 2: "Writing Nature" PIBO sponsored workshop — Tuesday May 16 to Saturday May 20

Instructor: Wayne Grady

Session 3: “The First Five” May 23 - 29 

Instructor: Margaret Atwood (BUY A TICKET THROUGH THIS CAMPAIGN)

Session 4: Monday June 5 to Saturday June 10

Self-directed residency

Fall 2017 Retreats & Residencies 

Session 1: "Writing Your Life" Monday Sept 11 to Sunday Sept 17

 Instructor: Iain Reid

Session 2: “The Craft of Poetry” Tuesday Sept 19 to Saturday Sept 23

 Instructor: Cassidy McFadzean

Session 3:  "How Story Transcends Genre"  October 2- 8

Instructor: Chuck Wendig (BUY A TICKET THROUGH THIS CAMPAIGN)

Session 4: Tuesday Oct 10th to Sunday Oct 15th 

Self-directed residency


ABOUT ME

Dawn Marie Kresan is an author, editor, and graphic designer. She has been a long-standing contributing member of the Windsor/ Essex County literary community. She founded the literary press, Palimpsest Press, has been a member of both the Literary Press Group of Canada and the Association of Canadian Publishers, was on the inaugural board of directors for Literary Arts Windsor, created the Pillette Village Reading Series, and was a founding member of Bookfest Windsor. She currently does freelance editing and graphic design, and works as a poetry editor and the in-house book designer for Palimpsest Press. She received her B.A. and M.A. in English Literature and cultural studies from the University of Windsor, received training in bookbinding from the Canadian Bookbinders and Book Artists Guild, learned letterpress from Hollander’s School of Book and Paper Arts, and has an advanced certificate in graphic design with a print concentration through Sessions College for Professional Design. Her books include the limited edition chapbook Framed (2009), and the full-length poetry collection Muse (Tightrope Books 2013). She co-edited, with Susan Holbrook, Detours: an anthology of poets from Windsor & Essex County (Palimpsest Press 2013). The anthology Canadian Ginger, co-edited with Kim Clark (Oolichan Press), and the nonfiction book Derelict (Biblioasis) are forthcoming.


ABOUT THE INSTRUCTORS

The instructors listed below have confirmed their participation, although the dates of the retreats they are instructing still may change. This is a work in progress. Instructors will be added as they are assigned sessions. Check back often.


Margaret Atwood is the author of more than forty books of fiction, poetry, and critical essays. Her novels include The Blind Assassin, winner of the Booker Prize; Alias Grace, which won the Giller Prize in Canada and the Premio Mondello in Italy; and The Robber Bride, Cat’s Eye, The Handmaid’s Tale – coming soon as a TV series with MGM and Hulu. Her most recent non-fiction books are Payback: Debt and the Shadow Side of Wealth (2008) and In Other Worlds: SF and the Human Imagination (2011). The Door is her latest volume of poetry (2007). She recently released Hag-Seed (2016), a novel revisitation of Shakespeare’s play The Tempest, for the Hogarth Shakespeare Project. Forthcoming is Angel Catbird, a graphic novel with co-creator Johnnie Christmas. Margaret Atwood lives in Toronto with writer Graeme Gibson.

Wayne Grady is the author of fourteen books of nonfiction, the translator of more than a dozen novels, and the editor of many literary anthologies of fiction and nonfiction. Brady won the 1989Governor General's Award for French to English translation, the John Glassco Translation Prize, and the 2008 National Outdoor Book Award. His first novel, Emancipation Day, was longlisted for the Giller Prize in 2013.


Steven Heighton is the author of twelve books, including the novels The Shadow Boxer, Every Lost Country, and Afterlands, which was a New York Times Book Review Editors’ Choice. He has received the Gerald Lampert Award, K.M. Hunter Award, P.K. Page Founders' Award, Petra Kenney Prize, and been nominated for the Governor General’s Award, the Trillium Award, and the Journey Prize. He was a fellow at the Cambridge Literary Seminars, and the writer-in-residence at Concordia University, Massey College, the University of Ottawa, and McGill University. He currently lives with his family in Kingston, Ontario.


Cassidy McFadzean is the author of Hacker Packer (McClelland & Stewart 2015), winner of two Saskatchewan Book Awards and shortlisted for the Gerald Lampert Memorial Award. Her work has appeared in magazines in Canada and the US including Prelude, Witch Craft Magazine, The Malahat Review, and The Fiddlehead, and has been a finalist for the CBC Poetry Prize and the Walrus Poetry Prize. Cassidy graduated from the Iowa Writers’ Workshop in 2015 and is currently at work on her second collection of poetry.


Alissa York is the author of the short fiction collection, Any Given Power, which won the Journey Prize and the Bronwen Wallace Award. Her internationally acclaimed novels include Mercy, Fauna, and Effigy, which was short-listed for the Scotiabank Giller Prize. Her most recent book is The Naturalist (2016). York has lived all over Canada and now makes her home in Toronto with her husband, artist Clive Holden.


Iain Reid is the author of two award-winning books of nonfiction, One Bird's Choice, winner of the CBC Bookie Award for Best Nonfiction Book of the year, and The Truth About Luck. Reid’s work has appeared in a variety of publications throughout North America, including The New Yorker, The Globe and Mail, and National Post. In 2015, he received the RBC Taylor Emerging Writer Award for his non-fiction work. His debut novel, I’m Thinking of Ending Things, is a National Bestseller, and has sold in twelve countries to date.


Chuck Wendig is an American author, comic book writer, screenwriter, and blogger. He is best known for his popular online blog terrible minds.com, and for his 2015 StarWars novel Aftermath, which debuted at #4 on The New York Times Best Seller list and #4 on USA Today's best seller list. As of early 2016, Wendig writes Hyperion for Marvel and The Shield for Dark Circle Comics. He was a finalist for the John W. Campbell Award for Best New Writer in 2013.


WAYS TO HELP

Please give what you can for this promising project and help spread the word about The Pelee Island Book House & Writers Retreat through word of mouth, twitter, and facebook. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Help Launch Terranautics!

Terranautics is the youngest sibling of aeronautics and astronautics.  It will train people to navigate an uncertain future on Planet Earth. We need your help to grow a small, local project into a worldwide movement through the platform of an interactive website.

Short Summary

Who are we? Reynold Ruslan Feldman, Ph.D., the founder, is an educator, author, and nonprofit consultant, a retired English professor, dean, academic vice president, and author of seven books. Ren has always felt education should be about body, heart, and soul, as well as mind, and that what we most need to know isn’t taught anywhere, not at home, school, or the university. He is assisted by a growing team, including Sophia Walder-Hoge, B.A., who is fascinated by what it means to be an effective, happy, contributing human. Both Ren & Sophia are magna-cum-laude Yale graduates 52 years apart, and they hope to work with the Yale Center for Emotional Intelligence in pursuing this project.

Terranautics 101

This project began as a book project but has developed far beyond that. The Terranautics Project endeavors to provide some answers that will improve all our lives. Step one is Terranautics 101—The Basics for Navigating an Uncertain Future, a book Ren is currently writing.

Parenting and education are the two primary means of preparing someone for living. Along with life experience, they are what give individuals their life direction and skills for living. We have created The Terranautics Project because we believe that this training prepares one primarily for the world of today, not tomorrow.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $6,000. This will be used to set up a Colorado-based US-tax-exempt nonprofit, Terranautics International ($875); establish the basis for an interactive website to facilitate collaboration ($1,435); research learning resources ($1,250); write and publish a provocative print/e-book—TERRANAUTICS 101 ($1,790); and do initial outreach and marketing ($650).

Perks!

If you donate the following amounts, you will receive the corresponding perks:

·  $20 – An email thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam

·  $35 – A hand-written thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam

·  $50 – An eBook plus a personalized thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam

·  $65 – An inscribed paperback book plus a personalized thank-you

·  $75 – A website acknowledgment, a personalized thank-you, & an eBook

·  $100 – Your answer about how to prepare for living the best life possible will be featured on our website. Plus, you will receive an inscribed paperback book and personalized thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam

·  $150 – A 20-minute Skype coaching session with Ren on “optimizing your life” plus an inscribed paperback book and personalized thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam

·  $250 - A talk by Ren within 50 miles of Denver, Colorado, plus an inscribed paperback book and personalized thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam

  • For every signed copy sent to a contributor, we will donate another copy to a school, prison library, or shelter.

The Impact

Why does this project matter?

“Human history,” wrote H.G. Wells, “becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.” Our book and project will help parents and educators better prepare our children and grandchildren to negotiate the turbulence of a rapidly changing world and people in general to live richer, more meaningful lives.

Risks & Challenges

Terranautics is not something that can be accomplished alone. We can only go so far without your assistance, enthusiasm, collaboration, and contributions. The more of you who get involved, the greater the Project’s potential impact.

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you interested in education? Parenting? The future of human development? Ever wonder what could make your life better? Send Ren your opinions and feedback at reynoldruslan@gmail.com. Also, please share this campaign (and your ideas) with your friends and family. Together we can give Terranautics to the world.

Thank you.

Ren & Sophia, The TerraTeam

Colorado-based US-tax-exempt nonprofit, Terranautics International ($875);
establish the basis for an interactive website to facilitate collaboration
($1,435); research learning resources ($1,250); write and publish a provocative
print/e-book—TERRANAUTICS 101 ($1,790); and do initial outreach and marketing
($650).
Perks!If
you donate the following amounts, you will receive the corresponding perks:·  $20 –
An email thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam
·  $35 –
A hand-written thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam
·  $50 –
An eBook plus a personalized thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam
·  $65 –
An inscribed paperback book plus a personalized thank-you 
·  $75 –
A website acknowledgment, a personalized thank-you, & an eBook
·  $100 –
Your answer about how to prepare for living the best life possible will be featured on our website. Plus, you will receive an inscribed paperback book and personalized thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam
·  $150 –
A 20-minute Skype coaching session with Ren on “optimizing your life” plus an
inscribed paperback book and personalized thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam
·  $250 -
A talk by Ren within 50 miles of Denver, Colorado, plus an inscribed paperback book and
personalized thank-you from Ren & the TerraTeam

For
every signed copy sent to a contributor, we will donate another copy to a
school, prison library, or shelter.  
  The Impact 
Why does this
project matter? 
“Human history,” wrote H.G. Wells, “becomes more and
more a race between education and catastrophe.” Our book and project will help
parents and educators better prepare our children and grandchildren to
negotiate the turbulence of a rapidly changing world and people in general to
live richer, more meaningful lives. 
  Risks & Challenges  
Terranautics
is not something that can be accomplished alone. We can only go so far without your assistance,
enthusiasm, collaboration, and contributions. The more of you who get involved,
the greater the Project’s potential impact.
  Other Ways You Can Help 

Are you
interested in education? Parenting? The future of human development? Ever
wonder what could make your life better? Send Ren your opinions and feedback at
reynoldruslan@gmail.com. Also, please share this campaign (and your ideas) with your friends
and family. Together we can give
Terranautics to the world.
Thank you.
Ren & Sophia, The TerraTeam

story:
Our Story

In the 20th century we thought we had eradicated slavery. In the 21st century we're learning that slavery is not only alive and well but it's worse than ever.

The Elite of the Weak is a YA novel about the plight, the fight and the young saints who bring the Lord's justice into places of darkness. At the end of the age, who will be chosen to rescue the least of these?


The Impact

Through fiction, I bring the truth about what happens to children across the globe who are trafficked as young as five years old. I write about this subject in such a way that the reader doesn't walk away feeling sick or despondent, but walks away inspired and hopeful, knowing God does use individuals to change the course of history. Partner with me to raise awareness about this issue.

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the areas where your donations will go:


Getting copies onto e-readers, on the shelves and in the hands of teens: $765


Marketing: $650


Supplies: $385


Other Ways You Can Help

Please pray for the success of this project--success by God's definition and not my own. And spread the news... The Elite of the Weak will be released on Dec. 2 rain or shine.

story:
Zašto New York i čemu uopće ova kampanja...

Spletom okolnosti pozvan sam na simpozij - War Stories. Peace Stories. - Peace, Conflict & The Media. Simpozij se održava u New Yorku u Times Centru, 11. travnja u organizaciji Pulitzer Centra. 

Mislio sam - ah šteta, a baš bi bilo lijepo prisustvovati tako nečem; a moram i priznati, kad dobiješ na mail pozivnicu, a na dnu piše Pulitzer Center - ne možeš ostati ravnodušan. Nakon što eto nekoliko sekundi nisam bio ravnodušan, pomisao na stvarnost, koja kaže - “Danas slobodni novinari iz ovog dijeli svijeta ne mogu si baš priuštiti samo tako skočiti na simpozij u New York. Da samo tako... Ne mogu - nikako.” - brzo me spustila. 

Nakon nekoliko kontakata i razgovora, odlučio sam da ipak idem na ovaj simpozij.

Kad doktori idu na simpozije, to im plate farmaceutske tvrtke; kad profesori idu na simpozije - troškove pokriju njihove visokoškolske ustanove npr., kad korporacijski novinari idu na simp... pardon, oni ne idu simpozije, (pa ni na teren ne idu) čemu, kad su se ionako odlučili za copy-paste novinarstvo. 

A ovih par slobodnih nezavisnih novinara što je ostalo, teško danas može skrpati od prvog do prvog, a kamoli da si ovako nešto priušti. I oni nemaju nikoga da stane u takvim trenucima iza njih - osim VAS. 

Oni nikome ne odgovaraju, niti jednom šefu, kompaniji, korporaciji, lobiju, interesu... oni odgovaraju samo vama, i struci kao instituciji koja u svom izvornom etičnom obliku polako izumire. Da se to ne bi dogodilo - mora se održavati korak s vremenom, naučiti nešto novo, i ono jako važno - ostvariti kontakte. 

I zato ova kampanja. 

A vi zauzvrat dobivate ono najvrijednije - istinu.

------------------------------------------------------------------

Znači, uz sve perkove dobivate priču, jer što bi drugo novinar bolje znao dati; a tu je i autorski dokumentarni film - "Afrički san" kojeg svi možete pogledati besplatno :) 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Ovih 900 dolara pokriva troškove avionske karte, vize i indiegogo provizije; ustvari malo više to košta, al kad sam unosio iznos, nekako mi puno bilo stavit tri nule :)

*UPDATE (11/06/2013)*

It's been too long since I've updated, reason being, life has been in the way. As you can see, the fundraising period is over. I am now in the final stages of editing and collecting illustrations from my illustrator.  The book should be out early in 2014, and those of you who purchased perks will be receiving them around then. I will keep you posted!

*End Update*

*UPDATE (9/25/2013)*

My original plan was to do all of my own illustrations, but a friend of mine who is more talented in that area than I am, has shown me a few sketch ideas he has, so he is now officially my illustrator. Check out the Facebook link for some sample sketches.

*End Update*

*UPDATE (9/6/2013)*


I know what you're thinking:

"In theses hard times,

Why waste my money

On some silly rhymes?"


Well the answer, dear friends,

Is really quite plain,

But I will elaborate

(So the slow ones don't complain).


When you make a donation,

It's not for some fad or some fashion;

You're supporting an artist,

And fueling his passion.


So please, if you're like me,

With less pennies than hair*,

Support with a like,

Maybe even a share.**


I've been writing for free,

For so many years;

I've written for laughs,

I've written through tears.


I will continue you to write

If I don't get another dime,

Because that's who I am,

My passion is rhyme.


That being said,

I wouldn't mind some donations,

Even from Brits, Turks,

French, or Croatians.


*I'm bald

**Facebook users check out facebook.com/theseriouslysilly

*END UPDATE*


*UPDATE (9/5/2013)* 

It occured to me that donators may be interested to know what my plans are if I don't reach my goal. If I'm relatively close to the goal, I will scrape enough pennies together myself (which I am, in fact, doing currently) to reach the goal and get this thing published. If I fall too far short, then the donated funds will go towards some nice printer paper, ink, and a three-hole punch in order to print off copies of the manuscript and fullfill any perks purchased.

*END UPDATE*

My name is Marty

I'm a bit of a poet,

And given the chance

I'd love to show it.

When I was a kid, I despised reading. My mom would sit me down with a book and tell me to read, and I would skim over the pages, counting to what I thought was an appropriate amount of time per page, and after a while, plop a bookmark in somewhere, and go off and play. Finally, in third grade, I picked up a copy of "the Hobbit," and all of a sudden, reading wasn't so bad. I started reading more and more. Eventually, I came across the works of Shel Silverstein, and fell in love with poetry. Silverstein led me to Robert Frost, who led me to Edgar Allan Poe. Soon, I wasn't just reading it, I was writing it. I learned to love and appreciate all kinds of poetry, but the childish simplicity, and deep messages found in many of Silverstein's rhymes have always held the largest place of my poetic heart.

I pull most of my inspiration from Shel, and have found myself styling many of my poems similar to his, but my particular life experiences are where I draw most of the differences. I grew up with four brothers and four sisters in a suburb of Chicago, but moved to West Michigan in my early teens. After graduating high school, I spent a semester at a private college before joining the military*. I served as a tank turret repairmen for a time, but have bounced around to fill other capacities. I was deployed for a year in Afghanistan, and will be deploying again before too long. Stateside, I have worked as a shoe salesman, a meat cutter, a vacuum salesman, a custom furniture builder, a bouncer, and, most recently, a husband.

Though I've changed jobs and titles several times, one of the few consistencies in my life has been my writing. I've dabbled in short stories, both fiction and non-fiction, but I keep coming back to my poems. Since I began writing, it's been a dream of mine to see my own words on a shelf alongside those same authors who inspired me to write. I want to be able to affect children the same way I was affected as a child. If even one person of any age reads my poems and finds excitement, joy, a bit of sadness, lots of laughter, and most importantly, hunger for more literature, then I will feel more than accomplished. My hope is to be able to reach more than one person, but even one inspired individual would be a wonderful thing.

Now, why do I need money to publish my book? Aren't there publishers out there who don't take money except out of sales? Well, yeah. The thing is, though, that after having some of the jobs I've had, I've learned to appreciate the feeling of working for myself. I don't want to have to go through the hassle of sending my manuscript to dozens of publishers, having to wait for who knows how long, just to maybe get some small kind of chance to get my book printed. With my next deployment on the horizon, I don't want to have to put things on hold, and have my manuscript get lost in the sauce while I'm out of the country. I've been building up the courage to do this for years, I don't want to wait longer, so I'm self-publishing via Amazon.com. It will be available through Amazon.com, Amazon Europe and UK, through Kindle, and some other retailers. I'm willing to bet that 1 of the last 5 books you bought was through an online retailer.

So how about it? Why not give an aspiring author the chance to inspire others?

A short example of my style:

Tell lots of jokes

To lots of folks

To see all kinds of smiles.

To make amends

With long lost friends

Go those extra miles.

Treat others with care

Don't forget to share

And you won't regret it.

When you show others kindness

With loving blindness

Believe they won't forget it.




*I am in know way using my affiliation with the military for any sort of gain, sympathy, or support. I only included my service to help show the diversity of my experiences.

story:
Millennial Tales Summary

Millennial Tales is a book of fables and other tales, beautifully illustrated, designed to teach the lessons particular to what the American millennial child needs to know. They're about growing up with unexpected hardship and learning to appreciate all that's at your disposal. In four spirited stories, you will learn about the lives of Americans of many walks as life gives them some important lessons. These stories are longing to be heard, to give voice to the lived experiences that go unnoticed every day.

 

Gifts of the Shopkeeper 

Three children fall on hard times. Three gifts give them the inspiration to make it through.

 

Sarah the Contrary

Sarah is a contrarian who always tries to do things her way, even against her parent's sage advise.

 

Isaac and the Summer Storm

Isaac following a storm and gaining some friends along the way.

 

The Governor's Daughter

Alyssa accepts the help of a mysterious little girl in choosing who she loves most.

 

Our Journey to Publishing

This project has been up and running for months now. Millennial Tales has gone through a name change, many edits, and falling short of our original campaign goal. Yet, throughout all of these changes and trials, our team has acquired a number of important assets.

We have acquired a consultant. She has provided us with a great deal of insight in this realm of publishing. Having had her available to us for several months now, we have identify resources that are critical for our publishing. In doing so, we have streamlined our process and removed some of our cost as we've invested more efficient means of reaching our audience and publishing this first installment of Millennial Fables.

Additionally, we've identified our most important assets our human assets. In our campaign we were blessed to find some many people willing to give and excited to support this project. These were people that we knew personally and some who heard and wanted to support. These relationships are integral to our success and we are so grateful that these people are still looking for their chance to support.

That said, this is our final campaign! We are taking 31 days to raise $1,200 through the support of 30 people. The funds raised in this campaign will go towards illustration, publishing costs, cost of shipping of our perks, perks and other merchandise, and towards reaching schools, children, and communities from Atlanta to Chicago.

With your donations, you'll be awarded perks like: Digital Artwork, Concept art from the author and illustrator, Posters, Book Marks, A first edition copy of Millennial Tales, A name in the special thanks page of the book, etc.

 

Our Impact

The impact that the Millennial Tales team seeks in this project is twofold. When I originally wrote these fables, I wanted to reach a generation of children who I believed lived in a culture that was drifting farther and farther away from its moralistic center. The environment that modern children are being exposed to nowadays has departed from a general atmosphere of insulated good and has instead adopted an atmosphere that, while good, lacks a sense of order. Young children haven't heard the older tales that teach morality. It isn't popular television or music for them anymore. More than ever the onus is on the parent to provide an environment that is intellectually stimulating and morally enriching to their children. They can't rely on media or schools to provide this gratis especially if they don't have the means to afford the best of these things. Children haven't heard the folktales or the nursery rhymes. They don't remember the fairy tales, and the ones they've heard have new lessons. They don't know songs like "I love you, you love me". Millennial Tales was created for my very small students who I could never assume knew the stories or lessons that they needed to know, regardless of their age. Millennial Tales is not seeking to replace the foundation that we as a culture have for our children, but rather to fill the cracks in it.

 

Secondly, because this project is about stories inspired from the American life, it was important that these fables reflected the American people. The American people are diverse. They are wildly creative and adaptive. I sought to show this in the pages of Millennial Tales by tasking our wonderful illustrator with drawing these fables in 4 completely different art styles with a diverse cast of characters. This was no small feat! In creating this book, we looked at art inspired from American cartoons, Japan, France, Mexico, and pockets of American culture across the nation. At the end of the day, when Millennial Tales reaches a child's hands, we want them to be able to see themselves in the pages and thereby foster a greater understanding of the lessons they teach. If Millennial Tales succeeds, the young ones that it reaches will sooner become the intelligent, compassionate, altruistic individuals that they're meant to be.

 

Now, the primary purpose of this project is to get these stories into the hands of children. We are based primarily in the Metro Atlanta Region and the greater Chicagoland Area. We would like to see our greatest impact in these areas.

 

Stretch Goal

 

We are well on our way to reaching our goal, and we are expecting great things. That said we'd like to release some of our stretch goals.

 

$1300

Free Millennial Tales Bookmark with every $25+ contribution

 

 

$1500

Free Millennial Tales T-Shirt with every $30+ contribution

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Thank you so much for your support!

The good news is that we've finished the manuscript and we've obtained all of our assets. All we need to be able to do now to make this project happen is put things together. We're looking to reach our funding goal and get the book out to you as soon as possible. We will be updating our backers regularly about shipping information and the process of the books completion. Please make sure your information is correct.

 

Follow Us


J. Lisle- Author

Youtube

 

Hannah Hernandez- Illustrator 

Facebook

Young children haven't heard the older tales that teach morality. It isn't popular television or music for them anymore. More than ever the onus is on the parent to provide an environment that is intellectually stimulating and morally enriching to their children. They can't rely on media or schools to provide this gratis especially if they don't have the means to afford the best of these things. Children haven't heard the folktales or the nursery rhymes. They don't remember the fairy tales, and the ones they've heard have new lessons. They don't know songs like "I love you, you love me". Millennial Tales was created for my very small students who I could never assume knew the stories or lessons that they needed to know, regardless of their age. Millennial Tales is not seeking to replace the foundation that we as a culture have for our children, but rather to fill the cracks in it.
 
Secondly, because this project is about stories inspired from the American life, it was important that these fables reflected the American people. The American people are diverse. They are wildly creative and adaptive. I sought to show this in the pages of Millennial Tales by tasking our wonderful illustrator with drawing these fables in 4 completely different art styles with a diverse cast of characters. This was no small feat! In creating this book, we looked at art inspired from American cartoons, Japan, France, Mexico, and pockets of American culture across the nation. At the end of the day, when Millennial Tales reaches a child's hands, we want them to be able to see themselves in the pages and thereby foster a greater understanding of the lessons they teach. If Millennial Tales succeeds, the young ones that it reaches will sooner become the intelligent, compassionate, altruistic individuals that they're meant to be.
 
Now, the primary purpose of this project is to get these stories into the hands of children. We are based primarily in the Metro Atlanta Region and the greater Chicagoland Area. We would like to see our greatest impact in these areas.
 
Stretch Goal
 
We are well on our way to reaching our goal, and we are expecting great things. That said we'd like to release some of our stretch goals.
 
$1300
Free Millennial Tales Bookmark with every $25+ contribution
 

 
$1500
Free Millennial Tales T-Shirt with every $30+ contribution
 
 

Risks & Challenges
Thank you so much for your support!
The good news is that we've finished the manuscript and we've obtained all of our assets. All we need to be able to do now to make this project happen is put things together. We're looking to reach our funding goal and get the book out to you as soon as possible. We will be updating our backers regularly about shipping information and the process of the books completion. Please make sure your information is correct.
 
Follow Us
J. Lisle- Author

Hannah Hernandez- Illustrator

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for taking the time.  My name is Reginald J. Reese.  I am currently serving in the US Army and have two children.  I began writing My Brothers Blood in 2006 during a stressful time in my life with family challenges, deployments and losing friends to the jaws of combat.  I would often find myself referring to my Bible searching for answers to a path that seemed hidden from me for a long time.  I have a love for history, esspecially biblical history.  I found myself reading the story of Abraham.  I realized that I had a lot of questions as to what really happened with the convenant of God and Abraham's son's Isaac and Ishmael.  Abraham is known to many as the Father of all faiths.  I was curious in my research of the origin of Chrisitianity, Judism, and Islam.  These faiths have been contradictive to one another for many years and have led to hatered, love, bloodshed and peace in many ways.  During my reasearch I began writing a fictional story based on biblical events starting with Abraham.  Before I knew it, my first book was complete but my journey is not.  I decided to write what is called the Bloodline Novel, which contiains three other books, four in total.  The next book, Father Abraham, will be published this year.  My book, My Brother's Blood, is being represented at one of Canada's largest book and magazine festivals, Word on the Street - Toronto 2013, with more than 215,000 avid readers, agencies, publishers and supporters. 

I have started a campaign to raise money in order to be provided with the best representation of my book in the most favorable conditions. A limited number of authors will have an exclusive opportunity to participate in book signing opportunities at centrally located, professionally staffed booths during the book fair. The book signing and video services are ideal for authors who are interested in presenting their book directly to publishers, agents, readers, bookstore buyers, librarians, and the media. My publisher, will provide an Author Video, which gives a mass audience and potential readers a professionally produced look inside my story.

 Facts about the Word on the Street Toronto 2013 event:

  • More than 215,000 readers are expected to attend
  • 87 percent of festival visitors expect to purchase a book at the event
  • The festival is recognized as one of Ontario’s Top 100 Festivals by Biz Bash Magazine
  • 93 percent of attendees define themselves as avid readers
  • 53 percent of visitors have a salary of $50,000 or more
  • The festival will be promoted by a print, digital and broadcast marketing campaign
  • 81 percent of attendees have completed college, nearly half of which have completed further studies

What I Need & What You Get

Your contributions will help me to achieve the following for my book at the festival:

  • Professionally-staffed, one-hour book signing event at an Author Solutions signing booth
  • Promotional materials, including bookmarks and fliers, to distribute during my signing
  • Poster displayed during your signing to promote my book
  • 75 copies of my book to sign and give away to eager readers*
  • Copies of my book for sale in the Indie Author Bookstore booth
  • Display space for my book in the Author Solutions Book Gallery at the fair
  • Inclusion in the Author Solutions Book Catalog, available to interested attendees as a free takeaway
  • A press release sent prior to the event to publicize our presence at the Los Angeles Times Festival of Books in the Author Solutions booth

What You Get

  • You will recieve valuable perks from autograph copies to your face sketched as a character in the next book. 

The Impact

Your support will have tremendous impact on getting my book launched on an incredible platform of oppportunity and exposure.  My future goal is to transition my book into a movie.  Your support will allow me to be among various networks of people in the entertainment industry.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I ask at the very minimum to please get the word out to family and friends.  With your support I can make my dreams into a reality.  

Thank you.

Sincerely

RJ REESE

story:
The Ultimate Guide to Getting Your Writing in Print & Getting Paid for It

Ever since I learned that my full-time hobby could also become a lucrative part-time job, I've lived and breathed, thought, dreamed, ate, and slept writing and publishing. I've attended conferences and retreats, read books and blog posts, joined forums and critique groups, experienced and observed in all forms the process of getting books to readers. To date, I've published a short science fiction novel with an indie publisher and have over 70 short story publications in venues such as Every Day Fiction, Beneath Ceaseless Skies, and the Sword and Sorceress series. I've been a writer, a beta reader who helped several friends find publishers for their stories, and an intern assisting a published author with her first novel. Through it all, I've tried to help others achieve the same: to fulfill their dream of finding readers and making money from their writing. 

The book started from a collection of blog and forum posts I've shared over the years, which I'm now revising and expanding. When finished, it will include:

  • Tips for defeating writer's block and finishing your story
  • Things to look out for as you revise to make the strongest manuscript possible
  • How to find markets for your writing and keep track of your submissions
  • How to concisely and engagingly describe your story to agents, editors, and potential readers
  • The relative merits of submitting to a press or self-publishing, as described by someone who has done both. The media is always eager to tell you about the latest self-publishing bestseller, but what is life like for the vast majority who never see the New York Times top ten?
  • Scams to avoid when getting your work published
  • How to advertise your work, including tips on everything from author's websites (and who actually reads your blog) to promotional bookmarks, plus the outline of a marketing plan for a novel

The book offers an on-the-ground view of publishing, with a focus on using the internet and inexpensive resources (after all, writers should make money off their writing, not pay for it!). Its holistic perspective aims to build skills that will continue to assist writers at any stage of their careers.

What I Need & What You Get

The goals of this campaign are twofold: to raise funds to make publishing and distributing the book a faster and easier process, and to offer interested readers a chance to 'pre-order'.

The smallest amount IndieGoGo allows as a goal is $500, so that's what I'm setting for this campaign. I believe I can get the project done for less than that, but this also provides a chance for everyone interested in getting a copy of the book or a manuscript review to sign up for one.  My needs for the project are:

  • $40 for formatting the ebook through Smashwords
  • $40 for expanded distribution with CreateSpace
  • $70 for formatting and distributing the ebook on Kindle, through CreateSpace
  • $50 for cover art
  • $125 to purchase an ISBN (needed for some distribution channels)
  • $110 to purchase a download of Microsoft Word as I replace my computer (a necessity for formatting and preparing the manuscript)

That's $435. Further funds will be used to pay for perk fulfillment and IndieGoGo and card fees. With more funding, I will be able to provide a better quality product (above and beyond the text, which I will edit to perfection no matter what) in a shorter timeframe. Even if this campaign's goal isn't met, I will still publish the book, just with a simpler cover, more basic formatting, and without the ISBN. Also, even if the goal is met or exceeded, if I find a more inexpensive way to publish the book at the same level of quality, I will go for that (this may mean different cover art, alternative distribution, or going without the ISBN after all). 

If this campaign's goal is met, donations will continue to be accepted as a way to allow orders of the book and to give everyone who wants to a chance to sign up for the first chapter, short story, and novel edits. 

The perks:

  • First, I'm offering the chance to pre-order copies of the book. The ebook will retail for $4.99 and the print book for $6.99 + shipping, equivalent to the donation amounts for those perks.
  • This is your only chance to get a signed copy of the book, unless you want to order a print copy and then hunt me down in person. 
  • I do freelance manuscript editing as a part-time job (it was also part of my internship during my last undergraduate semester). My suggestions have helped several writer friends land their first sale. Along with the developmental and line-by-line critiques, these perks include an ebook copy of the Starter Guide.
  • I should note this campaign is your only chance to get a First Chapter review of the first 4000 words of your manuscript. Usually I only offer this service as part of a larger package, and for the first 2500-3000 words. If the First Chapter review sells out, I may begin offering it outside of this campaign.

FAQs:

Q. If your book is about professional writing, why are you self-publishing it?

A: I define 'professional' as any writing the writer is paid for, and if self-publishing is successful, then the writer gets paid! Of course this means the Guide has an entire section dedicated specifically to self-publishing, and I'll amend that section with what I learn from this experience. I've chosen self-publishing for this project especially because I like the ability to determine my own content, design, distribution, and sales price. I feel confident in my ability to market this specific nonfiction work without a publisher.

Q. I haven't finished my story--is it too early to buy your book?

A: No! The Starter Guide for Professional Writer contains advice for how to complete your work in progress (writer's block or writer's schmock), revise and polish your prose to make a solid manuscript, and then what to consider as you get it published. Having some idea what comes next in the process will guide how you write your story, and it's never too early to learn the basics of a professional writing career. 

Q: I've already written my story--is it too late to read the book?

A: No! Now comes the real fun as you prepare to submit your story to editors and/or agents (or to readers directly). This step is at the heart of the Guide, as it's what makes the professional writer a professional. Tips on how to market the story once it's published--including steps you can take to build a platform right now--and advice on writing your next work are a bonus.

Q: I've already finished and published my book--it's too late now, right?

A: Not at all! The Guide still contains plenty of advice on how to market your book, work on the next one (avoiding the "curse of the second novel"), and offers a broad perspective on your options if you choose to publish your next book differently. It also offers some perspective on what your first publishing process was like--as it can be a bewildering experience to go through. A professional writer's career usually consists of more than one story, so the Guide will assist you as you go to work on your next one. And the next. And the next.

Q: I'm Stephen King, J.K. Rowling, and J.A. Konrath. All of them at once. They're all the nom de plumes of Myself, a multi-bestselling writer in the shadows.

A: Okay, you probably don't need the help of my book. You still might find it a fun read, though (and I'll keep your secret).

Q. I have a story I want critiqued that is more than 8,000 words and less than 50,000 (or more than 100,000). Am I out of luck?

A. Not at all--I do offer novella critiques (my own published book is a novella), though I chose to list just the staple review options as perks for this campaign. I also critique epic-length novels, for a slightly higher fee than the standard. Actual fees will depend on the length of the manuscript and the level of service desired. For more information, click the link to my website (linked to at the bottom of this page) and contact me at the email address provided. Mention this campaign and I'll be sure to throw in a free ebook download along with your edit!

Q. What's the worst that could happen with this campaign?

A. I'm glad you asked!

Worst Case Scenarios

  • I might not meet the funding goal
    • The goal should be more than enough to meet my publishing needs; however, if I don't raise enough to cover a particular service (like formatting or cover art), I can do the formatting myself using Smashword's useful guide and my own time, bribe an artist friend into designing my cover, fast for a week to save money for distribution, use ISBNs from CreateSpace and PubIt rather than buy my own, etc. The core of the book, its text, will be a high-quality, high-density informational guide unaffected by any changes to its packaging, although I will ensure the package is durable and attractive as well.
  • The book might flop
    • It might, but that won't affect you. You will get your copy and use its wisdom to launch your writing career whether or not anybody else decides to do the same (their loss, alas!).
  • The book might suck
    • Anything's possible, but I don't believe this'll happen. I've been writing and getting my work published--and helping others do the same--for over five years. As this campaign runs I am putting the completed manuscript through a grueling revision, though I've already received rave feedback on excerpts that I've shared on my blog and writing forums. 
  • I might waste my money
    • The most you can spend ordering a copy of the book is $15, and I made more than that on my first day of selling short fiction (seriously--and I'll share that tidbit of autobiography in more detail in the Guide). I guarantee that, following the advice in this book, you will be able to make at least $20 off your writing (provided you finish the stories) and that will recoup even the cost of a signed copy + shipping. I so much gaurantee it that if you buy the book, read it, and find yourself struggling to apply its advice, you're invited to email me and get step-by-step guidance to recoup your investment.
  • The Apocalypse may come about as Cthulhu Itself rises from the deeps to take advantage of the great perks offered in this campaign.
    • Oops.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Let your writer friends know about this book and campaign! IndieGoGo offers a lot of easy tools for sharing.
  • If you can't buy the book now, buy it when it's out!
  • Reviewing books is something you do for other readers, not the author, but this author sure appreciates it when people talk about her books
  • If you're not a writer but more a reader, you might check out my published stories.
  • Consider Eileen Flanagan's advice for "If You Love An Author," even if you in actuality feel nothing more than vague affection for me. 
  • If you have any leads, advice, or connections in the way of formatting ebooks, setting up distribution, or developing cover art (perhaps you or a friend are looking to build up a portfolio), get in touch! And maybe I can help you with your own project.

story:
Obsidian Javelin

Hello to one and all,

My name is Steve Wheeler. I am a knifesmith/swordsmith and author based in Hawkes Bay, New Zealand.  My latest claim to fame is as the Props Weapon Maker for the Hobbit movies which I worked on for two years.
 
I need your help to pay a few bills and feed my family while I finish off the third book by the end of August this year.

The first book in the 'A Fury of Aces' trilogy published by Harper Collins is called  'Burnt Ice'. It came out in April of last year, sold well in Australasia and is now available worldwide as an E book and next month (July) will be in bookstores throughout North America and Europe.

The second: 'Crystal Venom' will be released around the globe on September 1st this year. 

The third in the trilogy : 'Obsidian Javelin' will be out in September 2014.
 
A link to an article written about me: www.stuff.co.nz/dominion-post/culture/6692981/N...

I am inviting you, the reader, to become involved with a tiered system created for real people to buy themselves into the Fury universe as named and developed characters in this third book which at the time of writing this has passed the 65 thousand word mark of the 115000 required.

The story involves a Gjomvik vertical airship (The Haast) which has 110 crew onboard and plays a major part in the storyline. As a flying battlefield aircraft carrier it supports both aerial fights and ground support so there are 35 aircraft of six main types on board being : Hawk,Chrysops, Maul, Heron, Salvage and Aurora.  All of which have either been designed or built.
 
A link to my Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/steve.wheeler.18007

For those that want a place I have created a questionnaire that would flesh out each named character including how he or she looks and acts in the storyline on board Haast.  This gives all involved the chance to create their own heroic self.  All the badies will be totally fictional so rest assured everyone who buys in comes out looking good.

The character entry prices go from $250 to $1500.   The higher the payment the more action your character gets involved in. (Note:as of the 4th July the $1500 character perk is no longer avaialable as I am now in the last third of the story and all the main characters are in place.)

For everyone, no matter what their contribution, I shall make five special one off kitchen knives to the value of $350 each.  All the names of those who have contributed will go into a hat and I shall draw out five names then engrave those individual names onto the blades and send them.  You will also be kept up to date with all current and future developments.  And of course there will be T shirts!
 
A link to the knives : www.kilts.co.nz/wheelerknives.htm
 
Considering the tight timelines I have before the second book launch I need help with money to pay the bills for the next two months while I complete 'Obsidian Javelin'.  Fairly simple eh!  And in these tough times even the smallest contribution will be greatly appreciated by me and my family.

I am also working with three terrific concept artists: Anneke Bester from Christchurch NZ, Al Brady from Cambridge in England and Robb Merrill from Colorado in the USA.  Also I am building the actual models in the stories so as an author I can easily visualise what is happening.  On my Facebook page there are many of the WIPs and images of what we have achieved to date.

If you are unable to contribute in a dollars sense now please spread the word as the stories are all about hope.  My hope for us as members of humanity and our place in the Universe.  My characters love and care for each other no matter what happens.

story:
Short Summary

Fame All-Stars Notorious which consists of 20 members, and Fame All-Stars Legends which consists of 24 members has earned the opportunity to travel to Walt Disney World in Orlando, Fl  to compete at the Cheerleading Worlds.  The Cheerleading Worlds are like the Olympics for All-Star Cheer. Teams from all over the World compete for the conveted title of a World Champion.  Each team had to compete at several competitions and receive an At-Large Bid, which is an invite to attend.  Being invited to participate is an honor that reflects just how dedicated, hardworking, and talented each of these athletes are and continue to be.  Our teams are made up of Middle school, High School, and College aged Athletes who are even coaches and mentors to younger cheerleaders.  Some of them have been to Worlds before and for some, it will their first time attending this amazing opportunity.  We will need to raise enough money for participant fee, Hotel and Lodging, food, and Travel.  Please help these amazing athletes reach their goal and beyond so they may attend Worlds. 

What We Need & What You Get

To participate in The Cheerleading Worlds, we will need to raise $700.00 per Athlete by April 1, 2013.  This would cover the cost of participant fees, Hotel, and Travel.  We hope our friends, families, local and distant businesses will help our team.  When you donate a minimum of $25.00, you get to put a personal message on our Tshirt that all of our athletes wear to Worlds.  With a $100.00 donation or more, you business logo will also go on the back of our shirt, which will recieve national exposure.  Any amount is appreciated. 

The Impact

Lots of teams are traveling to The Cheerleading Worlds, and they all deserve your support, but we believe that when you donate any amount, you are helping these athletes reach their dream.  For some Athletes it will be their last time, for others it will their first time with excitment.  With your donation you are encouraging and motivating these athletes to believe in themselves as their coaches do.   

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can monetarily support our team, so we ask that you spread the word about our page and share with everyone you know.   We thank you and appreciate all your support.

story:
Why is this a good book for young and old?

Well, this book is about love and that is a subject you don't learn about at school. Instead you learn all about mathematics, science, language,... but about emotions?

No, this is a subject you have to figure out yourself and after many years you may eventually end up knowing something more about it. Yet, we all know that love is a bumpy road, with lots of tears and pain, that we will all have to march through.

Now this book helps everybody to understand the how's and why's of love. It helps to keep on moving without pain when you break up with somebody and explains why being positive and full of love is so important for your environment and yourself. It also gives courage to do in life what you "feel" you should do.

Yes, it is a kind of motivational book. Yet, it differs from similar books in that it uses pictures and imagery to explain what love is all about; and we all know that an image is worth more than a thousand words! So it sticks life long in the head. This book is loaded with facts, stories, and experiments about emotions, and it reveals some secrets of the laws of love.

Oh yes you will laugh, wonder and smile.


Some questions that "Love Vibrations" answers:

Do you know that when you get dumped the reason is very logical?
Do you know the different sound beats of the heart?
Do you know what to do when you are alone and have a heart attack?
Do you know the heart pulses of our different species on earth?
Do you know the most romantic love story in the world?
Do you know the law of vibration of love?
Do you know the law of rhythm of love?
Do you know the law of polarity of love?
Do you know what is wrong with lists of love?
Do you know why we don't have to be afraid when we are single?
Do you know why they hang padlocks on bridges?
Do you know all types of relationships?
Do you know when you break up a relationship, it is the right thing to do?
Do you know the road of love?
Do you know the crush table?
Do you know the percentage money makes a guy more attractive?
Do you know the relationship between a younger partner and life expectancy?
Do you know who is on your side from the moment you live till the moment you die? 
Do you know the influence of words?
Do you know the energies of words? 
Do you know the percentage they will cheat on you in your relationship?
Do you know the rice experiment?
Do you know my results with the rice experiment?
Do you know by how much your chances of divorce increase when you know someone who is divorced?
Do you know what Leonardo Da Vinci, Einstein and Nicolas Tesla had in common?
Do you know Cleve Baxter's amazing experiment with plants?
Do you know the experiment of the two cabbage plants and hate?
Do you know the color of rose you may never give to a girl and why?
Do you know the top 5 regrets when you die? 


Inside view (220 pages)


THE PERKS

Ebook + I love your brain 

 

The limited edition book  

            

 

For the love of the child 



Limited edition fine art print - any picture of the book

A limited edition fine art print 47"x31" / 120cmx80cm. Printed on fine art quality paper!  Limited edition of 10 each picture. (the book will be sent first). 



BIG Bühne print - any picture book from the book

Printed on one of the best high end fabric. (the book will be sent first). With certificate and signed on the back. Limited edition of 10 pictures each. (examples see below) 



HUGE Bühne print - any picture from the book

A huge print on your wall printed on one of the best high end fabric.  (the book will be sent first). With certificate and signed on the back. Limited edition of 5 each picture.  + A signed copy of the book.


The high quality fabric in close-up! It's a high end, fabric. With metal eyes in it to hang on your wall.  In this video you can see 2 Bühne prints, printed by us for an exposition of Inject Love  ( time 26 sec. and 52 sec.)


The book itself

The book is 220 pages, softcover, 110 illustrations + text, full color. Size  6,6"x4,7" / 17,8cmx12cm. Minor changes are possible. This campaign will determine the limited edition.

Why do I need funds?

The work is ready for a print-out. So now, I am only pleading for a little financial help. Because I am my own publisher and I would like my book to stay untouched. 

Can the book cover still change?

Yes it can. 

Will your book come to a bookstore near me?

No, sorry. 

Who is Brusse?

Brusse is a visual artist who makes making paintings, photos and installations about the concept of "love" and its hidden worlds(www.wearehearts.com). In 2008 he published his first book "Love Injections, extraordinary ways to surprise the one you love". At that time, the publishing industry didn’t believe it would sell so he became a one man publisher without distribution. In 3 years he sold over 3500 copies (there was a second edition). The book is now available on Amazon worldwide.

Together with Hanse Cora he forms the duo Inject Love. They make non-destructive forms of street installations and pieces of art about emotions (www.injectlove.com). They use street art to communicate views of dissent, evoke questions and to express political concerns.

Brusse had several expositions in Spain - Barcelona, Madrid, Santander. In Belgium – Antwerp Inject Love organized "streetlove", which were several installations placed in the whole city.  This summer 2 works were shown at the international art happening Watou (Belgium).  

Other ways you can help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Your voice is a great help.

Please share this campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter or send to your email contacts who you think might be interested in this project.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Disorientation Guides introduce new and returning students to communities, groups, resources, events, and histories they might not be made aware of in university-directed orientations. Whereas, the information and narrative of an orientation is tightly controlled by the university, the dis-orientation guide provides information and narratives made by students for students. 


The late 1960s and early 1970s were a time of student empowerment and sweeping cultural change on campuses across the country. The first disorientation-like student guide at the University of Maryland was the UMD Radical Guide, created in 1970 when students refused to stand by as the university took publication of the Maryland Guide away from the SGA. The UMD Radical Guide was filled with uncensored student narratives on campus life, civil rights movement happenings, and anti-war organizing. Starting in 2009, Radical Rush continues this tradition of student empowerment with the creation of the Disorientation Guide, which has become an annual publication with growing support both from our contributors and audience.


Last year's disorientation guide included articles, comics, and artwork about many topics like consent, harm reduction, bike repair, and edible weeds on campus. Our zine is now preserved in the University System of Maryland Special Collections and it was featured in a UMD history course lecture on student activism history. We distributed 250 print copies and the file was downloaded over 2100 times online! On campuses as far away as California and Michigan, our guide is being used as a model by students looking to make their own radical zines!


At about 20 pages a piece, each zine costs about $5 per copy. While our online version reached a very large audience last year, having a physical copy is like gripping a miniature riot between your fingertips. Our printed zines get people talking on campus and make minds fizzy like fountain cola, bubbling with new thoughts and ideas.  They are an awesome resource students can use all year long and pass-on to their friends! We will use every dollar we get - up to our goal - to print copies of this year’s guide. If we get extra money, we will save it for next year’s zine to make it that much more awesomer!

Every donation counts and even sharing this on facebook with your friends will go a long way. Thanks so much for your time and support. Contact us if you want to more ways that you can contribute.

story:
That picture up there? That's me touching the wall of the Panama Canal. Yep.

"How's the book, Gail?"

So many of you have asked me this question.  A lot of you know I've been working on a book about my family's work on the Panama and the Canal and life on the Canal Zone. The book is called Where There Is Pride In Belonging, which is the slogan for my father's high school alumni association from La Boca in Panama. Crafting this book has been a long and powerful process and I've worked hard to tell this story. My goal is to get it done and ready to be given to publishers by 2013, a year and a half from now. The centennial anniversary of the opening of the canal is 2014, a perfect time for the release of this book. I can do this but I need some professional help. I have been accepted into VONA, Voices of Our Nations, a transformative writing workshop for writers of color in Berkeley the week of June 19th. I will be in an intensive workshop with Faith Adiele, incredible Harvard-educated writer who has published her own personal memoir and, like me, is working on an intergenerational international family memoir. Her work has been featured in many anthologies as well as O Magazine, Essence, The Root.com  and many others.  There's an agent that loves the project, thinks I'm gifted writer with an important story but it just needs a little more work.  I'm so close to getting this out.  

Here's the link to the site for my Fulbright in Panama that provides more info about the project and great photos 

http://web.mac.com/liagd/wherethereispride/Welcome.html


 

Be Bigger! Help Me Shout!

Sometimes you are called to be larger than you envision. If I could, I'd sit back writing snarky articles about stuff I see on the subway and things that puzzle me. I’d be the black Ellen on paper and the web and chill. But I believe we are all called to do more than what's comfortable. I have been called to tell this story. Most of the books written about the Panama Canal’s construction talk about Teddy Roosevelt’s vision, about the marvel of American ingenuity and engineering it is, considered the 8th wonder of the world. But here's what they don't say:

-200,000 black laborers recruited from the West Indies

-60,000 of those from Barbados

-Every single one of those black workers lived under segregation on the Canal Zone --pay scales, housing, bathrooms, water fountains, schools for children of black labor 

- black workers often worked 14-hour days at  a dime an hour for digging in 100 degree heat and exposing themselves to disease

 One of those workers was Reginald McPherson Dottin, my grandfather. He arrived at 19 years old and worked through the construction and was one of the few black laborers who wasn’t forced off the Canal Zone at the end of construction. He continued working for the Canal and retired at 62. After 44 years of service he received a $45/month pension in 1953, the most he could get as a black worker.

 There have been so many voices unheard in our history, so many everyday heroes who have surmounted ignorance and prejudice to build the lives we are allowed to have. 

 

With your help I can live out this vision.  When Where There Is Pride In Belonging is published I will be working to create a curriculum about this hidden history in the public schools and lecturing around the country, being the humbled but honored voice of my grandfather and the thousands of men like him. Support the mission.  Help me shout!

 

No Time To Waste: What I Need & What You Get

VONA week is June 19th - June 25th

  • Balance of tuition for VONA - $400 due Monday June 6th
  • Airfare to Cali -- Approximately $600  (Less is likely) 
  • Room & Board - $650

 

  • Every contributor gets an acknowledgement  in the book
 
Contribute $50 or more and get:
  • an hours worth of writing assistance for you or child from Wordsmithery by Gail, my service that helps you shine Wordsmithery by Gail
  • or a custom  gift created for someone you love by Wordsmithery Creations
  • or if you live in the New York area, an hours assistance wherever you need it most cleaning, organizing, painting, filing, errands

  • Contribute $100 or more and get a sample of the first chapter now and a free, signed copy of the book when it comes out!  


Other Ways You Can Help

There are tools to share this indiegogo page, so please use them!

Post/share this fundraising effort on Facebook, myspace, and other social networking sites.

Hire me to help you  or to create a keepsake through Wordsmithery by Gail or Wordsmithery Creations. Click the links above

for the release of this book. I can do this but I need some professional help. I have been accepted into VONA,
Voices of Our Nations, a transformative writing workshop for writers of color
in Berkeley the week of June 19th. I will be in an intensive workshop with Faith Adiele,
incredible Harvard-educated writer who has published her own personal memoir
and, like me, is working on an intergenerational international family memoir. Her
work has been featured in many anthologies as well as O Magazine, Essence, The
Root.com  and many others.  There's an agent that loves the project, thinks I'm gifted writer with an important story but it just needs a little more work.  I'm so close to getting this out.  Here's the link to the site for my Fulbright in Panama that provides more info about the project and great photos http://web.mac.com/liagd/wherethereispride/Welcome.html

 
Be Bigger! Help Me Shout!
Sometimes you are called to be larger than you envision. If I
could, I'd sit back writing snarky articles about stuff I see on the subway and
things that puzzle me. I’d be the black Ellen on paper and the web and chill.
But I believe we are all called to do more than what's comfortable. I have been
called to tell this story. Most of the books written about
the Panama Canal’s construction talk about Teddy Roosevelt’s vision, about the
marvel of American ingenuity and engineering it is, considered the 8th wonder of the
world. But here's what they don't say:
-200,000 black laborers recruited from the West Indies
-60,000 of those from Barbados
-Every single one of those black workers lived under segregation on the Canal Zone --pay scales, housing,
bathrooms, water fountains, schools for children of black labor 
- black workers often worked 14-hour days at  a dime an
hour for digging in 100 degree heat and exposing themselves to disease
 One of those workers was Reginald McPherson Dottin, my grandfather. He arrived at 19 years old and worked through the construction and was one of the few black laborers who wasn’t forced off the Canal Zone at the  end of construction. He continued working for the Canal and retired at 62. After 44 years of service he received a $45/month pension in 1953, the most he could get as a black worker. There have been so many voices unheard
in our history, so many everyday heroes who have surmounted ignorance and
prejudice to build the lives we are allowed to have. 
 With your help I can live out this vision.  When Where There Is Pride In Belonging is
published I will be working to create a curriculum about this hidden history in
the public schools and lecturing around the country, being the humbled but
honored voice of my grandfather and the thousands of men like him. Support the
mission.  Help me shout!
 
No Time To Waste: What I Need & What You Get
VONA week is June 19th - June 25th



Balance
of tuition for VONA - $400 due Monday June 6th

to Cali -- Approximately $600  (Less is likely)

& Board - $650

contributor gets an acknowledgement  in the book

hours worth of writing assistance for you or child from Wordsmithery by Gail, my service that helps you
shine Wordsmithery by Gail

or a

you love by Wordsmithery Creations

or if
you live in the New York area, an hours assistance wherever you need it most cleaning, organizing, painting,
filing, errands

signed copy of the book when it comes out!
