story:
SAVE THE GORILLA (FILM MAGAZINE)

PRINTING OF ISSUE THREE DELAYED

 

Dear Readers,

 

It is with mild annoyance that I write you this message. For around the last 6 months our team have been working tirelessly on the creation of Gorilla Film Magazine. So far we have produced two shiny issues, a pleasant evening of short films and a stupendous Treasure Hunt.

 

Issue three has been in production for some time now, content flooding in from far and wide. We’ve been in cahoots with a learning disabled film festival, we have the latest on a brand new stereoscopic 3D animation being produced right on our doorstep in East London- which promises to share how, using only After Effects, one can make their own 3D motion pictures. There’s the top five alternatives to summer blockbusters and the usual smattering of hints and tips for all your filmmaking needs, plus reviews of some of our favourite short films.

 

Gorilla Film Magazine however is facing a problem. We have failed to raise enough funds to print issue three. Do not fear, this is by no means the end, merely a small blip, a slight delay while we establish our footing in the world of the magazine flim flam.

 

So what the hell are we doing to sort things out you might ask? And how can I, your faithful / loving / indifferent reader, be of assistance?

 

Please note that our team is unanimously against putting a price on Gorilla. We will fight to the end to keep it a free publication. As we feel this is the best way to keep our magazine as assessable as possible, plus we don’t really like the idea of talking about no-budget filmmaking and doing things on a tight budget and then charging people a fiver to read about it. Perhaps we are being idealistic and foolish… All I say to this is that it would not be the first time we have been called these things.

 

So in a very long-winded way, what I am trying to say is, WE NEED YOUR HELP.

Even the smallest donation will help to keep our magazine alive and in print. This is only a temporary solution, while we explore new avenues to generate funds.

 

In the mean time, Gorilla is ploughing on. have just set-up a new Blog which we will endeavour to update as often as possible. We have another Monkey with a Movie Camera short film night in the planning. A 46-hour film jam competition coming in June, register here. Plus much more….

 

Thank you for your time.

 

The Gorilla Team.

Gorilla Film Magazine is a free publication targeted at film makers and enthusiasts of the independent film world. We are based near Brick Lane and we a have circulation of 5000 copies with the majority of distribution within central London, and a growing UK and international mail order subscription. As the publication is free and all the staff and contributors work in kind, we are looking at raising money to pay for the only cost which is the printing.
If you would like to find out more about who we are check out our website www.gorillafilmmagazine.com/wordpress or email us at info@gorillafilmmagazine.com


What You Get When You Donate

£5-£10 or more –  Welcome to the Gorilla family, we'll post the current issue out to you wherever you are.

 

£25 or more – Your name will appear in the acknowledgments section of our next issue and of course you'll get a copy through your front door.

 

£50 or more – You'll receive the above plus, a limited edition Gorilla Film Magazine T-shirt.

 

£100 or more – You’ll receive all the above plus a Gorilla Film Magazine Goodie Bag, complete with mug, badges and postcards.

 

£250 or more and you'll receive a one of a kind jumper monkey, hand-made by  a member of the Gorilla team, plus all of the above.

 

£500 or more – Become an official patron of Gorilla Film Magazine, contact us directly at info@gorillafilmmagazine.com to discuss a sizeable donation of this kind to see how you or your company will be able to work with our publication and what we may be able to offer you for your contribution.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about Gorilla Film Magazine through any of our social networking sites:


Website: www.gorillafilmmagazine.com/wordpress

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/home.php?sk=group_113259292074367

Twitter: http://twitter.com/#!/GorillaFilmMag

Ideastap: http://www.ideastap.com/Groups/Group/b0d90770-c901-4a32-8d4e-9ea00183683b#Overview

story:
Pontus J. Back

My name is Pontus J. Back, from Vasa, Finland. Since the age of 12 I was filled with fear of death and tried to numb the fear with alcohol. I was only sixteen years old when I already was an alcoholic. I had one dream and that was to become a rock star. For 15 years I toured around the world and I worked with musicians from bands such as Whitesnake, Status Quo, Molly Hatchet, Lynyrd Skynyrd, Cinderella to name a few. My life was a mess and I was a heavy drinker and I was now also using drugs.

The miracle

In 2006 when I had tried everything I wanted to give Jesus a try as a friend had told me about Him for a period of 16 years. I received Him into my life and immediately He started to help me. I fell back and in February 2007 I was laying on my deathbed at the hospital in Vasa, Finland with incurable damages on my liver, kidneys and pancreas. I had several bleeding ulcers as well as 2 gallons of fluid in my stomach that was coming out through my skin. According to the doctors there were no hope for me to survive.

One night I met Jesus and He told me to do what I am doing today and I have been doing that for seven years full time now. It has been the best seven years of my life and I have a story to tell and songs to sing about what took place in my life.

To see a life get changed and one soul get saved is worth way more than all the money in the world and my prayer is that this is something we could do together!


Mission America 2014

Just a short testimony about our last missions trip to the USA in March 2014. We spent one week at the Daytona Bike Week and served together with Music For The Soul Ministries. After that we had 11 meetings within five days in prisons, drug rehabs, a ranch for children in need as well as a few churches.

One of the strongest memories was in one of the prisons we did. We were told not to pray with the inmates so I just shared my testimony and sang some songs. They were all listening and at the end of every meeting I usually give the inmates an opportunity to ask questions. Many questions are related to forgiveness and forgiving themselves.

This day one of the inmates asked me if I remember the prayer I prayed when I got saved. - Of course I said and it became natural to lead them into the sinner prayer. I told everyone who said the prayer and meant it with all their hearts that I wanted to give them a hug. While many of the inmates walked out there were still around 20 you men who wanted a hug and that day those gave their lives to Jesus. We saw people receive Christ into their lives almost every day and God confirmed to me why He wants me to visit USA twice a year. It is just grace that God is using someone like me.

Dates: 

November 1st until December 9th

Where: 

Texas November 1st until November 14th

Florida November 15th until December 9th

Mission: 

To share my testimony and music at the different locations. Preach a message about forgiveness, repentance, salvation and deliverance in Jesus name so who ever listens can understand the clear message, the good news about the Gospel. We go to place that others won't go! And what we do, we do for Jesus!

TEXAS

- November 6th - 9th we are going to be at the Lone Star Rally in Galveston, Texas. It is Americas largest four day bike rally and it will be the sixth year in a row I travel there to spread the Gospel among around  half a million people. This year for the first of its kind. A Christian Music Stage will be available for refreshing and rest for Christians witnessing at Lone Star Rally.  We have been talking and praying about such a concept in a very worldly setting for three years.  Finally, the AFJCMM are stepping out in faith to do such an event in satans arena.  Pray that the powers that are will not  bother this event.  This event is not affiliated to the Lone Star Rally.

- During my days in Houston, Texas I will also visit the church under the bridge or 1000 Hills Ministries and share my life story and preach a short encouraging message to the homeless people in Houston. That is the least I can do for them while I am there in the big city. Right next to the skyscrapers and nice buildings there are a rough area with lots of poor and homeless people and so far we have heard and seen of many people who have received a new life in Jesus through this ministry that has church for these people 7 days a week.

- I will also be speaking in different churches and do outreach in the Houston area as the Lord leads. 

FLORIDA

-  The first meeting in Florida is November 15th at Heaven's Way Biker Church in Cottondale, Florida. From there I am driving to Jacksonville, Florida to hook up with my old musician friend Dave Hlubek to record some of his parts for my coming album "Name Drops". Dave Hlubek is one of the "name drops" I will feature on the coming cd and hopefully his participation can help the record to be sold to more people within the southern rock community. The record is a christian rock record.

- From Jacksonville I drive to Daytona Beach for one meeting at Set Free Church, November 19th.

- After Daytona Beach I will be located in Okeechobee, Florida and serve out of Fountain of Life church. 

- November 22nd we are putting on a car and bike show at FOL Church with many musicians to draw the unsaved people.

- November 23rd we are having church service at FOL Church and we are inviting people the day before to come to church.

- On thanksgiving I will be playing at the thanksgiving outreach in Fort Pierce, Florida where they give away thousands of portions of food to the poor people. I will minister in Common Ground Church in Fort Pierce the same Sunday.

The rest of the visit in Florida is still open and I will focus on visiting prisons as well as do a few more churches. As I said we did 11 meetings in five days last time in Florida and we saw God move in a mighty and powerful way.

TV PRODUCTION:

During the entire trip I am also going to do several episodes of the TV programs "Life in Him" and "On The Road". We are doing TV programs with personal life stories and testimonies as well as about what God is doing around the world. We count on making around 20 new episodes during this trip. Check out: www.lifeinhim.tv for earlier episodes

NEEDS:

- International flights:booked and paid

- hotels in Galveston: 1000 USD

- rental car / car: 2000 USD (six weeks) we are also looking for to buy a cheap reliable vehicle to be used for our future trips.

- hotels in Florida: 2000 USD I am going to stay at several different hotels during my four weeks in Florida and I am not looking at fancy hotels. I am looking at low end motels with a bed, shower and toilet as well as WiFi so I can be in touch with the rest of the world while on the road.

- food & catering:1000 USD I am usually blessed by others but still need to feed myself as sometimes buy a meal for those who put up with me, so therefore I have added this need in this budget.

Schedule:

November 1st Fly from Vasa to Houston

November 2nd American Legion, Cleveland, Texas

November 3rd Homeless visit in Houston, Texas

November 4th Present to cub- boy scout and parents, Houston, Texas

November 5th Praise Chapel,  Houston, Texas

November 6th Lone Star Rally - Music For The Soul, Galveston, Texas

November 7th Lone Star Rally - Music For The Soul, Galveston, Texas

November 8th Lone Star Rally - Music For The Soul, Galveston, Texas

November 9th Lone Star Rally - Music For The Soul, Galveston, Texas

November 10th Wings of Eagles, drug restoration, Houston, Texas

November 11th TV production day

November 12th TV production day + farewell dinner

November 13th start drive from Texas to Florida, looking for meeting place in Louisiana

November 14th drive towards Florida, looking for meeting place in North Florida

November 15th Heaven's Way Biker Church, Cottondale, Florida

November 16th Drive to Jacksonville, Florida

November 17th Recording with Dave Hlubek and Second Shot, Jacksonville, Florida + TV production

November 18th Recording with Dave Hlubek and Second Shot, Jacksonville, Florida + TV production

November 19th Set Free Church, Daytona Beach, Florida

November 20th Drive from Daytona to Okeechobee, Florida

November 21st Preparations for Car & Bike Show. Okeechobee, Florida

November 22nd Car & Bike Show, Okeechobee, Florida

November 23rd Morning service at Fountain of Life Church, Okeechobee, Florida + TV production

November 24th Outreach, prison... Florida east

November 25th Outreach, prison... Florida east

November 26th Outreach, prison... Florida east

November 27th Thanksgiving outreach, Fort Pierce, Florida

November 28th Outreach, prison... Florida east

November 29th Outreach, prison... Florida east

November 30th Common Ground Vineyard Church, Fort Pierce, Florida - 2 morning services

December 1st Outreach, prison... Florida west

December 2nd Outreach, prison... Florida west

December 3rd Outreach, prison... Florida west

December 4th Outreach, prison... Florida west

December 5th Outreach, prison... Florida west

December 6th Outreach, prison... Florida west

December 7th Outreach, prison... Florida west

December 8th Outreach, prison... Florida west

December 9th Fly back home to Finland

December 10th Arrive at home in Finland

During the last week in Florida, December 1st to 8th we are still counting on visiting at least a couple of churches. We are working on getting into some of the prisons in the Fort Myers area.

We are also thinking about buying a vehicle in Texas as for years now I have rented a car and ever time I rent a vehicle I just pay money. To have a cheap reliable vehicle would make sense as then I could have it ready for next visit in March and drive it to Texas to be there for November 2015 again and so on.

Thank you for taking your time reading!

I hope we can stand in this together and reach many souls for Jesus!

God Bless!

Pontus J. Back

During the last week in Florida, December 1st to 8th we are still counting on visiting at least a couple of churches. We are working on getting into some of the prisons in the Fort Myers area.
We are also thinking about buying a vehicle in Texas as for years now I have rented a car and ever time I rent a vehicle I just pay money. To have a cheap reliable vehicle would make sense as then I could have it ready for next visit in March and drive it to Texas to be there for November 2015 again and so on.
Thank you for taking your time reading!
I hope we can stand in this together and reach many souls for Jesus!
God Bless!
Pontus J. Back

story:
(The little picture is of me holding my in-progress novel from a fiction-writing course.)


Me & Writing

My name is Kristen, and ever since middle school, I've really, really, really liked writing. If I could choose one job to do and do well out of all the infinite choices this world affords, I'd be a writer and make the sort of beautiful stories that have helped shape, enrich, and guide my life. I have already begun, in my own way, and have several short stories, a couple plays, and a large chunk of a novel under my belt.

As of now, I am an unpublished writer. Of course, I would like to be published. If you read the "What's Special About a Writing Conference?" section, you can see why attending this conference will put me closer to both my aspirations: publication and the honing of my craft.

Now, if you've read this and wondered just who I am...

  • I'm a twenty-year old student at College of the Atlantic in Bar Harbor, Maine, where I've taken several fiction-writing courses.
  • I'm originally from the Tampa Bay area (of Florida).
  • On the nonfiction side of things, I work as a freelance writer--mainly writing business biographies and webpage content--which, if nothing else, at least necessitates that each day I sit down to write something.

What's Special About a Writing Conference?

Writing conferences can be invaluable in providing writers, both of fiction and nonfiction, with professional feedback, support, inspiration, and--perhaps more important than all of those perks--a chance at networking, which makes finding publishers in the future much easier! 

Personally, the idea of being around other writers, too--and hearing their work--sounds wonderful.  The discussions, presentations, and workshops will also help me develop my skill. Additionally, this conference will also mesh well with an independent study I am to complete in the fall on fiction writing and publication.

The Destination

Should I raise at least $250 (the cost of a single day out of the three-day event), I will attend one (or more) days at the Northwestern University Summer Writer's Conference. 

(In other words, I'm shooting more for $250 than $500!)

Northwestern University is located just outside of Chicago, IL, where I am staying for the summer.

    Why Do I Need Funding?

    As a college student with a chronic illness (type 1 diabetes), I don't have a lot of spare money after covering my expenses . . . And I certainly don't have $250+ to attend one or more days of the conference. I believe I could get so much out of attending even one day of the conference, however, and that's why I would be incredibly appreciative of any help I receive.

story:
Welcome to Revolutionizing Relationships

Break-ups happen. They are happening right now. And although they suck, break-ups are also the best time to learn and grow. I wrote Break-up Rehab: Start over Stronger to support people through their pain and guide them to their victory. 

Where the money is going: 

  • 1000$ Editing Fee, 200$ formatting fee. 600$ design fee. 300$Create Space fee. 1000$ print fee. 200$ISBN tracking fee. 1000$ book tour/PR fee. 500$ 9% platform fee. Every dollar counts. Spread the good news about break-up. Let's meet and exceed this goal together! 
About the Author: 
  • I am an Intuitive Relationship Counselor with over a decade of experience in the field of Psychology and Spirituality. In my private practice, I help clients transform their lives. Everyone want's his or her relationship to be wonderful and it helps to remember that life--she's a naggy bitch. It's difficult to succeed. We all could use a little Rehab from time to time. 
  • If you've ever found yourself asking, "Why did my relationship really end?" "Why am I perpetually single?" "What does the other sex want from me?" or "How can I feel satisfied with my life?" Then this book is for you (and all of your friends and family who are asking the same questions.) 
  • With your generous contribute to this campaign you will be saving millions of broken-hearts. With your donation I will be able to publish this book and spread the good news that break-up can mean break-through and not break-down.  

BE THE HERO! 

Let's make this a win win! 

Break'n it down: 

  • I need 200 people to donate $25.00 ASAP so that I can pay for publishing, design fees, and a small book tour. If you can't donate PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD TO YOUR ENTIRE SOCIAL NETWORK!  Spread the word at:  http://thndr.it/1oysTQM  
  • Spread the word and help me get to $5000.00 ASAP! (at lease 10% funded in week one: Let's do it!) 
  • This book needs to happen. I believe in kick back. 
  • Kick back: 
  • $5.00--heal a broken heart!
  • $25.00--Start Over Stronger Bracelet
  • Many more great perks! The best being giving. 
  • Let's get to the mountain top. But If I only reach base camp, the funds will go directly to my editor Heather and artist Taylor. 

The Impact

Sometimes you can't be there for a friend who is really hurting after a break-up. Sometimes you can't listen to your friend complain about breaking-up one more time. This is the book you give to those hurting and who need real support (or the book you read yourself because you need those things too!) 

  • Once this book is published it will be the foundation of a movement. I plan on taking what I earn from the book and opening Break-up Rehab  Retreats and Centers. It is a big vision and you get to say, "I helped build that!" 
  • I am the queen of getting shit done. Let's do this together! 
  • True Love is possible. The twelve steps in Break-up Rehab: Start over stronger shows you how. 

Risks & Challenges

I believe in this with my whole heart. Believe with me! 

  • The challenge is getting enough commitment (Ironic right?) 
  • Sure, the economy isn't great and five dollars won't break the bank. 
  • I don't just need exposure. I need over exposure! 
  • Love and understanding. I just can't seem to get enough. 
If you can't shake your money maker shake your groove thang! 
  • Get our your mega phone and tell the world! 
  • Share on every social media network. Spread the love! 

Hugs and kisses and thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

  • For those of you who do not know me my name is Asia Igou, I am 22 years old going to school for media art and graphic design. I have created art and done creative writing for five years now and have found passion in both. I have struggled with body image and self esteem and know the negative impacts that the media can have on personal body image, and self love. It has been my dream to reach out to adolescence to teach them self love and acceptance at an early age. 
  • This campaign is to help me publish and make copies of the children's book I have written "All Sizes Cry" the book is geared towards ages 3-5 but can be helpful for just about anybody. It is about the differences we as people are gifted with and how that makes as all special and unique. Knowing that I could positively impact a young girl or boys life with the words in this book would mean the world to me. 
  • I cannot do this alone. I am a full time student with a part time job and simply do not have the funds to get this off the ground by myself, which is why I need your help! Your name will be inside of the book on the page of contributors to show my gratitude of your help. Think of all the children we could reach with just a small donation. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Funding will go to pay the illustrator of the book, the publishing company, the prints that need to be made, and my literary agent who is helping me work out all the details. I'm trying to raise 1,000 dollars for these expenses. 
  • Everyone who donates 20 or more dollars will get a signed copy of the book, and anyone who donates 50 or more will get a signed copy, and their name on the contributors page on the inside of the book. 
  • Any amount of money is helpful, if I do not reach my goal of 1,000 I will still get this book published no matter what it takes! The more money I have the more copies I can generate. 

The Impact

  • With your donation a young child somewhere will be able to read my words and realize that their traits are what make them unique. They will be better able to look at their bodies and realize that no two people are the same and that is what makes us all so special. "All Sizes Cry" is meant to generate self acceptance and to give children a better understanding of the concept before the media infiltrates their minds. 

Risks & Challenges


  • Challenges are sure to arise the first company I shoot for may not want to publish my book but I have a dear friend who knows people in the business and she is willing to search for every publishing company until we find one that fits. I am not one to give up, especially when it comes to something I am so passionate about.                                                                                                                     

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • I know I am not the only one with a tight budget and I understand of any of you cannot contribute financially but getting the word out to friends and family or letting me know of people in the industry you have connections with are all a great help to me as well! 
  • And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What and Who We Are

Parallel Planets — Counterparts & Coexistence of Worlds in Between

We are a conglomeration of creative oeuvres by various artists unravelled worldwide; a thoughtfully laid anatomical dissection of never-before-published pieces; an online planetarium that aims to derail from the usual, existing ones; a virtual manifesto that teleports an artist and his passion to another world, and; a visual vein that illuminates what it’s like to be in a parallel point of view.

We are based all over the world. We have writers and photographers from Singapore, Seattle, Manila, Florida, Illinois, & California and collaborators from Europe, Hong Kong, United States, and Vietnam. We have also featured over 120 artists from Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, France, Israel, Japan, Poland, Russia, South Korea, Spain, and United Kingdom, among many others.

We are a year-old independent web-based zine and we are compelled to create a tactile and tangible version of our publication to deliver to you, our readers.

What We Need

We are looking to raise $10,000, which would cover most of our printing costs, as well as pay our talented contributors. Our first print run will be 500 copies, though we'd love to print more if there's enough demand.

    What We'll Do

    Your support is essential to Parallel Planets' continued success. Through your contributions, we'll be able to:

    • Have Parallel Planets Issue Nº1 printed,
    • Do an overall makeover of our website, and
    • Continue printing our magazine once a year.

      What You'll Get

      We need your help to produce Parallel Planets Issue Nº1, but we wouldn’t dream of taking from you without giving something back. Depending on the amount you'll willingly contribute, you will be able to get these exclusive, limited, and possibly even personalized Parallel Planets merchandise:

      *Samples only. Designs may be updated later in the campaign.

      • Embroidered patches & temporary tattoos,
      • Postcards & stickers,
      • Button pins & stationery sets,
      • Shirts,
      • Tote bags,
      • Thermoplastic pendants & rings from Viva La Manika,
      • Mix CDs (with original/unreleased tracks from selected artists),
      • Parallel Planets Issue Nº1, and
      • Other rewards: signed photo prints & customized artworks from our roster of selected artists, ad spaces on Parallel Planets, and the privilege for you to become a Publisher in our masthead – both online and print,
      • Plus MORE special items to be announced soon!

            The Printed Issue

            Our approach to the Issue Nº1 goes back to the basics of Parallel Planets: monochrome matters, parallel perspectives, and spatial subjects. We spoke to our favourite artists whom we’ve featured since our website launched last October 2013 and they agreed to contribute something that coincides with our manifesto – all of which are exclusive and have never been published.

            Aside from putting the spotlight on our previously featured artists, we are also going to include special articles and photo essays by our staff. Issue Nº1 is going to be a mishmash of all things creative the way you haven’t seen before. We plan on releasing it by mid-2015.

            However, we don’t want to spoil the sense of surprise that you’ll experience when you flick through the “colourless” pages of Issue Nº1, so we’ll leave most things unannounced until you get your eyes and hands on the actual book.

              Risks & Challenges

              The magazine industry is a challenging one but we, over at Parallel Planets, are sincere and starving to conspire with your Universe. We hope that this Indiegogo campaign will help Parallel Planets gain more readership, establish a worldwide community, and create a space – both virtually and tangibly – for people to explore, share, and appreciate creativity from a new perspective.

              Parallel Planets is independent and currently ad-free but we are also working to build relationships with advertisers and sponsors to ensure that we’ll be printing for the years to come. We are positive that our fresh approach and the quality of our publication will result in success. We believe that there are enough like-minded people around the world who would help our project flourish. We hope you’ll join us.

                Other Ways You Can Help

                Aside from your generous monetary contributions, we would appreciate it if you could spread the word about our campaign to your friends and online followers.

                • Share this link.
                • Follow us on our social network (links below) to get updates.

                Thank you very much!

                Sincerely,
                The Parallel Planets Staff

                Our official Partner Site:


                Our official Media Sponsor:

story:
Thank you for considering contributing to this campaign! I have written the first two books to inspire readers to delve into long, nostalgic, and hopefully, enlightening conversations with their loved ones.  The first book will be published by May of 2019. It has been beautifully illustrated by Xitlhali Treviño (@xitlhali_trevino on Instagram) and is being designed by Jud Burgess (@judburgess on Instagram).  The book will be available in print and will be sold online, primarily. 

By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping to pay for:

  • the illustrator’s advance
  • graphic design
  • logo design
  • proof prints
  • rewards for contributors of this campaign 

Money that exceeds the goal will be used to establish a website for the book and to pay for the illustrations and design of the second volume.   Muñeca’s Books (munecas_books on Instagram), the publishing company, will serve other authors who want to self-publish and donate their proceeds to worthy causes.  

What are the first books about? 

The first two books are in English and Spanish and they are about my grandmother, Mama Clemen.  She was wise, open-minded,  and didn’t think children should be sheltered from the truth.  I have a lot of memories of her. I remember her taking us to an elderly neighbor’s funeral.  She told us to go to the open casket and say goodbye to our friend. I was four, maybe five.  My cousin was a year younger.  Yep. We were very little.  We had a ton of questions and she answered all of them and I don’t remember being haunted by the experience.  She demystified death and robbed it of its fear the way she demystified life - by talking about it.  It was like having our very own Mr. Rogers.

Photo: Mama Clemen in her kitchen.


Mama Clemén died when I was 13 and for decades, I’ve wanted  to share her with the world.  The first two books are about her through the eyes of the family dog, La Toma, and are based on the stories Mama Clemen and my mom shared with me.  They are set in the 1960s, a time when Cd. Juarez, Chihuanua was more rural, more ecologically diverse and so safe that dogs didn’t need leashes or fences.  While the family’s dog was a Pomeranian, the dog in the books is a Pit Bull because the breed is very close to my heart and is very much in need of a sweet poster child.  The picture below shows my mom and her sisters with one of La Toma's puppies, who looks like a Pit Bull, so I think La Toma would approve.

Photo: My mom and her sisters with one of La Toma's puppies.  Photo courtesy of Navarro Family. 

Photo: My cousins with La Toma.  Photo courtesy of Navarro Family.

Photo: My grandparents, Federico (Papa Vico) and Clementina (Mama Clemen) 

Why children’s books? 

I firmly believe that all of my academic and professional  achievements can be traced back to my grandmother’s kitchen.  It was there that I learned to love words.  Because of my quiet demeanor, I was allowed to listen to great storytelling.   

I don’t think anyone ever read to me.  I started school later than most kids.  I was a monolingual Spanish speaker.  I was raised by a working class single mom.  But none of that set me back because I arrived to school equipped with a large vocabulary and knowing how to pay attention to words and how they were spoken.   

We know that kids are sponges, but we can’t take for granted that kids see or absorb everything they need to or that they understand what they are seeing and feeling.  That’s where storytelling comes in.  Storytelling is such a powerful tool that it is one of the five recommendations of the science-based learning campaign, the Boston Basics, which is trying to close the skills gap between socio-economic, racial, and ethnic groups. (boston.thebasics.org) 

The challenge is that storytelling is not easy or natural for alot of us, including me.   This is complicated by the fact that most books for toddlers and early readers do not have much text and parents and grandparents don’t always know how to use them as a springboard for talking about their own experiences and memories.  

By including a lot of words in short stanzas, in both English and Spanish, and accompanying them with beautiful illustrations, I hope my books make storytelling easier, especially for working class families.

Tell us about yourself. 

I was born in El Paso, Texas and raised across the border in Cd. Juarez, Chihuahua by my mom and her parents.  My mom and I commuted to El Paso so that I would go to public school and she would go to work.  The commute was stressful and long, but necessary.  I graduated from Brown University with Honors and a double-concentration in Environmental Studies and Ethnic Studies.  I went on to The University of Texas School of Law and have been practicing law at Texas RioGrande Legal Aid, Inc. since 2004, where we provide free legal services to people who are poor.  After law school, I adopted Max, a Border Collie, Pit Bull mix who radically changed how I advocate for animals and the people who love and depend on them.  

Photo: Max, who bears a striking resemblance to La Toma's puppy.
story_txt:
Thank you for considering contributing to this campaign! I have written the first two books to inspire readers to delve into long, nostalgic, and hopefully, enlightening conversations with their loved ones.  The first book will be published by May of 2019. It has been beautifully illustrated by Xitlhali Treviño (@xitlhali_trevino on Instagram) and is being designed by Jud Burgess (@judburgess on Instagram).  The book will be available in print and will be sold online, primarily. By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping to pay for:
the illustrator’s advance
graphic design
logo design
proof prints
rewards for contributors of this campaign 
Money that exceeds the goal will be used to establish a website for the book and to pay for the illustrations and design of the second volume.   Muñeca’s Books (munecas_books on Instagram), the publishing company, will serve other authors who want to self-publish and donate their proceeds to worthy causes.  What are the first books about? The first two books are in English and Spanish and they are about my grandmother, Mama Clemen.  She was wise, open-minded,  and didn’t think children should be sheltered from the truth.  I have a lot of memories of her. I remember her taking us to an elderly neighbor’s funeral.  She told us to go to the open casket and say goodbye to our friend. I was four, maybe five.  My cousin was a year younger.  Yep. We were very little.  We had a ton of questions and she answered all of them and I don’t remember being haunted by the experience.  She demystified death and robbed it of its fear the way she demystified life - by talking about it.  It was like having our very own Mr. Rogers.Photo: Mama Clemen in her kitchen.Mama Clemén died when I was 13 and for decades, I’ve wanted  to share her with the world.  The first two books are about her through the eyes of the family dog, La Toma, and are based on the stories Mama Clemen and my mom shared with me.  They are set in the 1960s, a time when Cd. Juarez, Chihuanua was more rural, more ecologically diverse and so safe that dogs didn’t need leashes or fences.  While the family’s dog was a Pomeranian, the dog in the books is a Pit Bull because the breed is very close to my heart and is very much in need of a sweet poster child.  The picture below shows my mom and her sisters with one of La Toma's puppies, who looks like a Pit Bull, so I think La Toma would approve.Photo: My mom and her sisters with one of La Toma's puppies.  Photo courtesy of Navarro Family. Photo: My cousins with La Toma.  Photo courtesy of Navarro Family.Photo: My grandparents, Federico (Papa Vico) and Clementina (Mama Clemen) Why children’s books? I firmly believe that all of my academic and professional  achievements can be traced back to my grandmother’s kitchen.  It was there that I learned to love words.  Because of my quiet demeanor, I was allowed to listen to great storytelling.   I don’t think anyone ever read to me.  I started school later than most kids.  I was a monolingual Spanish speaker.  I was raised by a working class single mom.  But none of that set me back because I arrived to school equipped with a large vocabulary and knowing how to pay attention to words and how they were spoken.   We know that kids are sponges, but we can’t take for granted that kids see or absorb everything they need to or that they understand what they are seeing and feeling.  That’s where storytelling comes in.  Storytelling is such a powerful tool that it is one of the five recommendations of the science-based learning campaign, the Boston Basics, which is trying to close the skills gap between socio-economic, racial, and ethnic groups. (boston.thebasics.org) The challenge is that storytelling is not easy or natural for alot of us, including me.   This is complicated by the fact that most books for toddlers and early readers do not have much text and parents and grandparents don’t always know how to use them as a springboard for talking about their own experiences and memories.  By including a lot of words in short stanzas, in both English and Spanish, and accompanying them with beautiful illustrations, I hope my books make storytelling easier, especially for working class families.Tell us about yourself. I was born in El Paso, Texas and raised across the border in Cd. Juarez, Chihuahua by my mom and her parents.  My mom and I commuted to El Paso so that I would go to public school and she would go to work.  The commute was stressful and long, but necessary.  I graduated from Brown University with Honors and a double-concentration in Environmental Studies and Ethnic Studies.  I went on to The University of Texas School of Law and have been practicing law at Texas RioGrande Legal Aid, Inc. since 2004, where we provide free legal services to people who are poor.  After law school, I adopted Max, a Border Collie, Pit Bull mix who radically changed how I advocate for animals and the people who love and depend on them.  Photo: Max, who bears a striking resemblance to La Toma's puppy.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tonya McClearin. I grew up in Dayton, Ohio, one of six children. As an overweight child I faced bullying from other children and adults in my family. Then there was the sexual abuse. As a child, I tried to forget what I endured. I wanted to pretend it wasn't happening. I was an angry child. I would fight anyone that posed as a threat, even as an adult. It wasn't until my own two children were nearly grown that I found out that I needed to examine who and what I had become. I have always known the was a nice, sincere and gentle person on the inside, now I needed to bring that person to the surface. When I finally stopped and looked in the mirror, physically looked in the mirror, the first time I didn't recognize who that person was. It wasn't until I took a second look that I realized the person I wanted to become. I knew my life was not going in the direction I had desired for myself. It was time for a change. My connection with God gave me the strength to find the true me, the person I was always meant to be. Finally, I discovered that I deserve to live my life the way I had always wanted it to be.

Writing this book has given me a purpose in life. It has shown me how I can help others, not just through my writing, but as a future speaker who is willing to share the uncertainty of the past, and hope for the future. My trust in God has only become stronger as I share the often painful and burdensome reality of my past. Through God's strength I have learned that even in the most dire of circumstance you can overcome anything, and that we are all loved, no matter what choices we make in life.

Your contribution to this project will help me to establish myself as an author, mentor and speaker. Something I had never dreamed of being just a short time ago.  I hope to encourage and inspire others to achieve their goals, not matter what walk of life they may come from. I am ready to start a new journey as I forgo the past.

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $2,500 to cover the cost of editing, printing, typesetting, and publishing of my book. Part of the funds will also cover the cost of the book launching. I want to start of on the right foot by making this book a celebration of my life.  

For a $20 donation you will receive a signed copy of my book. For a $50 donation you will not only receive a signed copy, but also a chance to mingle with my family and friends as we celebrate a new chapter in my life. For $100 you will be invited to also break bread (have dinner) with me and my closest friends to celebrate this new day. For a $250 donation, you will receive the book, cocktail party, dinner and a "Thank you for helping to fund this project" inside the book that will forever be a reminder that I could not have done this alone, and that someone is always there to have your back. 

Most of the funds will go toward the editing, formatting and printing. My book cover is complete. If I don't reach my goal, I will not give up. I will move forward with my book. However, for those who would like to share this journey with me, donating for a book will go a long way. 

The Impact

It is time for me to give back. It is time to show the world that I have changed. I know I have it in me, and I know I can make a difference for others by sharing my journey. I have learned to accept others for who they are, the mistakes I've made  and to accept who I am. I have learned to appreciate the blessings that I failed to realize in the past. 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks associated with anything. I would be a fool to say there is none with this project. There is never a guarantee when it comes to anything we attempt in life. But I am determined to make my book, my future a success. I will publish this book, even if I have to wait a little long to make it happen on my own. I will not be discouraged. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you cannot financial help fund my project. All I ask is that you share it with those that are not burdened with financial obstacles. Please ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. I want to show the world I can make a difference in the lives of others.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Story of Stirring the Pot

Stirring the Pot is a book for women of all ages. It will inspire you to stir things up, helping you to recognize the value of your own life and find your simple purpose. 

My name is Traci Mitchell and I am the author of Stirring the Pot. I wrote this book because I believe women are wonders of the world. We don invisible capes. Yet, we forget our powers, our gifts. We get lost in other people’s opinions and beliefs. Women are capable of making what may seem impossible, possible. It’s as simple as believing in yourself and finding others to cheer you on. 

My hope is that, in reading Stirring the Pot, you will hear something and you will feel something in the soul stirring stories of women who reveal their vulnerabilities and their courage. I hope to instill in you the passion and excitement that I felt while hearing stories of so many women who once stumbled and fell or were battered and bruised but are now living on purpose. Ultimately, I want you to see Stirring the Pot as a tool to help you unearth your own purpose and live it everyday.

In Stirring the Pot, you'll learn about women who are killing it in their personal and professional lives. You'll hear stories like...
  • My interview with Oprah who talks about what she’s doing that most of us are not. 
  • An entrepreneur who made hooch in her bedroom at 12 years old and is now reaching for new heights that may include billionaire status. 
  • A woman who took years to figure out that she is enough.
  • And, my personal stories of struggles and triumphs. 
You will love Stirring the Pot if you’re trying to find meaning in your life, if you want to uncover your own gifts and if you love a good story of women succeeding.

Stirring the Pot is a nonfiction book that speaks to women of all ages who want to wake up from their daily grind, get unstuck and find joy and meaning in their lives.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 paperback copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Smart, persistent, and always enthusiastic, Traci excels at efficiently examining and assessing situations, utilizing creative ways to tackle seemingly impossible tasks. She’s not afraid to stir the pot if she knows something good is cooking on the other side. Helping women unearth their gifts is a genuine source of joy for her which is why she wrote Stirring the Pot. She hopes the words and wisdom spoken in the book will inspire women around the world in believing the impossible is possible and spark a fire in pursuing their passions and purpose. 

With her background as an Emmy award-winning journalist, Traci prides herself on being an eloquent communicator, and a strategic thinker. She loves hearing a good story.  Over the years, she has heard some of the deepest secrets and the most incredible successes. 

Traci has endless energy and positivity.  She also has a deep appreciation and love for her southern roots in New Orleans where she believes good people and good food go hand in hand. 

Traci sincerely values time spent with her husband and children, which is why she often volunteers for events and activities at her children’s school. Her altruism doesn't end with her own family, as her efforts extend to a membership with the Junior League of Washington—a local organization that focuses on funding resources for complex literacy issues for all age groups. 

Since she was a young child learning to read, Traci's imagination has always run wild when she curls up with a good book. When she wants to quiet the noise, she pulls out her sewing machine and morphs into her creative maker side.

Connect with Traci at tracimmitchell@gmail.com by email and at tracimitchella on Instagram and linkedin.com/in/traci-mitchell-19231011 on LinkedIn.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #stirringthepot and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support! It means that world to me!

Thanks again,

Traci

story:
Story of My Book

After a series of traumatic concussions, the direction of my life was forever altered. I Need a Walk explores my personal journey of healing, by way of backpacking the length of New Zealand’s South Island.

My name is Claire Lewinski and I am the author of I Need A Walk. I wrote this book because I felt unseen and misunderstood after my brain injuries. I’m hoping my story can help others feel validated and show the possibility of resiliency.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the truth behind living with a brain injury and the difficult process of recovery. I want you to see this book as inspiration and an opportunity to overcome hardship, escape from personal lock down, and learn alongside me about the importance of healing, in your own way. 

In this book, you will encounter multifaceted dimensions of identity and adventure through narratives like:

  • How my concussions severely impacted my well-being — challenging how I defined myself when I could no longer work, go to school, exercise, or even communicate in the same way; 
  • How subtle impacts and slip ups, caused by my brain injuries, severely impacted my decision making skills leading me question my ability to live independently;
  • Overcoming the natural challenges faced hiking through the Southern Alps, including river crossings, cyclones, and uncontrollable diarrhea, as well as the incredible moments of silence in the mountains, filtering through the light of the rising sun. 


You will love this book if you are passionate about mental health, feel a connection with nature, and like a good adventure. 

I Need a Walk speaks to people coming of age and survivors who want to grapple with finding themselves and healing from trauma in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that I Need a Walk inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How are you seizing your struggle?
  • How do you define personal success?
  • Why is mental health a luxury?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing mental health, recovery, and exploration will change us all for the better. 
 

The Book - I Need A Walk


The book is written in four parts.

Part 1 Reward  to Resting. As a young adult, I’m just trying to find my place in the world. I discuss how my life began to unravel as I tried to navigate a concussion. I was forced to realize how serious the injury was and start making adjustments in my life. 

Part 2 Finding the Sun to Entering the New. One concussion turned out to be three separate concussions, leading to a traumatic brain injury diagnosis and long lasting impacts. I took my recovery seriously, going through therapy and continuing on with life, learning the value of a supportive community and advocating for myself. 

Part 3 The Beginning to Hike Your Own Hike. I found a way to continue my recovery by backpacking over 800 miles, the length of the South Island of New Zealand, with a dear friend. I continued to struggle with my head, but found the space to really start healing. As I climbed mountains, experienced trail magic and unexpected challenges, I regained my sense of identity and confidence, realizing the unstoppable power of a human being. 

Part 4 is an afterword, glancing into my life after the walk and how I’ve continued to heal, thrive, and find my own way. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021. 

  • The cover design of my book; (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats);
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication;
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish;
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments;
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback;
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title;
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process;
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Claire Lewinski is finishing her chemical engineering degree remotely from New Zealand. She has had the opportunity to advocate for issues she’s passionate about including sexual violence, science policy, and conservation. 

She decided to share her story in hopes that brain injuries will become less stigmatized. Ultimately, helping others overcome hardship. 

Claire is always up for an adventure and tries to go backpacking whenever she can get a few days off. Recently, she’s become obsessed with Brazilian Jiu Jitsu as she notices it continues to help with her recovery. She is fueled by dark chocolate and bad jokes. 

For more information, you can connect with Claire at clairelewinski.4@gmail.com, or connect through LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/claire-lewinski-231..., Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/claire.lewi8, or Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/claire_lewi/. 

 

International Preorders 

For international preorders outside of the United States or New Zealand, please send me a private message. Shipping is included for those in the United States and New Zealand. 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ineedawalk and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Claire Lewinski

SUMMARY

Children’s literature gives children the opportunity to consider and respond to their world. Through storytelling, children’s literature introduces problem-solving by putting the protagonist in the position to address a perceived problem. By providing relatable stories with engaging characters, children are given the opportunity to explore and develop emotional intelligence and strategies to improve themselves. 

The authors have a goal to create a children's book chronicling the journey of Nia on her journey to be of service and teaching the less fortunate how to find purpose in their life. 

We thank you for your consideration of supporting this book project and impact the lives of children through quality literature. 

We thank you for your consideration of supporting this book project and impact the lives of children through quality literature.

We are seeking $8,500 to help us write, design, and produce the books and other items at a healthy enough volume that we can be sustainable and continue to print and share the products in the future.  An illustrator will be added to the team to design the cover and interior pages.

Dr. Nia Bailey | Nonprofit & Community Leader

Dr. Nia Bailey is a passionate community leader and servant. She has a deep passion to work with homeless community through outreach and education. story:
About the Author

 Tanner Roan is a community leader from St. Petersburg, FL. He is the founder of Ecstatic Dance St. Pete and works as a freelance writer and designer. He is incredibly passionate about self-work and aspires to be the best person he can be. He has presented transformative workshops across the country and is currently working to help improve the lives of others through writing. 

Growing up, Tanner was perhaps the last person you'd expect to be hosting a popular dance event or presenting workshops on self-development. He was reserved, quiet, and suffered from bouts of severe depression, social anxiety, and suicidal ideation. He was reclusive and anti-social, and up until about 20 years old, severely overweight. 

As a young adult, Tanner began his journey of self-development. He dropped his excess weight, began researching into psychology, spirituality, philosophy, and began experimenting with yoga and psychedelics to gain a deeper insight into the nature of reality and into himself.

Over the years, Tanner has been exploring different ways to improve himself, first to be able to function as a "normal" adult and then to improve himself to be able to better spread seeds of transformation to those who would benefit.

Today, Tanner employs many practices in order to function at his best including dance, writing, yoga, meditation, and more - all modalities exploring flow states. His goal is to reach as many people as possible who would benefit from his experience and story. 

Here's a quote from Tanner:

"In my adolescence, I always felt like an outcast. I went without a true feeling of belonging until my early twenties when I finally began connecting with my self and with my tribes - when I finally built up enough courage to form my own sense of identity. In my work and my writing, it is my prime purpose to lend to my readers the agency to form their own identity, to live genuinely, and find what it truly means to be happy - to be who they are and love it."

 

About the Letters

I began “letters to my self” as a daily writing practice to bring attention to self-talk; as well as, the importance and impact of positive self-talk.

We all have a problem at times with being too hard on ourselves. If we were to talk to other people the way we often talk to ourselves, those people may never speak to us again. We should treat ourselves the way we treat those we love and avoid perpetuating negativity within us which only serves to take away from our happiness. If anything, this is a project about self-love. It’s about loving your self.

As you begin to improve your self-talk, you frame your experience with positivity. You can begin to see obstacles not as challenges to overcome, but opportunities for growth. You learn to build yourself up rather than putting yourself down. You stop beating yourself up for little things and start encouraging yourself to do bigger and better things.

Through these letters, I show how I talk with myself and share the messages I need to hear. I play with notions of self to express the balance between perceptions of self, between ego and soul, between self and other. I aim to blur the boundary lines between these to release an underlying message of love and oneness. That in writing to myself, I am also writing to you.

These letters are all raw, unedited, messages of positivity between my selves. They are spiritual in nature, as I take the time to allow connection with my intuition, with my unconscious, higher self, in order to express the truth I see. I write them to remind myself of beauty and love. I write them to keep myself on track and doing what matters. I write them so that I remember who I am and why I do what I do. I write them for myself, but just as much, I write them for you.

I hope that through these letters, you may look at and improve your own self-talk. I hope you take the time to connect with yourself and realize just how miraculous you really are, what you’re capable of. I hope you realize how much I love you.

The world can often seem a divided place. People can seem hateful and mean. But these expressions we see are reflections of internal states. People are mean because they’re mean to themselves, because they haven’t been shown another way. The world is becoming ever more loving and open, and it begins with you. With the way you talk to your self.

Love your self.

 

Check them out for yourself

I posted a website with all the letters available for public viewing, for free - 
https://loveyourselfletters.com/
 

Publishing 

I want to get these letters out to whomever could benefit from them, in front of whomever will appreciate them. To do that, I would like to order an initial run of 100 art-style books, which will cost roughly $1200 - or 500 for roughly $3600, depending on how much we can raise. There will be additional costs for professional image editing and marketing , but I am only asking for help with the initial publishing costs.

How you can help

The most straight forward way is by making a donation to the campaign and preorder a book. Otherwise, simply sharing the campaign and sending it out to your friends would also help out immensley.

story:
Story of My Book

My book The Child in Us: A Collection of Stories About Happiness is a compilation of stories chronicling people’s happiness journeys in life. It tells the stories of people who I greatly admire as they find and remember their own happiness despite harsh circumstances in life. 

My name is Elizabeth Lucy Ivanecky, and I am the author of The Child in Us. I wrote this book because I want more people, especially young people, to have the opportunity to reflect on their happiness and what happiness means to them. I want to show that even though we may not have our paths fully figured out in life that we are not any less valuable than those who do. Wouldn’t it be great if today’s youth could create more opportunities to understand each other, and our individual paths, without casting judgment? And even better, if young people could learn early on the importance that happiness plays throughout the rest of their life! It would certainly save them so much time and energy in the long run.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what happiness means to you. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to remember your inner child and keep that child alive within you. 

About My Book

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of happiness and unhappiness, acceptance and judgment, and innocence and experience through narratives like:

  • Haley Newlin, who has come such a long way from her days as a writing intern at several magazines, to writing her second novel, “Take Your Turn, Teddy.” Through her main character, she shared her struggles with depression and anxiety in her first horror novel “Not Another Sarah Halls” as a way to help her readers overcome their own struggles and fears. It was also incredible to hear about the wonderful people who support her in life like her twin sister, Hanna, and boyfriend, Jeremy.
  • Tanveer Kalo, whose joy comes from learning and writing about the relatively untold history of his American-Indian community in the U.S. His passion for these stories sprouted from his own family tree which continue to grow the more he learns about his ancestors, their struggles, their joys, and their quest for the American Dream.

Audience

You will love this book if you are interested in reflecting on, understanding, and remembering your own happiness. As you read these stories of other people’s happiness, I challenge you to take ownership over your own journey and story and reflect on who you are as a person. If you’re not where you want to be in life, you are never too young or old to make a positive change.

The Child in Us speaks to people of all ages who are interested in staying connected to their inner child while finding and remembering their happiness. It is an especially important message for young people to learn sooner, rather than later in life.

Ultimately, I hope that The Child in Us inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What does happiness mean to you?
  • How do you keep your inner child alive while at the same time being a responsible, passionate adult?
  • How can I be happy even if I don’t have the things that I want yet in life?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing happiness, our inner child, and our journeys as a work of art, will change us all for the better. 

The Book - The Child in Us

The book is written in 3 Parts:

  • Part 1 contains my author’s note, introduction and Chapters 1-5. Here you’ll learn about how I remembered my own happiness and the start of my book writing journey. You’ll meet young people who have just graduated from college and are entering the workforce. They are still early on in their journeys and are still in the process of understanding their own happiness.
  • Part 2 contains Chapters 6-10. Here you’ll meet people who have reflected more on their happiness and are actively pursuing their happiness.
  • Part 3 contains Chapters 11-13 and the conclusion. Here you’ll meet people who are living out their happiness and looking back in time and remembering their journey — both the difficult times and the good times. I’ll also share what I’ve learned in the process of writing this book while having the opportunity to reflect on my own happiness.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish ebook and paperback editions. 

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will publish ebook, paperback, and hardcover editions. 

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish ebook, paperback, hardcover, and audiobook editions.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Elizabeth Lucy Ivanecky is a professional writer who has had a passion for the English language, storytelling, and writing, ever since her father told her and her brothers bedtime stories. She is a creative writer who sees a future filled with possibilities. She has always believed in the magic and wonder of storytelling, to dare people to love more, and to be kinder to one another. This passion is what has led her to writing about other people’s happiness journeys, and keeping the inner child alive. Elizabeth “not so” secretly vows to never grow up. She plans to always play in the fantastical realms of her wildest childhood imagination. In writing about the happiness journeys of other people, she is reminded to continue writing stories that will always enchant the little girl dearest to her heart. Herself.

For more information, you can connect with Elizabeth at her email address elizabethivanecky.author@gmail.com and on her social media platforms.

LinkedIn       

Twitter

Facebook
Instagram

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheChildInUs and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

With love,
Elizabeth Lucy Ivanecky

story:
Update: November 26

Thank you SO much for helping me achieve my initial goal of $5000!! Each of your contributions helped me get here and I cannot thank you enough. 

While my goal was $5000, please continue to support my book and share it with your communities! $7,000 of the proceeds will go to my editors, publishers, and illustrators, so let's aim to reach $8000 worth of purchases for The Rector Girls. 

As of November 26, you have purchased 119 copies of The Rector Girls, can we make it 200?! Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

Short Summary

The Rector Girls tells the story of an extraordinary woman who dedicated her life to serving others and the impact her legacy had on her daughter. The death of Grace’s mother took a toll on her life and fueled Grace’s journey to discover how to carry on her mom’s legacy. 

My name is Grace Mariana Rector and I am the author of The Rector Girls. I wrote this book because I wanted to share the spectacular lessons on family, honesty, generosity, independence, and more that my mom taught me throughout her life. The wisdom she carried inspired everyone around her, and I want to pass that wisdom along so her memory never dies.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the intimate bond between my single mom and I, and learn what family means along the way. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement I have for storytelling, traveling, loving friends and family, and even talking with strangers. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you realize that you cannot control life, but you can control how you react to its ups and downs. My mom faced limitless setbacks, but she always remained calm, only changing what she could control.

In this book, you'll learn about the importance of traveling and never taking life too seriously. You'll hear stories such as...

  • When my mom was in the hospital, I came to visit her. But rather than be sad and apologetic that her health had failed her, she and I decided to have fun, so I went shopping and made a nice picnic on the hospital side table! After eating our fun array of meats and cheeses, I crawled into her hospital bed and we watched a romantic comedy.
  • The time I got stuck on the Bolivian-Chilean border and had to hitchhike 7 hours in a 16-wheeler cargo truck.
  • My entire family, except my mom, is an adopted family, because my mom handpicked her tribe and invested in those relationships so I’d have a support network, even after she left me.

You will love this book if you care about untraditional families if you love hearing about travel adventures, and if you’re a romantic, just like me. The Rector Girls is a creative nonfiction book that speaks to young women exploring their journey forward and to adults reflecting on how they want to be remembered. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring!

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Grace Rector is a senior at the Georgetown School of Foreign Service studying Culture and Politics with a minor in Education, Inquiry and Justice. She currently works at the Beeck Center for Social Impact and Innovation as a Student Analyst and plans to pursue a career in international service. She will graduate in May 2021 with a Bachelor’s of Science in Foreign Service.

Grace has been writing since she was 6 years old when she would write about barbies and princesses. Now, as a young adult, Grace decided to hone in on her passion for writing and connect it with her desire to honor her mom through a story on her life and legacy. Grace hopes that this book will not only show the beauty of a non-traditional family but that readers will feel called to love each other more deeply and to take charge of their lives and make their dreams happen. 

Outside of school and work, Grace loves to sing and perform in improvisation groups! Her friends have heard her travel stories a million times, as Grace has been to 50+ countries. Still, listen in because Grace tells the story a little differently each time to keep even her closest friends engaged. Random facts about Grace: She doesn’t like chocolate (except brownies), she speaks some Arabic and Bosnian, and she loves the color red.

For more information, you can connect with Grace Rector at gracerector@gmail.com and at @The_Rector_Girls or @GlobalGraceGazette.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheRectorGirls and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Grace Mariana Rector
