story:
Story of My Book

The Nature of Work In The 21st Century…thinking of organizations as organisms is about a new solution to a very human problem — how do we collaborate more effectively to achieve shared goals? My name is Greg Morris and I am the author of The Nature of Work In The 21st Century. I wrote this book because organizations and individuals are in dire need of an ability to adapt more quickly to change. We need new approaches to tackle the unprecedented extent of technology and pandemic driven change that we’re facing. Just working harder is not sustainable.

My book frames a new way of thinking about work, meaning efforts to achieve goals. This perspective enables a shared understanding of the work required to achieve goals. As a result, we can be more aligned, productive, and more likely to achieve goals effectively by simply thinking differently.

I will share how my work in medicine, health care, and consulting have defined the perspectives painted throughout the book. For example, the approach to enhancing problem-solving and value creation in business is modeled after how physicians learn to diagnose problems in the human body. I hope reading this book will instill in you the passion and excitement that I have for exploring the world by thinking differently.

You will love this book if you enjoy exploring different points of view,  you need to be a more effective problem solver, or you are just looking for something different to read on a quiet weekend. 

The Nature of Work In The 21st Century is a nonfiction book that speaks to business leaders and individual agents who want to lead, work in, and collaborate with organizations focused on creating value in the 21st-century economy. This book also offers a framework for students to understand leadership, management, and execution in a new way. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you be your best self — as an individual with big goals, as a team, or as a whole organization.

The Book - The Nature Of Work In The 21st Century

My book is written in three parts.

Part I: Work and organizations are human…
In Chapters 1-2, I offer a perspective that presents work and organizations as intrinsic elements of human existence. My goal is to help you see past all the complexity and see work and organizations as manifestations of our humanity. For example, for as long as we have been human, we have “worked” to meet our needs and have “organized” to do that work. Here we are, many thousands of years later, still organizing to do work to meet our needs. 

PART II: Work has changed...the system, not so much… 
In Chapters 3-5, we will bring into focus the paradigm — Frederick Taylor’s Scientific Management — that defines how we work in organizations. Our focus on efficiency, adherence to hierarchy, and predilection for bureaucracy are derivatives of this 100+ years old way of doing business. We will explore how the current system was designed with efficiency in mind, but how now, with the evolution of our economy, it undermines the effectiveness of knowledge work and problem-solving. We will consider this dilemma from an organizational perspective and from a knowledge worker point of view. We also will consider the role of ambiguity in suppressing productivity.

PART III: A choice to think differently (about the system)…
In Chapters 6-9, we will stop to consider how every major advancement in human history is rooted in people embracing a new way of thinking. One example is that, at one time, we believed that the earth was at the center of the universe. Advances in communications and space travel would not have been possible without continuously relearning and redefining the way that we think. We will consider how frameworks play a critical role in disseminating and creating shared knowledge. I will introduce a framework for understanding how we can collaborate to achieve goals more effectively. Finally, we will look toward a better understanding of major trends or headwinds that we face. We will explore how we can use this framework to create greater value as we move further into the 21st century.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021 spring
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in the spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. If together we exceed these targets in the next 30 days that comprise this campaign, excess funds will go to one or more not-for-profit organizations or causes that you will help me select.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Greg Morris is a partner in MorrisHuml LLC, a business advisory firm focused on helping clients to achieve goals more effectively. The partners establish an environment in which leaders learn muscle memory for working together, how to function as a high performing unit, and how to engage their teams in building new performance-based habits.

Greg’s original career goal was to better understand the big picture view of the US health care system in order to fix it. An unanticipated byproduct of his journey has been to see organizations and how they operate to create value, as seen through the lens of someone without a business education. He started with limited knowledge about how organizations work and has since become a foremost thought leader in his comparison of organizations to the human body.

Greg has three passions. He works extensively to make a difference by giving his skills and talents to not-for-profit organizations. He loves learning new things, in particular how things work. He loves being with his young grandkids; he has lots of experience playing variations of ghostbusters, hiding, and whatever their developing minds imagine.

For more information, you can connect with Greg Morris at greg.morris@morrisstandardmethod.org and on LinkedIn and Facebook.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheNatureofWork and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Greg Morris

story:
Who is Heather?

As a teen girl Heather was bullied and excluded by her peers. But instead of being crushed by those experiences, she found herself surrounded by big sisters in the faith who walked with her and helped her overcome those challenges. Now Heather is passionate about helping young women overcome their struggles and live their God-given dreams. She does this through motivational speaking, book writing and life coaching.

Short Summary

"Letters from a Big Sister: Shared wisdom to Encourage and Equip Teen Girls" is a book birthed out of a dream to connect big sisters in the faith with their little sisters. Each chapter begins with a letter written from a big sister sharing a struggle she went through as a teenager and the truth she wishes she would have known then that could have helped her through. Our hope is that these stories will remind teen girls that they are not alone and there are other women who believe in them and are cheering them on. 

Our Big Sisters are: Jess Connolly, Jamie Ivey, Kristene DiMarco, Jenna Kutcher, Jessica Honneger, Tiffany Thurston, Rach Kincaid, Leslie Crandall, Carrie Lloyd, Lauren Vallotton, Summer Wright, Hannah Giddens, Alisha Mckay and Shezza Ansloos. (read more about them under "Contributors")

When you contribute to this project you are becoming a big sister or big brother to these little sisters. You are saying to the teen girls in your life, whether daughters, grand daughters, sisters, nieces or cousins, that you believe in them and want them to live their best lives.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $20,000 to cover the cost of design, editing, publishing and printing the first run of 1000 books. Heather has been working on this book since January 2017 and has personally invested about $10,000 into the project so far (design, editing and some of the publishing costs). To print the first 1000 copies will cost just over $10,000 so that is what we are hoping to raise with this campaign. 

When you contribute to this campaign you get discount pricing on the book, fun perks (bonus chapter, free ebook, digital prints and more), plus access to our exclusive "SISTER" sweatshirts at wholesale pricing.

All money raised will go towards printing the first 1000 copies of the book, whether our goal is met or not. 

The Impact

"Letters" is unlike any book on the market right now for teen girls. Not only is it a full colour book with beautiful images and design, it is full of raw and vulnerable stories addressing the issues teen girls face, but rarely feel safe to talk about. The book covers topics like anxiety, body image, sexuality, family challenges, dating, and more from a biblical perspective. At the end of each chapter is a section set aside for different reflection activities such as bullet journal pages, scriptures for further study, action steps and song suggestions. 

Risks & Challenges

Some of the challenges with this book will be getting the word out beyond Heather's personal platform. Because we are publishing with a small Canadian publishing house rather than a larger American publisher, we'll definitely need your help in spreading the word! 

By having each of our 14 contributors share on their platforms we will be able to get the word out beyond where any one of us could on our own. And with your help there's no telling how far this message will spread!

We also plan to do radio and TV interviews, contact church youth groups to buy books for small group studies or grad gifts, advertise on social media and more. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone will be able to contribute financially to this project but another powerful way to help is by sharing this campaign with your circle of friends. Posting about it on facebook or instagram, or telling your church youth pastor will make a huge difference in getting the word out! 

Also if you have connections to any local media outlets, or people you think we should connect with, please don't hesitate to reach out and let us know. 

Contributors

Jess Connolly - Author of "Dance, Stand, Run" and "Wild and Free".

Jamie Ivey - Author of "If You Only Knew" & host of The Happy Hour podcast.

Kristene DiMarco - Worship leader and songwriter w/ Bethel Music.

Jenna Kutcher - Photographer, online educator & podcast host of The Goal Digger podcast.

Jessica Honneger - Founder and CEO of Noonday Collection and Author of "Imperfect Courage".

Tiffany Thurston - Speaker, worship leader and champion of young women. 

Rach Kincaid - Blogger, truth teller, mama of 6 and mentor to teen girls.

Leslie Crandall - Overseer of one of the largest ministry schools in America (BSSM).

Carrie Lloyd - Author or "Prude" and "The Virgin Monologues", life coach & pastor at Bethel Church. 

Lauren Vallotton - Pastor at Bethel Church and host on Bethel TV.

Summer Wright - Wife, mother, film producer and advocate for hope and redemption. 

Hannah Giddens - Pastor at BSSM, mama of 5 and encourager of women.

Alisha Mckay - Wife, mama and Marriage and Family therapist. 

Shezza Ansloos - Guidance counselor, published author, singer/song writer & painter.

Now Heather is passionate about helping young women overcome their struggles and live their God-given dreams. She does this through motivational speaking, book writing and life coaching.
Short Summary

"Letters from a Big Sister: Shared wisdom to Encourage and Equip Teen Girls" is a book birthed out of a dream to connect big sisters in the faith with their little sisters. Each chapter begins with a letter written from a big sister sharing a struggle she went through as a teenager and the truth she wishes she would have known then that could have helped her through. Our hope is that these stories will remind teen girls that they are not alone and there are other women who believe in them and are cheering them on. 
Our Big Sisters are: Jess Connolly, Jamie Ivey, Kristene DiMarco, Jenna Kutcher, Jessica Honneger, Tiffany Thurston, Rach Kincaid, Leslie Crandall, Carrie Lloyd, Lauren Vallotton, Summer Wright, Hannah Giddens, Alisha Mckay and Shezza Ansloos. (read more about them under "Contributors")
When you contribute to this project you are becoming a big sister or big brother to these little sisters. You are saying to the teen girls in your life, whether daughters, grand daughters, sisters, nieces or cousins, that you believe in them and want them to live their best lives.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $20,000 to cover the cost of design, editing, publishing and printing the first run of 1000 books. Heather has been working on this book since January 2017 and has personally invested about $10,000 into the project so far (design, editing and some of the publishing costs). To print the first 1000 copies will cost just over $10,000 so that is what we are hoping to raise with this campaign. 
When you contribute to this campaign you get discount pricing on the book, fun perks (bonus chapter, free ebook, digital prints and more), plus access to our exclusive "SISTER" sweatshirts at wholesale pricing.
All money raised will go towards printing the first 1000 copies of the book, whether our goal is met or not. 

The Impact
"Letters" is unlike any book on the market right now for teen girls. Not only is it a full colour book with beautiful images and design, it is full of raw and vulnerable stories addressing the issues teen girls face, but rarely feel safe to talk about. The book covers topics like anxiety, body image, sexuality, family challenges, dating, and more from a biblical perspective. At the end of each chapter is a section set aside for different reflection activities such as bullet journal pages, scriptures for further study, action steps and song suggestions. 


Risks & Challenges
Some of the challenges with this book will be getting the word out beyond Heather's personal platform. Because we are publishing with a small Canadian publishing house rather than a larger American publisher, we'll definitely need your help in spreading the word! 
By having each of our 14 contributors share on their platforms we will be able to get the word out beyond where any one of us could on our own. And with your help there's no telling how far this message will spread!
We also plan to do radio and TV interviews, contact church youth groups to buy books for small group studies or grad gifts, advertise on social media and more. 

Other Ways You Can Help
We know that not everyone will be able to contribute financially to this project but another powerful way to help is by sharing this campaign with your circle of friends. Posting about it on facebook or instagram, or telling your church youth pastor will make a huge difference in getting the word out! 
Also if you have connections to any local media outlets, or people you think we should connect with, please don't hesitate to reach out and let us know. 
Contributors
Jess Connolly - Author of "Dance, Stand, Run" and "Wild and Free".
Jamie Ivey - Author of "If You Only Knew" & host of The Happy Hour podcast.
Kristene DiMarco - Worship leader and songwriter w/ Bethel Music.
Jenna Kutcher - Photographer, online educator & podcast host of The Goal Digger podcast.
Jessica Honneger - Founder and CEO of Noonday Collection and Author of "Imperfect Courage".
Tiffany Thurston - Speaker, worship leader and champion of young women. 
Rach Kincaid - Blogger, truth teller, mama of 6 and mentor to teen girls.
Leslie Crandall - Overseer of one of the largest ministry schools in America (BSSM).
Carrie Lloyd - Author or "Prude" and "The Virgin Monologues", life coach & pastor at Bethel Church. 
Lauren Vallotton - Pastor at Bethel Church and host on Bethel TV.
Summer Wright - Wife, mother, film producer and advocate for hope and redemption. 
Hannah Giddens - Pastor at BSSM, mama of 5 and encourager of women.
Alisha Mckay - Wife, mama and Marriage and Family therapist. 
Shezza Ansloos - Guidance counselor, published author, singer/song writer & painter.

Short Summary

The Changing Face of Power explores the power, influence, and visibility of the new generation of Latinx leaders in the United States while deconstructing what Latinx Excellence really means, who it’s for, and how the contributions of Millennial and Generation Z Latinx leaders are profoundly impacting the trajectory of the United States.

My name is Claudia Alarco Alarco and I am the author of The Changing Face of Power. I wrote this book because Millennial and Generation Z Latinxs in the United States are fundamentally transforming this nation and they’re doing so in ways that are more disruptive, innovative, and inclusive than ever before.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover and realize the limitless power and potential of Millennial and Gen Z Latinx leaders, while also learning about the ways in which this new generation of Latinx leaders are leading the fight for a more inclusive redefinition of what it means to be Latinx in the United States.

In this book, I hope to instill the same passion and excitement that I have for the deconstruction of Latinx Excellence in you. I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand how Latinx Excellence has perpetuated white supremacy and the deeply rooted anti-blackness within the Latinx community and how we can begin to dismantle this and redefine Latinx Power.

You will love this book if you are passionate about the power that the new generation of Latinx leaders hold in this country, if you are committed to uplifting and elevating all Latinx voices and if you are invested in seeing a progressive and inclusive change in this community and in the United States at large.

The Changing Face of Power is a non-fiction book that speaks to those in the Latinx community who are aware and cognizant of the systems of power that intentionally oppress those who are not proximate to whiteness and those who are looking to deconstruct, dismantle, and redefine. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book.

About the Author

Claudia Alarco Alarco is an activist, thought leader, and agent of change with experience in the private, public, and non-profit sectors serving in the Obama White House, the Human Rights Campaign, and at the National Institutes of Health.

A proud native of Peru, Claudia received a multilingual and multicultural education throughout her upbringing in Latin America, the Caribbean, and the US.

She earned her bachelor’s degree in Political Science from Villanova University and received her European Politics Certification from the European School of Political and Social Sciences at l’Université Catholique de Lille in Northern France.

For more information, you can connect with Claudia at ClaudiaAlarcoAlarco.com

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheChangingFaceofPower and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Claudia

story:
Sibel Schick veröffentlicht ihr neues Buch

„Hallo, hört mich jemand?“ ist ein neues Buchprojekt von Sibel Schick. Es soll in Kürze in der edition assemblage erscheinen. Ihr könnt das Buch bereits vorbestellen auf euren Kanälen dafür werben.

 

Worum geht es in diesem Buch?

„Hallo, hört mich jemand?“ ist eine Sammlung aus den Kolumnen und Kommentaren Schicks über Rassismus, Klassismus, Sexismus, Identität und Sprache, geschrieben aus ihrer einzigartigen Innen-Außen-Perspektive, die in der deutschsprachigen Medienlandschaft zu kurz kommt. Wer Deutschland verstehen möchte, muss Sibel Schicks Buch lesen.

 

Wie kann ich das Buch schon jetzt bestellen?

Du kannst nebenan den roten Button klicken. Für 12 Euro erhälts du das Buch!

 

Wie viele Bestellungen werden benötigt?

Unser Ziel ist es, mindestens 330 Bücher (330 x 12 = 3.960 Euro) schon vor dem Druck zu verkaufen. Dann ist die Vorfinanzierung des Buches gesichert. 500 Euro sind da Minimum.
 

Wer ist Sibel Schick?

Sibel Schick ist 1985 in Antalya, Türkei, geboren und zog 2009 nach Deutschland. Sie arbeitet als Autorin, Redakteurin und Speakerin, und studiert Soziologie in Leipzig. Die Texte in diesem Buch schrieb Sibel Schick unter anderem für das Missy Magazine, taz, Spiegel und diverse andere Medien.

 

Stimmen zu dem Buch von Sibel Schick

„Sibel Schick legt alles auf den Tisch, was Deutschland gern verdrängen würde. Ihre Texte sind eine Mischung aus präziser Analyse, ehrlicher Wut und wunderschöner Poesie.“

Margarete Stokowski

 

„Es gibt derzeit niemanden, der die Deutschen so treffsicher auf die Palme bringt wie Sibel Schick.“

Leo Fischer

story:
The Story of Missing Pieces

Missing Pieces is a true story about childhood sexual abuse, the effects of leaving trauma unhealed, and finding the courage to fight for your life.

At ten years old, I realized that I was different. The way I interacted with others, or lack there of, was a struggle. At twenty-five, I found out why. I wanted to forget it, and I did... Or so I thought.

My name is Andi Hunt and I am the author of Missing Pieces. I wrote this book because I believe part of my journey in this lifetime is to help encourage others, like me, to persevere to get the help they need to feel whole again. This book actually became part of my pathway to finding peace, one paragraph at a time.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your ability to achieve healing, recovery, and peace. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to openly talk about sexual abuse, childhood abuse, trauma, PTSD, panic, anxiety, depression, suicide, and addiction. Use my story to open up a conversation with a friend or a family member who may need the encouragement to seek help. Something that I’m grateful to have finally managed, at forty-four years of age.

One reason I wrote this book is that I wanted to understand why I suffered for thirty-one years with depression, anxiety, and fear. The day I realized that no pill would fix me, and I couldn’t leave my house without having a panic attack, I decided that was enough. I was going to take my life back no matter what it took. I asked a friend for a referral to their therapist and made an appointment. That was the day I met my monster, face to face.

You will love this book if you love stories of victory and overcoming the odds, enjoy learning about other people’s journeys and the obstacles they faced and succeeded against. You will find yourself eager to learn how you can help encourage others to do their part to change the view of mental health in todays world.

Missing Pieces speaks to adults and teenagers who want to learn about mental health and how to achieve a peaceful state with the right counseling and daily practices.

Ultimately, I hope that Missing Pieces inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Why am I never enough?
  • Why do I have to hide this thing that happened to me or how I feel?
  • Why can’t I just be happy and go with the flow like them?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!
 

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I hope to ultimately publish this Winter 2021.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

Standard Tiers:
Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.
 

About the Author

Andi Hunt is an author with New Degree Press and a full-time Executive Recruiter. She believes in doing the right thing, interacting with everyone, and making people feel comfortable. Her passion is to encourage others to seek healing, no matter the age, which led her to write this book.

Andi is a no-frills country girl from a small town in Oklahoma. She never suspected that she would write a memoir about her life, and at one time thought she was nothing special. She asked herself, why would anyone want to read my book? This simply added to her sense of fear, guilt, and shame. Andi wouldn’t wish the things she’s gone through on anyone else. This is her story and she is the only one who has lived it, so why not her?

For more information, you can connect with Andi Hunt at andi.hunt.author@gmail.com and Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form Preorder a Copy of Missing Pieces (google.com) to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can contribute financially, and that's okay. Here are some ways you can still support me: 

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page. 

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #MissingPieces and tag me as well as my publisher, @newdegreepress, so we can help amplify your efforts. 

I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please share my book with five friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media. My social media handles are below: 

Tag:
Instagram - @andihunt_author
Facebook - @AndiHunt_Author
Twitter - @AndiHunt9 
LinkedIn - Andi Hunt
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Forever grateful, 
Andi Hunt

story:
Thank you!

Thank you to all that supported the pre-launch efforts to get Out To Lead ready for publishing! The book will come out in just a few short months, but please stay connected on social media via our Instagram @OutToLead! In the meantime, if you would like to purchase a book, schedule an author talk, or host a book launch near you please reach out via email at outtolead (at) gmail.com. 

------------

"For years I thought I had it all together. Then suddenly sitting there on those steps I looked out into the street full of people walking in and out of stores, out of the metro, simply going about their day-to-day without a care in the world and then I realized. I was lost, alone, and confused. The tremendous blow shook the world around me like one does a cheap souvenir snow glob you play with, but don't buy, at the airport gift shop just to pass the time between flights. I just sat there, numb, letting it all swirl and clash around me. Letting the rush of emotions enter and consume me in only the way a life-changing moment can. I couldn’t deny it anymore this was it, this was me, it had always been me and it was time to let him out." - Out To Lead. Fall 2021

 

Why I wrote Out To Lead

My name is Jonathan Dromgoole and I am the author of Out to Lead. My book is about resilience and leadership within the LGBTQ+ community, and the reasons why we are currently seeing a rise in LGBTQ+ leaders in all industries. 

LGBTQ+ people have always existed and played an influential role in society. So influential in fact that society wrote laws to exclude the community for centuries. I wrote this book because the LGBTQ+ community’s history needs to be shared. For so long our stories have often told and portrayed through the lens of someone else - someone who is usually straight - and it's important that we get to share our own stories. 

In reading this book, you will discover how LGBTQ+ leaders have overcome adversity throughout their lives to become the resilient and effective leaders we have begun to see. My hope for this book is that it will inspire future leaders, motivate allies to hire and support Queer individuals, and break down barriers with those who need to realize the value of people that identify as LGBTQ+. 

 

Out to Lead

The book is written in three parts...

Part 1 looks at the rise of queer rights and resilience focusing on the lack of LGBTQ+ history and what our community looked like before the concept of “pride.” It also looks at the first out LGBTQ+ elected official in the United States – no it wasn’t Harvey Milk. 

Part 2 looks deeper into the creation of queer resilience through personal stories and those from cultural, business, and political LGBTQ+ leaders. 

Part 3 focuses on the value of coming out and using your authentic voice. It also takes a step back to look at the diversity within the LGBTQ+ community and what comes next.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. The publisher set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021
  • The final cover design of my book. (What you’re currently seeing is just a mockup)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (there is more to it than I thought)
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication (which if you know me you already know how desperately I need this if you couldn’t tell already)
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall

 

With your help...
130 pre-sell copies = the paperback book gets published
150 pre-sell copies = an audiobook gets published 
200 pre-sell copies = the hardcover edition gets published 
The goal of the presale = getting the book published! 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • Exclusive opportunity to discuss your resume and leadership development.  I have done this for everyone from college applicants to Ambassadors.

 

And much more!

 

About the Author

Mexican-made, Texas-raised, & DC educated, Jonathan Dromgoole is a community leader focused on increasing representation for marginalized communities in policy & public service. He is a double first-generation graduate of Georgetown University (SFS ’16 & MPP ’19) and a graduate from UVA’s Sorensen Institute's Emerging Leaders Program. His professional & personal achievements have focused on social good & people-centered policies that enhance equity, uplift communities, and work towards progress from international to local activism.

 

Jonathan currently works for the Victory Institute where he focuses on making our federal government be more reflective of the diversity of our country as the Presidential Appointments Manager. Jonathan has worked with and advised Ambassadors, Secretaries, Vice-Presidents of multinational organizations, Senior Executives, Lawyers, Policy Makers, Elected Officials, Community Leaders, and recent College Graduates. He currently serves on various local & national partisan and non-partisan boards. Jonathan lives with his husband, Juan, and their two dogs in Northern Virginia.


For more information, you can connect with Jonathan at info@jonathandromgoole.com and at @OutToLead on Instagram

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #OutToLead and tag me, @jonathandromgoole as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.


We're here, we're queer, get used to it! 
Jonathan Dromgoole

story:
The Golden Thread: Where to Find Purpose in the Stages of Your Life

The book is a storied expose on how Purpose lives within us, and right in front of us. I wrote it because it is time for us all to contribute our Golden Thread to the tapestry of humanity. My book will publish in April, 2020.

Story of My Book

This book will dispel any notion that your life doesn’t matter. I’ll show you how your own nuanced one-of-a-kind Purpose is right there in front of you, waiting to be discovered, so you can listen to its whispers and let it guide you like a GPS to a more fulfilling and impactful life.  I'll also show how your nuanced Purpose shows up uniquely at different stages of life (related to Stage of Consciousness), which is part of why we can't see our Purpose so clearly.

Most people think or believe that:

  • Purpose is a job or career, or a passion, and that you usually figure it out as an adult, if at all.
  • Childhood wounding is bad, and prevents you from living a good life. 
  • We are “defined” at an early age, which becomes the identity our lives get stuck in.

BUT, based on my 30-plus years of research and in activating thousands of clients to “find themselves,” and then to live powerful, aligned lives guided by their deep Soul Purpose, I’ve come to witness that:

  • Purpose is the seed that guides us throughout our life.
  • Passions and curiosities are indicators of Purpose, and jobs and careers are expressions of Purpose, but they are not inherently our Purpose.

 

In this book, I’ll demonstrate how Purpose shows up in different parts of our lives through our unique expression.

Our childhood wounding is an indicator of Purpose, which we can use to uncover our Purpose as we explore and heal that wound. In this book, I’ll show why we’re required to do this “growing up”, and accomplish the developmental tasks at different stages of life, in order to fully express our Purpose.

Our Soul Purpose is evident at very early stages in life, as our soul pulls us in the direction of our longings. In this book, I’ll demonstrate how we sabotage that pull and limit our own evolution and purposeful expression. 

I’m Holly Woods, and I am the author of The Golden Thread. I was compelled to write this book after uncovering these patterns that debunked the myths about Purpose. 

Most people don’t think to “find themselves” until serious turmoil or trauma forces them to explore who they are, or later in life, as they experience a deep longing for more meaning. I wondered if it didn’t have to be that hard or come so late in life. So I put on my scientist hat and found a childhood pattern of extremely nuanced soul expression that was repeated over and over, like a “thread” throughout our lives. 

This Golden Thread is evident very early, and somehow we miss it.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you’ll discover where to look for the Golden Thread in your life stories. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same passion and excitement that I have for living my Purpose. And then ultimately, I want you to use this book as a tool to help you watch for and create a different trajectory for a life with more meaning, intention, and success.

In this book, you'll learn about how the GPS of your Purpose pulls you forward, and how it shows up distinctly over your life span. You’ll meet numerous former clients, a handful of colleagues and Purpose mentors and hear about the Golden Threads that run through their lives. These include:

Gregg Levoy, Author, former reporter and behavioral specialist at USA Today, whose explorations of the secret passageways of his grandfather’s house led him to have courage to step into the dark crevasses of his psyche to find his calling;

Tim Kelley, Author and Founder of the True Purpose Institute, whose childhood experiences caused him to have a loss of faith but ultimately led to his work to resolve intractable social problems around the globe; 

Agathe Daae-Qvale, a former tech consultant in Norway turned serial entrepreneur whose childhood desire to include strangers turned into several start-ups to aid the integration of immigrants into European countries;

And many other stories highlighting the early nuanced expression of Purpose and how it shows up over a lifetime.

You will love this book if you are someone who has been searching for your own Purpose and wondering why you can’t find it. Or maybe you want to read stories and be inspired by people who’ve learned to successfully live into their Purpose so you can learn from them. 

And especially if you want to contribute your greatest gifts in this time of crisis on the planet, this book is for you. 
.
The Golden Thread is a non-fiction book that speaks to Visionaries who want to execute their ideas, veteran Professionals who want to find more meaning in their career, Seekers who want to embody their spirituality, and Parents who want to help their children find their Purpose earlier than they did. It’s for anybody who is looking at finding their Soul Purpose and creating a life aligned with that.

 

The Golden Thread: Where to Find Purpose in the Stages of Your Life


The book is written in Three Parts.

Part One contains the Introduction and Chapters 1 and 2, and shows how Purpose shows up as the Golden Thread, guiding us forward. You’ll see how the thread has shown up in your life, and why you may have missed it. You’ll read about the science behind Purpose and how it can affect every area of your life, from health and well-being, job or career satisfaction, abundance and even organizational success.

Part Two contains Chapters 3-6. These Chapters go into detail about how Purpose shows up in different phases of life, starting with childhood through mature adult, using several frameworks to help you think about how Purpose may have shown up in those stages in your own life. You’ll see the Golden Threads of the book’s characters depicted across these stages.

Part Three contains Chapters 7-9. Here you’ll learn about what it means to live “on Purpose,” as the existence of living in flow and coming to know yourself newly, rather than the over-identified personality which creates most of the turmoil of our lives. We’ll discuss what the world needs now, and why living your own “why” matters most of all. You’ll get top-notch advice to start looking for your own Golden Thread so you can move into your Purpose adventure. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor that will work alongside me to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020.

  • The Cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

  • The Layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, Ebook formats).

  • The copyediting for my Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this spring of 2020.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

 


 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book.
  • Your Name will appear in a special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and other excerpts, with the opportunity to review and provide feedback.
  • The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • Invitation to a Golden Thread workshop (online and in select locations) where I will offer experiential opportunities to hear about people’s life stories and unpack the Golden Threads that live within them.
  • Select exercises to help you find your Golden Thread and live into it.
  • And more...

About the Author

My name is Holly Woods. I am the Founder/CEO of Holly Woods Coaching & Consulting, creator of the Purpose to TruePower™ Accelerated Program, the Aligned Business Blueprint™ and Purpose Aligned Business Design™. I earned a PhD in Human & Organizational Development, am a Master Integral Coach, Professional Facilitator, Master Energy Medicine Healer, am studied in the Stages of Consciousness.

I wrote this book because I was disillusioned by the sheer number of humans on the planet who live miserable meaningless lives, which seems directly related to the catastrophic condition of the planet. I was compelled to share about this Golden Thread to mobilize you to come home to yourself.

While I write about others in the book, my own life was the origin and anchor for this work. Most everything I learned came about because I was so stuck, screwed up, lost, depressed and suicidal, and had no idea how to find my way home. I began this long journey to freedom because I wanted to stay on the planet, and just knew I had something important to contribute. 

I want to help you find your most important gift, while you still have time to share it.

I grew up in Texas where I experienced vast contextual landscapes, spent 28 years in Colorado climbing numerous kinds of mountains, and have spent this last liberating phase in northern California. I have two adult daughters, love to hike, read, travel and dance. 

Thank you for your interest in this book, and any type of support at all that you wish to share.

For more information you can connect with me at HollyWoodsCoaching.com, HollyWoodsCoaching on Facebook, and https://www.linkedin.com/in/hollywoods/
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GoldenThread and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
  • Thank you so much for all of your love and support!



Thanks again,
Holly Woods PhD

Invitation to a Golden Thread workshop (online and in select locations) where I will offer experiential opportunities to hear about people’s life stories and unpack the Golden Threads that live within them.
Select exercises to help you find your Golden Thread and live into it.
And more...

About the Author
My name is Holly Woods. I am the Founder/CEO of Holly Woods Coaching & Consulting, creator of the Purpose to TruePower™ Accelerated Program, the Aligned Business Blueprint™ and Purpose Aligned Business Design™. I earned a PhD in Human & Organizational Development, am a Master Integral Coach, Professional Facilitator, Master Energy Medicine Healer, am studied in the Stages of Consciousness.I wrote this book because I was disillusioned by the sheer number of humans on the planet who live miserable meaningless lives, which seems directly related to the catastrophic condition of the planet. I was compelled to share about this Golden Thread to mobilize you to come home to yourself.While I write about others in the book, my own life was the origin and anchor for this work. Most everything I learned came about because I was so stuck, screwed up, lost, depressed and suicidal, and had no idea how to find my way home. I began this long journey to freedom because I wanted to stay on the planet, and just knew I had something important to contribute. I want to help you find your most important gift, while you still have time to share it.I grew up in Texas where I experienced vast contextual landscapes, spent 28 years in Colorado climbing numerous kinds of mountains, and have spent this last liberating phase in northern California. I have two adult daughters, love to hike, read, travel and dance. Thank you for your interest in this book, and any type of support at all that you wish to share.For more information you can connect with me at HollyWoodsCoaching.com, HollyWoodsCoaching on Facebook, and https://www.linkedin.com/in/hollywoods/ 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #GoldenThread and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,Holly Woods PhD

story:
La Spatula Clark, langue de cuisine  concept

La cuisine est un lieu du plaisir, de l'invention, du partage.

En revisitant la spatule de nos cuisines, la jeune designer Hélène Olive allie la technicité de cet incontournable ustensile au détournement poétique et drolatique qui en décale les habituelles caractéristiques.

La Spatula Clark arbore une insaisissable incongruité inventive : c'est une langue bleue et souple qui remue, mélange, tourne, étale, agite ou prélève au bout d'un manche tout aussi bleu et tendre.

L'objet est en silicone alimentaire. Sa souplesse et sa couleur inhabituelle en font une spatule unique dans la cuisine. Son nom rend un hommage teinté d'humour respectueux à la plus frenchie des chanteuses anglaises des années 70...


Spatula Clark, tongue of cooking   concept
The kitchen is a place of pleasure, invention, sharing.

By revisiting the spatula of our kitchens, the young designer Hélène Olive allies the technicality of this inescapable utensil to the poetic and funny gap which moves its usual characteristics.
Spatula Clark raises an imperceptible creative incongruity : it is a blue and soft tongue which stires, mixes, turns, spreads, shakes at the tip of a handle also blue and soft.

The object is made with food silicone. Its flexibility and its unusual color make a unique spatula in the kitchen. its name pays a tribute tinged with respectful humor to the most frenchie of the 70s' english singers...

 

 La Spatula Clark, langue de cuisine     technique

C'est une spatule cuillère en silicone alimentaire* souple résistant jusqu'à 425°.

Longueur : 29,5 cm. Largeur spatule : 5 cm. Largeur manche : 2 cm
Gravure dos du manche.
Couleur : Bleu caeruléum.
Conditionnement : sac tissu coton sérigraphié avec lien (32 x 10 cm).
Garantie : 1 an.

* le silicone alimentaire de brûle pas. Il ne raye pas les surfaces émaillées ni les revêtements des poêles, casseroles, sauteuses... Il n'absorbe pas les odeurs et est parfaitement hygiénique.

Spatula Clark, tongue of cooking Technics

  • It is a spatula/spoon in soft food silicone resistant until 425 °.Length: 29,5 cms. Width spatula: 5 cms. Width handle: 2 cms.

  • Engraving on back of the handle. Color: caeruléum blue. Packaging:cotton bag silk-screened with links (32 x 10 cms). Guarantee: 1 year
    The food silicone does not burn. It does not scratch enamelled surfaces nor the covers of frying pans, pans pans... It does not absorb the smells and is perfectly hygienic.


La Spatula Clark, langue de cuisine    qui ?

Une nouvelle collaboration qui réunit Smoll, petites opportunités des créations contemporaines animé par Brigit Meunier Bosch et la jeune designer et designer sonore  toulousaine Hélène Olive

                                                                    

Les installations et les objets d'Hélène Olive donnent aux matières sonore et tactile un rôle essentiel et singulier qui métamorphose définitivement la relation avec notre environnement proche, le fonctionnel, les animaux, la nourriture. 
Ce "design" sensible, curieux, exigeant et non dépourvu d'humour est une invitation originale et multiple à la rencontre de ce que nous sommes avec les autres.    

                                                                                                                                          

L'engagement de longue date pour la création contemporaine et les artistes est le socle de l'aventure artistique personnelle et professionnelle sans cesse renouvelée de Brigit Meunier Bosch. Des collaborations multiples et enrichissantes qui se sont concrétisées entre autres dans l'édition de livres contemporains d'artistes, la direction du BBB centre d 'art à Toulouse ou de l'école supérieure d'art de Dunkerque... Elle crée Smoll en septembre 2012.


Spatula Clark, tongue of cooking  Who ?
A new collaboration which gathers  Smoll, small opportunities of the contemporary creations managed by Brigit Meunier Bosch and the young designer and sound designer Hélène Olive

Installations, objects and Hélène Olive's spaces give to the sound material an essential and special role which definitively transforms our relation with our close enviromnent, fonctionnal objects, animals or food. This sensitive, curious, exigent "design", not lacking in humour, is an original and multiple invitation to the meeting of what we are with others. 

The long-time commitment for contemporary creation and artists is the base of Brigit Meunier Bosch's personal and professional artistic adventure. Multiple and enriching collaborations which became a reality among others in the edition(publishing) of contemporary artist's books, the management of the BBB, art center to Toulouse or the Art school of Dunkirk... She creates Smoll in September, 2012


La Spatula Clark, langue de cuisine  est une première "vraie" incursion dans l'édition design pourqui depuis deux ans, déploie un concept mobile, curieux et souple alliant la production et l'édition de multiples et d'oeuvres d'artistes et de créateurs et l'organisation d'événements "activateurs" pour leur diffusion .

Smoll est une toute petite entreprise en train de pousser qui prend ses repères en couveuse entrepreneuriale. Juste un bureau/atelier pas très loin de Toulouse. Pour le reste de l'énergie, des idées, des projets, des complicités, un site, des hôtes...

Avec le livre de cuisine radiophonique, édité en 10 exemplaires au printemps dernier par Smoll avec Hélène Olive, une rigoureuse boîte blanche cachait de savoureuses et baroques recettes narrées avec drôlerie par l'étonnante mamie de la designer.

Avec la Spatula Clark, c'est une nouvelle invitation à expérimenter votre cuisine ... 
         


Spatula Clark, tongue of cooking is a first "real" raid in the design edition for Smoll which since two years, deployes a mobile, curious and soft concept allying the production and the publishing of multiple and works of artists and creators and organization of "activating" events for their distribution.

Smoll is a small company which is growing in a business incubator. Just an office / studio not very far from Toulouse. For the rest : energy, ideas, projects, complicities, a website, hosts...

With the radio cookbook, published in 10 copies at the last spring by Smoll with Hélène Olive, a rigorous white box hid delicious and baroque recipies told with joke by the amazing grandma of the designer.

With Spatula Clark, it is a new invitation to experiment your cooking
         


 La Spatula Clark, langue de cuisine    quand et comment ?

Programmée pour  Mars 2015 l'édition de la Spatula Clark en 500 exemplaires fait l'objet aujourd'hui d'un appel à financement participatif . 
Véritable petite campagne filmique et sonore en trois volets pour mettre en ébullition la curiosité, l'enthousiasme et la participation évidemment...

A découvrir jusqu'au 25 janvier 2015 !!! Attention séquences cultes !!!


Spatula Clark, tongue of cooking When and how ?
Scheduled for Mars 2015, edition of Spatula Clark in 500 copies is today subjetc to a call for participative financing. Real small movie and sound campaign with three parts to put boiling curiosity, enthusiasm and participation obviously...

To discover until January 25nd, 2015!!! Watch it ! cult sketches!!!


 La Spatula Clark, langue de cuisine   7000€ pour quoi faire ?

7000€ ou 8750$ (pour faciliter les paiements en ligne par carte bancaire sans passer par Paypal le choix de cette devise est nécessaire).

La spatula est une marque française. Conçue par Hélène Olive, les prototypes du moule et de l'insert et les moules de fabrication sont fabriqués par TMI-2, EURL à Toulouse.
La production des 500 Spatulas et du packaging est réalisée artisanalement dans l'atelier de Smoll. 

C'est cette phase de fabrication et de production que vos contributions permettront de réaliser : prototypage, fabrication des moules et inserts, achat des matériaux (silicone, colorant, séchoir) et production des pièces.

Smoll finance la rémunération du créateur, le dépôt du modèle à l'iNPI, la conception et la fabrication du packaging de la Spatula Clark, le coût de la communication globale du projet.

La fondation Ecureuil pour l'Art contemporain à Toulouse est le partenaire privilégié de la réalisation des trois vidéos de la Spatula.



Spatula Clark, tongue of cooking 7000€ for what doing?
The spatula is a French brand. Designed by Hélène Olive, prototypes of the mold and the insert and the molds of manufacturing are made by TMI-2, enterprise from Toulouse. The studies of project were led with FabLab to Toulouse.The production of 500 Spatulas and packaging are made by craftsmen in the Smoll's studio

It's this phase of manufacturing and production that your contributions will allow to realize: manufacturing of molds, prototypage and inserts, purchase of materials (silicone, coloring, hairdryer) and production of pieces.

Smoll finances remuneration for the creator, the deposit of the model in the iNPI, design and manufacturing of the Spatula's packaging , and cost of the global communication of the project.

The Fondation Ecureuil for the contemporary Art in Toulouse is the privileged partner for the making of three videos of Spatula.


 Alors oui nous avons besoin de vous !

Parce que nous croyons que la poésie et la fantaisie riment avec création et innovation  et peuvent trouver naturellement leur place dans une cuisine.

Parce que nous soutenons l'idée que la création est à vivre avec intensité au quotidien. Un certain Robert Filliou l'a exprimé bien mieux que nous ("l'art, c'est ce qui rend la vie plus intéressante que l'art...")

Then yes we need you!

Because we believe that the poetry and the whim are rhyming with creation and innovation and can find naturally their place in a kitchen. 

Because we support the idea that creation is to be lived with intensity every day. Robert Filliou expressed it much better than we (" Art, it's what makes life more interesting than art ")


La Spatula Clark, langue de cuisine   nos contreparties
Les contreparties ne sont pas des ventes déguisées. Elles sont des récompenses "symboliques" pour votre soutien et votre encouragement, des petites traces sensibles de votre aide à la production de la Spatula, de votre complicité  effective à la réussite de ce projet original.

MERCI

Spatula Clark, tongue of cooking our perks
The perks are not disguised sales. They are "symbolic" awards)for your support and your encouragement, small sensitive tracks of your help to the production of the Spatula, your complicity for the success of this original project.

THANK YOU

story:
¿Qué?

El Rey Bufón es una novela que asienta su argumento sobre una base histórica, sin renunciar por ello a un ritmo trepidante y unas tramas llenas de diversión.

Aseguran las crónicas que el mítico rey de Tartessos, Arganthonio, vivió más allá de los 120 años de edad, y que esto fue posible tras robar una manzana a las Hespérides de su jardín al igual que hiciera el mismísimo Hércules en uno de sus doce trabajos. Pero los años pasaron y aquel rey poderoso se convirtió, a cambio de su longevidad, en un anciano decrépito.

El don de la longevidadacarreaba, además, asumir una maldición: Arganthonio sería el último rey de Tartessos y, a su muerte, el reino desaparecería con él. Apremiados por esta vieja leyenda los druidas de las diez tribus que conforman el reino deciden enviar a alguien para robar otra manzana del jardín de las Hespérides que le permita a Arganthonio vivir cien años más y, con ello, asegurar la pervivencia del reino. El elegido no es otro que el deforme bufón del rey, que será acompañado en tan incierto viaje por un inexperto druida.

 El viaje hacia el jardín de las Hespérides les llevará más allá de Gadir, enfrentándose a un imperio naciente, Cartago, que parece dispuesto a engullir Tartessos y sus codiciadas minas de plata.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Víctor Almazán.

Nace el autor, sin él proponérselo del todo, en el azaroso Madrid de la Transición, y por algún inexplicable apego continúa viviendo allí. Tras licenciarse en Ciencias de la Información y en Camarerología por el bar de la misma facultad, comienza a escribir guiones de largometraje (recibe premios del ICAA, TVE, Antena 3 y queda finalista del prestigioso Julio Alejandro de la SGAE).

Debido, quizás, a la extrema contaminación de la capital, decide alternar la escritura de guiones con la de novelas. Así, gana el premio Jaén de narrativa juvenil con La venganza de las cajas, el premio Literadura con Saqueadores de Miseria y queda finalista del premio Hislibris con el relato histórico La morisquilla.

Para sobrevivir, pues la vida en Madrid es cara, y también por una extraña vocación que sus biógrafos achacan sin dudarlo a los altos índices de arsénico en el agua potable de la capital, ha sido guionista de diversos programas de televisión, alguna que otra serie, copy —pero no paste— y catador de vino amateur.

Víctor Almazán desborda talento y oficio.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El Rey Bufón que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Víctor Almazán vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
story_txt:
¿Qué?El Rey Bufón es una novela que asienta su argumento sobre una base histórica, sin renunciar por ello a un ritmo trepidante y unas tramas llenas de diversión.

Aseguran
las crónicas que el mítico rey de Tartessos, Arganthonio, vivió más allá de los
120 años de edad, y que esto fue posible tras robar una manzana a las
Hespérides de su jardín al igual que hiciera el mismísimo Hércules en uno de
sus doce trabajos. Pero los años pasaron y aquel rey poderoso se convirtió, a
cambio de su longevidad, en un anciano decrépito. 
El
don de la longevidadacarreaba, además, asumir
una maldición: Arganthonio sería el último rey de Tartessos y, a su muerte, el
reino desaparecería con él. Apremiados por esta vieja leyenda los druidas de
las diez tribus que conforman el reino deciden enviar a alguien para robar otra
manzana del jardín de las Hespérides que le permita a Arganthonio vivir cien
años más y, con ello, asegurar la pervivencia del reino. El elegido no es otro
que el deforme bufón del rey, que será acompañado en tan incierto viaje por un inexperto
druida.
 El viaje hacia el jardín de las Hespérides les llevará más
allá de Gadir, enfrentándose a un imperio naciente, Cartago, que parece dispuesto
a engullir Tartessos y sus codiciadas minas de plata.

¿Quiénes?Tandaia es
 una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a 
autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes 
ideas como es el crowdfunding. De este modo eres tú, 
ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra 
que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro 
catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.Hoy te presentamos a Víctor Almazán.

Nace
el autor, sin él proponérselo del todo, en el azaroso Madrid de la Transición,
y por algún inexplicable apego continúa viviendo allí. Tras licenciarse en
Ciencias de la Información y en Camarerología por el bar de la misma facultad,
comienza a escribir guiones de largometraje (recibe premios del ICAA, TVE,
Antena 3 y queda finalista del prestigioso Julio Alejandro de la SGAE). 
Debido,
quizás, a la extrema contaminación de la capital, decide alternar la escritura
de guiones con la de novelas. Así, gana el premio Jaén de narrativa juvenil con
La venganza de las cajas, el premio
Literadura con Saqueadores de Miseria
y queda finalista del premio Hislibris con el relato histórico La morisquilla.
Para
sobrevivir, pues la vida en Madrid es cara, y también por una extraña vocación
que sus biógrafos achacan sin dudarlo a los altos índices de arsénico en el
agua potable de la capital, ha sido guionista de diversos programas de
televisión, alguna que otra serie, copy —pero no paste— y catador de vino amateur.

Víctor Almazán desborda talento y oficio.
¿Cómo?Para
 arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la 
cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con 
un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
